And then heat the cautery, the shape of which will come [is appropriate - contextually implied], and place it on the tooth and keep your hand there until the cautery cools; and do this several times, for the pain will be removed either on that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And it is necessary that, after the application of the cautery, the patient fill their mouth with good dung and hold it for an hour and then spit it out; and this is the manner of cauterization.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize with whichever extremity you wish, as best you can. 
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the cannula/tube:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of extrophulos/protrusions (likely referring to hemorrhoids).
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When protrusions/extrophulos are caused by phlegm and cold humors and do not respond to digestion by medicines, and you desire their gentle digestion, then you should heat a hollow cautery, the form of which is as follows, having two open ends so that the smoke may escape from the cautery through the other end, and place the heated cautery on the swelling/abscess once, and again if needed, until it reaches the core/depth of the swelling/abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the swelling/abscess is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the swelling/abscess, and then leave it for three days and place upon it cotton soaked in butter/ointment until what the fire has burned is removed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment, bandages/compresses, and cloths until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the cannula or cautery should be like this/as shown. (Likely referring to an accompanying illustration).
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter 23.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On cauterization of hoarseness of voice and constriction of breath/windpipe.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humors come upon the canal of the lung, and especially when this is accompanied by coldness of complexion, then it is necessary that the patient be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and afterwards cauterize him/her behind the root of the throat in the depressed/affected area. 
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful not to reach the throat with the cautery, nor burn his uvula/throat, but only a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize him/her with another cautery behind the joint of the neck on his/her last vertebra.  (Could also mean lowest vertebra - context unclear)
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And his/her cautery should be nail-shaped according to the preceding method.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat him/her with what was described previously until he/she is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On cauterization for lung disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When a cough and lung disease are caused by cold humors, and the patient does not have a fever or phthisis (tuberculosis), and it is a chronic illness, then cauterize him/her with two cauteries above the furcula (collarbone) in the depressed areas along the length and width; and with another cautery in the middle of the feet between the two ankle bones (malleoli); and the cautery should be nail-shaped according to the preceding method.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, perform your cauterization by puncturing with the cautery that is called "puncta," the form of which was described previously in the section on cauterization for ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And the punctures should be between each one (of the cauterizations? Perhaps referring to multiple punctures in the locations already mentioned); and afterwards treat him/her with the same medicine that was previously described until he/she is healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And the cautery should have three prongs because the cauterization is done with it: with one application, you can make three cauteries in this manner:
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On cauterization of the uvula, which is the tip of the little tongue (or soft palate).
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the tip of the uvula is dislocated because of slippery humors and is not stabilized at the time of its return from its dislocation until it is accustomed to returning to its place, and then by a small movement it is dislocated again so that it happens, as we have witnessed, then it is necessary that you first reduce the dislocation, and then the patient should be turned over on their back or on their left side; and then lift the uvula which is on the inner part of the soft palate to the upper parts with the fingers of your left hand, if the joint is dislocated to the inner parts.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then heat the cautery having two points; and this is its form:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	And then cauterize the uvula until it penetrates to the other side; and the figure of the cauterization will then have four cauterized points.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	and that is subtle according to the size of the probe/instrument; and this is its form:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes it is arranged according to this count and for that reason there are eight cauterizations.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	And then place cooked leeks with salt on the cauterization, and then have the patient lie still, and the limb should not be moved for some time until it is strengthened/healed.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	And if the dislocation is in the upper parts and this is done late, then cauterize over the muscle with a nail-shaped cautery or with many pointed cauteries, because the joint is strengthened and the moisture is removed and the patient is healed.
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De cauterizacio del stomac.	On cauterization of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When coldness and much moisture comes into the stomach, so that it deviates from its normal complexion and those [cold and moist humors] multiply and remain within it, and if you continue the methods of treatment and it is not strengthened, then it is necessary that the patient lie supine on his back, and extend his arms and his thighs, and then cauterize him with three cauteries: with one cautery under the feet by the length of a finger with a nail-shaped cautery, and with two cauteries on both sides of the cautery, so that a triangular cauterization pattern results; and keep them separated so that they are not touching, which would cause putrefaction/infection. 
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And the depth of the cautery should be two-thirds the thickness of the skin.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And the shape of the cautery should be according to this form without addition. And if you wish, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form; and this should be a cautery in the shape of a circle according to this form:
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	And let the stomach be cauterized by puncturing in someone who is afraid of this cautery [the large circular one]: that is, you mark points on the stomach as many as you want with a probe, and then cauterize it at those points with a cautery; and then treat it with the aforementioned treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	On cauterization of a cold liver.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	When pain occurs in the liver due to coldness or humidity or excessive wind, such that its normal complexion is thrown off by superfluous discharge, and the patient is treated with what we have said and does not recover, then the patient should lie on their back, with their neck raised, and you mark with a probe three cauteries in this form and this same size on the liver below the hypochondria, where one can perceive the lying position of the person.
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And let the space between each cautery be the width of a finger, and let the cautery [mark/incision] be the length of a straight body [of a date pit, according to other texts].
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not press your hand heavily with the cautery.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	And if the amount [of burnt flesh] that is adhered is half the size/thickness of a hazelnut shell, then add no more; and if the patient is standing on their feet; and if not standing, then they should be lying down, with their thighs extended and their arms raised.
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	And this is the shape of the cautery [mark]:
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible for you to cauterize these [points] with a bladed cautery, when you have subtlety and prudence in the art.
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	And be careful not to go too deep in the cauterization, only burn as much as a hazelnut shell’s thickness,  so that the entire area is cauterized and [the heat] reaches the intestines, because the shell is thin there; and know this. 
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the perforation of a liver abscess with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When a growth or abscess occurs in the liver and you want to know if that abscess is in the flesh of the liver or in its membrane, then if it is in the flesh of the liver, the patient will find [it] heavy and the pain will be sharp.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the membrane of the liver, the pain will be very sharp and sometimes it even tires the physicians who treat it.
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	Therefore, it is necessary that the patient be turned on his neck/back; then probe the location of the abscess with a probe/instrument; then ignite the cautery which is shaped like a radish, the form of which has been shown in the previous page.
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	And cauterize with that cautery until all the diseased matter is burned, until it reaches the diaphragm, until healthy blood comes out.
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with the treatment for other abscesses until it is healed.
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And this type of cautery should only be used by one whose study in the art of medicine is extensive, and in whose hands many illnesses have been treated;  but even with experience, one should rarely be bold with this operation, but rather leave it to us [experienced physicians], and that is better. 
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On Cauterization of Pleurisy.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancients said that cautery with the roots of birthwort for cold pleurisy should be done in this manner: you take one dried root of long birthwort, as long as can be found, and the thickness of a finger.
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	Then submerge it in oil and dry it by the fire, and then cauterize with a cautery in the place which is between the joining of the collarbone and the neck; and with two small cauteries placed below [the first cautery], angled slightly towards the area below the chin; and with two cauteries in the area sloping between the fifth and sixth ribs, angled slightly towards the back; and with another cautery in the middle of the foot; and with another on the stomach; and with three cauteries on the back; and with one cautery in the place between the two shoulders; and with two cauteries on the two sides of the foot, below the cautery which is between the two shoulders.
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	And it is not necessary to squeeze your hand with the cautery, rather let it be held loosely in the hand.
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	And some of the ancients have said that some men use an iron cautery resembling a ray, and ignite it, and place it in the area between the ribs, until they reach the abscess with it and pus is drawn out, as we have said concerning abscess of the liver. 
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	But this perforation with a cautery is not without danger, for one may die immediately or a fistula may develop in that place which cannot be healed.
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	On cauterization of the spleen.
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When you treat the disease of the spleen with what we have said about its treatment in the section [on diseases] and your treatment is not effective, then cauterization is done in three ways, all of which are direct, one of which is that you make three or four cauterizations in a line along the length of the spleen, following the pattern of the cauterizations of the liver, the figure of which has preceded [this chapter].
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And let the space between each cauterization be the width of a finger or a little more, and the manner of cauterization be the same as we have described for the cauterization of the liver.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not press your hand with the cautery; and the patient should lie on his back. 
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	And there is another way to cauterize, which is that you ignite the cautery having two openings, as we have described in the chapter on muscle dislocation, and lift the rib cage which is next to the spleen where it may be according to the position of the patient on their left side.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And the lifting motion with which you raise the rib cage should be along the length of the body, so that the cauterizations are made along the width of the body.
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	And then insert the two openings, very hot, into that space, so that with them you penetrate the rib cage from the other side.
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	And then remove the cautery; and thus four cauterizations are made.
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	And if you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three openings.
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	And then you treat the cauterized area after it has stopped emitting sparks for several days, because this is more important than the other preceding steps in the treatment.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	On Cauterization for Dropsy (or Edema).
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	Cauterization is not used in general dropsy/edema, but only in ascites specifically.
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	When you treat the dropsical/edematous patient with the methods of treatment that we have mentioned in the division/chapter and your treatment is not effective, then it is necessary that you cauterize him/her with four cauteries around the navel and with one cautery on the stomach, and with another cautery on the liver, and with another cautery on the spleen, and with two cauteries between the vertebrae/spine of the back, and one cautery on the right foot, and with another cautery on the stomach.
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	And the amount of depth of the cautery should be proportional to the thickness of the skin.
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	And then leave the cautery wound open so that it drains fluid for a long time.
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	And do not stop the patient's treatment soon after the cauterization with the necessary procedures, so that two intentions/purposes can be added to it, and healing will be hastened for him with assistance/help.
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	The shape of the cautery with which the abdomen is cauterized should be nail-shaped according to the form of that which is described above, and the one with which the back is cauterized should be olive-shaped according to its preceding form/description.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	On cauterization of the feet and thighs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are abscessed/swollen in dropsy and are filled with serous/citrine fluid, it is necessary that you cauterize the feet on the top of the foot in the space between the little toe and the ring toe. And lift your hand with the cautery and do not twist it; then lift your hand and do not remove it entirely, because the serous/citrine fluid will drain out.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery is of this shape [likely refers to an accompanying image]: And then make two cauterizations on both thighs, and on each thigh the cauterization should be made with the tip of a knife-shaped cautery.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	And the cauterization should be along the length of the thigh: one above the knee and the other below the middle of the thigh; and two cauterizations on each thigh.  (So a total of four, two on each thigh).
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	And leave the wound open without dressing it for a long time so that any fluid may drain out of it.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then treat it with those things which we have mentioned.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On cauterization of the abdomen/belly. (Literally "body of the belly")
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	When the abdomen, due to cold and humidity within, weakens the faculties—namely the digestive and retentive faculties, which are in the stomach and intestines—and this is treated with the usual methods of treatment and they do not help, and sometimes the patient, tolerating cautery, shows improvement, then cauterize him with a large cautery on his stomach as described previously in the cauterization of the stomach, with the circular cautery and with four subtle cauteries around the navel, with a subtle nail-shaped cautery; and with a cautery on the hip over the large trochanter, or with two cauteries.
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	And if you sometimes see excessive humidity and the patient tolerates it, then cauterize him on the pubis and over the intestines, and very lightly apply two cauteries on the stomach and near the groins, for it is a complete curative treatment with which you will not err.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	On cauterization of old hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When there are, in the posterior, old hemorrhoids of a nature consisting of thick cold humors or corrupted humidities, and they are treated with what we have said in the section [on hemorrhoids] and your treatment is not effective, then cauterize with three cauteries on the bone below the two small vertebrae and the small triangular one, and with a cautery above the navel down two fingers [widths].
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if you suspect that his stomach is cold and his food is not digested, and his face appears pale/sickly, then cauterize him on the stomach with a large cautery as described previously; and with one cautery on the liver, and with another cautery on his spleen with a nail-shaped cautery, and leave the cautery open for some time, and then treat him until he is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	On cauterization for fistulas after their excision.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you excise a fistula, then you should heat the cautery that is shaped like a spoke/ray.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Then insert that heated [cautery] into the excised fistula, and guide it with your hand until the cautery reaches the opening of the vein from which the blood comes.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, for if there are many such [fistulas], then cauterize each of them as we have described, and then treat them with the ointments you deem appropriate until they are healed.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	And if you cauterize with a large cautery over some area, it is slower in healing.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	On cauterization of fistulas that are located in the posterior of the body in the lower parts.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	When the [usual treatment/nature] doesn't respond to the procedure we have described in its place, and the patient is frightened by this, let it be treated with cautery.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when someone has a fistula in the posterior, and it is old, with decaying sanies (pus) and corrupted moisture, then what is most necessary is to probe it with a thin probe, and then determine the extent of its depth with the aforementioned probe.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then heat the cautery that is ray-shaped (or like a spoke).
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	And then insert this heated cautery into the fistula, according to the depth to which you inserted the probe.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And repeat [inserting] the cautery into it until the corrupted flesh is burned, either one or two or three times, according to the extent of your need.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	And beware of burning a nerve or a vein; or if the fistula goes to the body of the bladder or to the body of the intestine, then beware of all those places; and do not do this unless the fistula is in a fleshy place and you think it is not penetrating [deeply].
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area until it is healed.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the area is sealed, and the infected matter is cut away from it, and remains so for a long time, then know that it is already completely healed.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the infected matter is not removed from it, then know that it is penetrating either into the depth of the bone where it is corrupted, or that this [condition] is caused by things which will be discussed in their [proper] place.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	On cauterization of the kidneys/loins. (The word "ronhos" likely refers to the lumbar region, commonly referred to as the kidneys in older medical texts.)
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When pain occurs in the loins/kidneys due to cold or excessive flatulence, and because of this the patient's side is numb, then it is necessary that you cauterize him on the loins/kidneys with a cautery on each kidney/loin with a nail-shaped cautery, which was mentioned previously.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And very lightly cauterize with the second one a little below, so that there will be three cauterizations in a line, and thus they will be more helpful in healing.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	On cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When weakness and softening occur in the bladder due to cold and humidity, such that the patient cannot retain urine, then cauterize him in the lowest part above the bladder, where the pubic hair begins, and cauterize with one cautery on his right side, and with another on his left.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And let the length of each cauterization be according to the size of the patient's finger's width; and cauterize him with a cautery on the lowest part of the back, or with two cauteries if necessary. 
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And let the cautery be nail-shaped as described previously.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	On cauterization of the uterus/womb.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When coldness and humidity occur in the uterus, and therefore pregnancy is prevented, and the menses are corrupted, and their onset is delayed, and pain occurs before their arrival, then the area should be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel, as we have said regarding cauterization of the bladder; and with a cautery on the area lowest on the back, or with two cauteries, and the cautery should be nail-shaped.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On cauterization for dislocation of the hip.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When mucous humidities infiltrate the hip area, and cause it to become dislocated, a sign of this is that one thigh is longer than the other when they are compared.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is found where it bulges.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then it is necessary to cauterize the patient on the area of his hip with a circular cautery, after you have marked with ink the circumference of the area as it is swollen, so that the affected part falls in the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And use the cautery whose form was previously described for cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not available to you, then cauterize it with three cauteries using a large olive-shaped cautery.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And the cauterization should be done according to the thickness of the entire swelling/growth; and then treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On cauterization of the sciatic vein/nerve.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the hip area, and it is caused by cold and humidity, and the patient is treated with what we have said and it does not help, and this treatment is outdated, then you must purge the patient of gross humors with foul-smelling pills or with artificial or similar pills; and then cauterize him.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the method of cauterization in this case is of two kinds: either cauterization with burning medicines, or cauterization with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	It will be according to two known methods, one of which is that you cauterize him on the area of his hip with three triangular cauteries in this way; and make a good depth with them.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the space which is between each cautery be the amount of the thickness of a finger, whether the cautery is olive-shaped or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	But sometimes the cautery is placed over the middle part, on the head of the hip, for which there are four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, cauterize with the circle, the form of which is described in the cauterization for dislocation of the hip, where the circle should be continuous and burn around the thickness of the entire thigh. 
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the manner of cautery in sciatica when the pain is located in the hip and does not extend down to the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it extends down to the thigh, then cauterize it with two cauteries on the thigh over the place where the patient feels the pain; and with one cautery on the ankle about four fingers below the outside part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if you use a knife-shaped cautery, the depth of the cauterization should be according to the thickness of the thigh.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the patient feels that the pain extends down to the area near the toes, then cauterize him there where he feels it with a cautery, making three points or four or more if needed.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient feels pain below the knee towards the thigh, then cauterize him there with a knife-shaped cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And be careful in all cauterizations not to go so deep with the cautery that you burn a nerve or a large artery, and thereby cause the patient harm or contraction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have seen some of those who cauterized on the ankle and went too deep in the cauterization, and the leg became so swollen that the swelling reached the foot, and the whole foot was perforated and corrupted.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then severe diarrhea occurred, and soon after, death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two places together, cauterize each one according to this method.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And some wise men have said regarding cauterization of the hip, a cautery of which this is the manner: make a circle of iron, the circumference of which is half a palm; and let its opening be the size of a date pit or a little less.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And inside that circle let there be another third; and let the space between them be the size of a finger joint; and let these circles be open in two places; and let the length of these cases be a joint or two joints, and make in them an iron mark decently fitted within the circles; and this is its form/shape:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then it should be heated in the fire until it glows red and emits sparks, and then it should be placed on the part of the hip, with the patient lying on their healthy side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And then cauterize that with three round cauteries at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it for three days; then plaster it with a poultice and leave the wound open for many days; and then treat it with ointments until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Albucasis says: Oh, sons, we have used this type of cautery little because of the fear of its appearance, and because we have found few who look upon it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	But it is among the best cauteries for those who have tolerated it, and it finds its place with them.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	But cautery with burning medicines is when you make two circles having a perforated handle in which they hold the bolt of the iron door; let the length of the walls in their height be two nuts or about that. 
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And let the space between each one be the width of a finger; and let them be open below and above, and let them contain themselves between each other in this manner:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	Then place it on the part of the hip [with] the patient lying on his side, and press your hand on the part of the hip; then take hot water and pour it between the two circles, and let its quality be with the fire little by little, and keep it [there] for the amount of one hour, and let the patient endure the biting and the burning of it — for it produces a biting like that of fire — until the biting ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	Then lift your hand with the instrument and wipe the hot water from the whole hip with fresh water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then leave it for three days and place lint on it until the blackness of the burn is removed, and leave it for some days, and pus will run from it; this is latest in improvement/healing.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then treat it with ointments until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain extends into the thigh or the leg, make him a bath in which he soaks in water just as is done in the hip bath likewise. 
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the method of the hot water bath, and I have already written about it in the treatise on the correction of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Take one part each of alkali and unslaked lime, crush them and place them in a new pot, the bottom of which should be perforated by a small hole, according to the size of the ray (fish?). / according to the amount that fits within the ray.  (This line is tricky -  "ray" could refer to a fish, a beam of light, a measurement, or something else. Context might help clarify.)
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And place another glazed pot beneath the bottom of the first pot, and pour fresh water over the alkali and quicklime, covering them by a finger's breadth. Then compress these with your hand, pressing firmly, and let the pot drip the sharp water into the glazed pot below.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	Then collect all that water, and pour it over more fresh quicklime and alkali, for it will then become very strongly acrid, which is used in many medical operations and in cauterizing other limbs, because it acts like fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And there are some medicines with which a burn may also be cauterized, such as Armenian wormwood, anacardic honey (or cashew honey), and lime with soap, mixed together.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And Galien recounts the operation and treatment of an ancient man with which pain of the hip and sciatic nerve is cured, and highly praises its effectiveness, saying that no other treatment is needed, and that it is healed by a single application, as he relates, because the man entered a bath very quickly, and thus was already cured of it.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And take fresh spurge, and if fresh is not found, take a fresh fig; and mash it well with a little grease and place it on the hip where the pain is, or on the thigh, or on the leg, and bind it.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And leave it for the duration of three hours or for the amount of time that the patient feels relief from the burning sensation.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then place him in a bath, and when his body is reddened, place him in the sun, because the pain ceases and he is healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And know that one should not use a cautery with these medicines except after the bowels have been evacuated.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	But, Escorides [Dioscorides] said that when the styptic vein is cauterized with goat dung, it benefits the patient; and the cautery should be with it in this manner: take wool and soak it in old oil, and place it between the arch of the foot and the ankle.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take dry goat dung and ignite it with fire until it becomes charcoal; and then place it on the wool and leave it there until it is extinguished.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat this, and do not cease doing this until the sensation of the burning reaches the hip and the pain subsides.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this type of cautery is called cautery of cows (or cautery of oxen).
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	On cauterization for back pain.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Sometimes pain is in the back from several causes, such as a fall or a blow, or excessive evacuation, and from similar causes, by the influx of cold and moist matter.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And cautery is not appropriate except in this one type, which is caused by an outpouring of cold material (or humor).
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	Therefore, after purging the patient with fetid pills and the like, it is necessary to make three lines along the width of the back where the pain is located, then mark with ink where to apply five or more cauteries on each line, according to the patient's tolerance and strength.
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	And the cauterization should be done with a pointed cautery.
E si vols, cauteriza am tres cauteris o am quatre am cauteri clavilh medial segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, cauterize with three or four cauteries of a medium nail shape, in this way:
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On cauterization at the beginning of kyphosis/humpback. (Gilbositat likely refers to a hump or curvature of the spine.)
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	This disease often happens to young children; and a sign of its beginning in children is that it occurs with tightness in the spine along with elevation and movement (of the spine/back).
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And you will find on the last vertebra of the back and its joints that it already begins to protrude over the other vertebrae.
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	And so when you see this and want to prevent it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery according to this shape:
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	The cautery should cover the entire part of the vertebra equally.
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	And if you wish, cauterize two or three lines in the circumference of the vertebra with the pointed cautery.
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	And let the points be close to each other.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat am aquo que havem dit.	And then treat the area until it is healed with what we have said. 
Mays guarda que cauteri no sia administrat en gelbositat que sia fayta per spasme de nervi.	But be careful that cautery is not administered on a swelling caused by a nerve spasm.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On cauterization of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pains are caused by cold humors, which infiltrate every part of the body, then when pain comes to the feet, it is customary for doctors to call this gout specifically/properly.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And so when gout is treated as a cold ailment with the appropriate methods and the pains do not subside, then cautery remains (as a treatment option).
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	And you should cauterize (the patient) near the evacuation point in the area around the foot joint with many cauterizations.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And it should be an olive-shaped cautery, of which this is the form:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary that points be made on the surface of the foot, then do it with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	And if the pains rise up to the knees or other joints, and this happens many times, then cauterize the patient on each painful spot with three or four cauterizations on all sides with this olive-shaped cautery.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	And if you need many cauterizations, then cauterize the area but don't press your hand too hard with the cautery; rather, [the burn] should only be about the thickness of a string/cord.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	And if the pains rise up into one or two knees, then administer the cautery which we have discussed in its chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pains are only in the hands, and it is called chiragra/gout of the hand, then puncture around the wrists as they turn, puncture in those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if pain remains in the said fingers, then puncture around the wrists on each knuckle and on the back of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	And if the pains rise after a few days to the elbows or the muscles, then cauterize each of these with the aid of assistance [i.e., helpers/instruments].
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And do not neglect the patient's good regimen and the taking of medicines, for if a good regimen is followed and phlegm is evacuated with this cautery, they will be healed, God willing. 
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On cauterization of ruptures/hernias. (The word "rompeduras" suggests something broken or ruptured, thus hernias fits the surgical context.)
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When a rupture occurs in the groins, with the intestines descending before the bandage to the genitals, and this is a recent onset, then you must order the patient to stop eating on that day and to use softening/laxative things so that the tear/opening in their belly descends.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And then hold the patient between your hands, supporting them on their back, and tell them to hold their breath until it is completely exhaled or the bandage or intestines appear. 
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And then return/replace it (the hernia/intestines) with your fingers and mark with ink the rupture above the pubic bone with a mark whose extremity should be similar to a half-circle on the upper parts of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then heat the cautery, of which this is its shape:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it is very red and throws off sparks.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	And then return the intestine or the hernia to its cavity, and then place your hand over the place so that the intestine does not come out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	And you have already opened (the space) between the patient's thighs and placed a cushion there, and another assistant should be on his legs, and another on his chest, who holds his hands. (Or potentially "on his feet," depending on the precise meaning of "pietz," which could mean feet or chest in some medieval contexts).
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And then place the cautery on that mark with your hand, with the cautery held straight, and keep it there until you reach the bone of the pubis to the middle of the finger; and repeat this another time if you have not reached the bone on the first try.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And carefully watch the protruding intestine at the time of your cauterization, so that you do not burn that intestine, lest death or other great harm come upon the patient. 
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you do not reach the bone with the cautery, your operation will not be successful / you will not have achieved your goal.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And it is necessary that the cautery for children be small according to their size and dimensions.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And then treat the cauterized area for three days with ointment until the burn scab is removed/falls off.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with the other ointments until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient should lie on their back for forty days until the area and the wound are sealed/closed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And it is necessary that you adjust his nourishment according to the length of his treatment, which cleanses his bowels, and so that the intestine does not protrude due to the strain of healing. 
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And then when he wants to get up after about forty days, apply a properly made bandage, and keep it on for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And he should be spared from work and from excess of food and drink, and from loud speech, for when he follows this regimen, he will be completely healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And I will describe the treatment of ruptures in the other parts of the belly, and this at the beginning, and if you wish them not to recur, then cauterize that rupture with a round cautery according to its size, and let that which is excised from the swelling be about a third of it; and then treat it with what we have said, and it will not return.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And some earlier [physicians] said that a rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery in this manner, after it is marked with a probe:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	and a line is placed across the width on the highest side of the rupture, and another line above; and place your hand with a nail-shaped cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	On the cauterization of torsion/testicle pain. (Torcio can refer to twisting, which could relate to a hernia or testicular torsion.)
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain occurs in any limb due to a fall or a blow, and that pain persists for a long time and you cannot achieve a cure with medicines, then it is necessary that you cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the cautery should be applied to the whole limb according to its size, its smallness, its strength, its weakness, the location of the torsion/pain, and the degree of pain.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore, if it is healed by the first cauterization, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cauterization; for it is customary in these pains that the limb be punctured, from that limb to the one that is near it, so it is necessary that you follow these with the cautery until the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Lepers are sometimes [treated] with cautery with very great benefit, and especially if the type of leprosy is caused by putrefaction of phlegm and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And so when you want to cauterize that one, consider if the leprosy is advanced and you have treated it with what we have said in the division and it doesn't diminish, nor stop, and you fear that the corruption will take over the patient's whole body and their entire constitution, then cauterize him on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and the second a little below it, near the forehead at the hairline; and two on the temples; and one behind, on the nape of the neck. 
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finally, press your hand with the cautery a little so that it makes a small impression on the bone, and the scabs are removed from it, so that the expiration of thick vapors is relieved from him; and cauterize over the spleen according to what is needed/prescribed.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy has already spread over the patient and appears manifestly, then you must cauterize him with those cauteries which we have mentioned on the head; and with a cautery on the tip of the nose, and with two cauteries on the two cheeks, and with two cauteries on two vertebrae of the neck, and with six cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, and with a large one on the vertebrae near the tailbone, and one on the tailbone, and with two on the hips, and with one on each hip, and with two on the knees and one on each knee, and with two on the elbows, and with two on the muscles, and with two on the palms of his feet; and cauterize him on all the joints of the fingers and toes, and on each heel of his feet, and on the wrists of his hands.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And beware of the nerves that are on the heel so that you don't burn them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes it is cauterized with one cautery on the pubic bone and with another on the pit of the stomach, and another on the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that the more cauteries you apply, the more helpful and beneficial it is; and know that the patient does not feel pain from the cautery, as healthy people do, because his body is already numb.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And the cauteries must be large or small depending on the limbs and joints according to what was previously described regarding the types of instruments.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the cauterized area with cooked chickpea flour mixed with honey and the other treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On Cauterization for Numbness/Stupor.  (Or, Cauterization in the Case of Stupor)
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a limb is numb or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and is not healed, then you cauterize that numb limb with cauteries according to the size of the limb, whether large or small.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery penetrate a little into the thickness of the skin. (The word "codena" likely refers to skin or flesh)
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes numbness, which occurs in the hands and feet, and in the vertebrae of the back near the exits of the nerves which move that limb, is cauterized, and the numbness is removed.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But no one should presume to do this except someone who is knowledgeable in the anatomy of the limbs and the paths of the nerves moving throughout the entire body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On cauterization of morphea, which is albaras (likely a skin condition, possibly vitiligo or another form of discoloration).
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When albaras (morphea) is old and you can't treat it with any medicinal ointments, then you cauterize it with a pointed cautery, lightly, according to the size of the affected skin area, until the whiteness and discoloration are removed, and its color is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with a mixture of chickpea and lentil flour, rose oil, arnica leaves, and either pigeon blood or swallow blood, one part of each all mixed together.  Then spread this on a cloth and place it on the affected area until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter 50.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the cauterization of cancer.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When a cancer is beginning and you want to remove it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery around its circumference, just as it is circumscribed.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the scholars said that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle; but I have not seen this, for I fear it may ulcerate, and I have already seen this happen several times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is more correct that it be cauterized around its circumference with a circle as we have said, or with many cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51. (Roman numerals LI)
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On the cauterization of swelling/tumor. (The word "adubilati" likely refers to a swelling, tumor, or possibly an abscess.  The "-ati" ending suggests a plural form, but the context implies a singular concept.)
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When a swelling is slow in ripening/maturing, and this is due to the superfluity causing it, or due to the patient's age, because he is old and decrepit, with little blood, or because of the weather/season, and you want to hasten the ripening/maturing of the swelling; then cauterize around its circumference with many small pointed cauteries; and then leave it, for it will hasten its maturation.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	But if you want to perforate it with a cautery, then you heat the cautery, of which this is the form/shape: and place it in the middle of the swelling until it penetrates the skin/membrane. (The word "codena" likely means skin, membrane, or a layer of tissue.)
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery [is applied] in the place that is lower/dependent, so that the arm's body may be relieved/drained; then treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On Cauterization with Corrosives/Caustics.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	A corrosive/caustic is an ulcer spreading in the limb, which corrodes/eats away at it like fire consuming dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see this corrosive ulcer in a place that tolerates cauterization with fire, then you should ignite small pointed cauteries, as many as is appropriate for the place where the corrosive ulcer is located.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize it all around until you eradicate all of the corrosion and no trace of it remains.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.
