And then leave it for three days, and place over the cauterized areas a dressing soaked in mixed oil until the scabs are all removed/have fallen off along with all the infection/corrosion.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then treat it with ointments that promote flesh/tissue growth.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days you see that healthy flesh grows where there is no more infection, it is good; but if not, then repeat the cauterization on what remains in the infected places.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And a corrosive agent is sometimes medicated with a sharp/strong medicine, because that is used in place of a cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But nevertheless cautery with fire provides the easiest/quickest relief.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already described the treatment with sharp/strong medicine in the section/chapter (on it), so take that when you need it for him/her.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On cauterization of nails and other similar (things/ailments).
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many times an ailment called a corn/nail occurs on the parts under the foot, and it is a large, deep-seated cause which hurts the foot; and cautery on these is of two kinds, that is, cautery with fire and cautery with hot water. 
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	But cautery with fire is that you heat a concave cautery similar to a vulture's feather, which should be made of iron according to the size which entirely contains the nail/corn, and it should have thin edges/margins.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then place that heated (cautery) on the nail/corn, and then turn your hand with the cautery around the nail/corn until the cautery reaches the depth of the nail/corn.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave that for three days until it begins to throw off/expel pus.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And then plaster it with wild mallows crushed with salt, and leave the plaster on it for one night, for it will be eradicated from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with a flesh-generating ointment until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it doesn't heal, and many times this happens on the surface of the body, especially on the hands and feet, then you must administer in those (places) cautery with water, and that is that you take a small tube of copper or iron or a vulture's feather, and place it on the nail/corn; and then pour a small amount of hot water into the tube, and keep your hand (there), and you turn it with the pressure of your hand completely, and let the edge of the tube be pressed into the root of the nail/corn, and the hot water will find a way to the depth of the root of the nail/corn; and let the patient wait a bit, for the burning of the hot water for an hour, and then remove it, for the nail/corn with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And do this with those, and then with the next one until you come to all of them that are in the body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And then treat them, after the roots of the nails/corns are eradicated, with those ointments which generate flesh.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter 54.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On cauterization of tremor/shivering/shaking.  (Likely referring to a treatment for tremors or shivering)
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When someone experiences tremors due to cold in the nerves or from a fever caused by cold, or for other similar reasons, then you must cauterize them with four or five cauteries on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with one cauterie; and with a cauterie on their feet, and on their stomach, with an olive-shaped cauterie.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And their tremor will subside and their recovery from the cold illness will hasten.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On cauterization for white spots/patches appearing on the body. ( *Albati* likely refers to some kind of skin discoloration or lesion perceived as white.)
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When white spots/patches appear on the body, and there are cracked pustules which are made of gross corrupted matter; then it is necessary at the onset of their appearance, that each head of the fistula be cauterized with a fine cautery made of myrtle wood, the tip of which is ignited with fire; or with the roots of long birthwort (*Aristolochia longa*); or with a lentil-shaped cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes cautery is also appropriate at the beginning of its expulsion in this manner; and they [the pustules/lesions?] are not believed [understood?], and the superfluity making them is broken up, and heals from them.  (This sentence is a little unclear; the meaning of "cregudas" in this context is uncertain.)
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	But it is necessary that this be done after evacuation by phlebotomy (blood-letting).
Capitol lvi.	Chapter 56.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On cauterization of blood flow occurring from the incision of an artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Too often there occurs a flow from an artery that is incised below the wound which happens deeply, or from the incision of abscesses or cautery of the limb, and other similar things, and it is difficult to remedy this.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when this happens to someone, then you should quickly cover the opening of the artery with your hand, and place your finger on it, pressing it strongly many times until the flow of blood is stopped beneath your finger, and so that it does not come out. 
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then put in the fire several small and large olive-shaped cauteries, in great number, and blow on them until they are very hot.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take one of them, small or large depending on the location and the wound in which the artery is ruptured, and quickly, after you have removed your finger, apply the cautery on that vein until the blood is burned and stopped.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood spurts from the opening of the artery when you remove your finger and apply the cautery, then quickly take another cautery from those that are prepared in the fire, and continue to do this one after the other until the blood is stopped. 
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful not to burn the nerve that is there, and that another injury comes upon the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when blood flows from the artery, then it is not possible to stop the bleeding in those, especially when the artery is large, except in one of four ways: either with a cautery as we have said, or by extraction when it is not extracted, because when it is extracted its ends are better cauterized and the blood is stopped, or that it be tied with thread or with a ligature by tight constriction, or that medicines whose virtue is to stop blood be placed on it; and they should be pressed with a cushion with decent constriction. 
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers proper constriction either with ligature and tight bandages or by applying burning substances and similar things, he won't do anything but cause delay.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the doctor is not present nor medicine, then gently press with the index finger on the opening of that vein as we have said, and apply great pressure until the bleeding stops from the upper part of the wound, and do not remove the finger from over the artery; and sprinkle very cold water on the artery until the blood congeals and thickens; and it is better to sew than needing cautery or medicine.
Comensa la segonda partida.	The second part begins. 
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incisions and perforations and cupping glasses and of phlebotomy (blood-letting) and of wounds and similar things.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis (Abu al-Qasim al-Zahrawi).
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already discussed in the first chapter every disease in which cauterization with fire and with burning medicine is appropriate, and the occasions and causes of it, and the necessary instruments with the forms of the cauteries; and I have ordered the chapters from the top of the head down to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter in the same manner, so that the one seeking this may be helped, then, concerning that which he has asked.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before I begin this, it is necessary, son, that you learn that what is in this chapter is, by means of terror, that which is in the first chapter on cauterization. 
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because great caution is required, for in the operations which are in this chapter many times there is evacuation which is with blood, with which is life, either through the opening of a vein or incision over an abscess or opening of a fistula or cleaning of a wound or extraction of an arrow or incision for a stone and things similar to them.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And all of these are accompanied by fear and trembling, and in the hands of many of them [i.e., practitioners], death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that what leads to hesitation does not fall upon you, for sometimes you will encounter people of many temperaments with many kinds of illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of these there are some who become angry about their illness, and death is insignificant to them; and this is because of the intensity of what they find from their illness, and because of the length of their illness, and with the illness there is fear, which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of these there is the one who gives you his possessions and says, you hoping for his recovery, and his disease is pernicious/fatal.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore it is not fitting that you agree [to treat] the one who comes to you in this manner; and let your caution be greater than greed and your rapacity; and do not presume anything about this except with certain knowledge which verifies it before you, and to which follows praiseworthy success.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And in the treatment of all your patients, make use of prognosis and indications of him whose health is restored, for in that is your aid in acquiring fame and renown, praise and glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, sons, may God inspire his understanding in you and not remove from you direction and protection, for this is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have arranged this chapter, distinguishing it by sections as preceded in the chapter on cauteries, from the treatment of the head down to the feet, so that what you ask about and what you need may be made easier for you.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the treatment of water which is contained in the heads of children. (This likely refers to hydrocephalus.)
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness often comes to children after childbirth, and when the nurse squeezes the child's head carelessly/without gentleness. (This probably refers to birth trauma).
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes it happens due to a hidden cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this illness except in children; and in all those whom I saw, death followed, and thus it seems to me a wasted effort in those cases. (Meaning the author found the condition untreatable)
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen a child whose head was filled with water, and his head was always so enlarged that he could not sit up by himself because of the size of his head, and further, the fluid increased until he died.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this fluid is either collected between the skin and the bone, or it is collected below the bone, above/on the nape (back of the neck).
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	For the operation in this case, if the fluid is between the skin and the bone, and the abscess is small, then you must cut in the middle of the head with an incision latitudinally, and let the length of the incision be almost two fingers so that the fluid may drain, and this is the shape of the spatum (bandage/compress):
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And then if the fluid is more abundant and the abscess is larger, then there are two incisions made in this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the fluid is below the bone, a sign of it is that you will see the sutures of the head opened on all sides and the water is squeezed out when you compress it with your hand on the inside parts, and this is not hidden from you.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	You must cut in the middle of the head with three incisions in this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	and after the incision, extract all the fluid; and then bind the incisions with cloths and soft lint; and then soak it from above with wine and oil until the fifth day, and then loosen the bandage and treat the wound with tents and ointments, and bind the head evenly; and feed the patient with dry food with little moisture until the limb is strengthened and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another method of incision, which considers where the size of the abscess and the collection of fluid appear, for sometimes it is more in the occiput, or in the front part, or on the right, or on the left; and therefore pay attention with the incision where the abscess and the fullness of the fluid appear, and do this as best you can.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And take care not to cut the artery and consequently cause bleeding and the patient dies from that blood flow with evacuation of fluid.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter 2.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	On the incision of the arteries that are near the ears, called "hilasseysse" (possibly a specific term for those arteries or a related condition).
Capitol segon.	Second Chapter (This is a repetition of the previous line, likely a stylistic choice).
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When someone develops cataracts or rheum (discharge) in the eyes or feet, and it is chronic, and medical treatments are not effective, then the last resort is the incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	Therefore, when you want to incise them, have the patient shave their head, then rub the area with a rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and then tighten the patient's neck with a cloth; then consider where the vein pulsates; the locations of each are on the areas near the depressed parts close to the ears, and they are so hidden except in some men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then mark the artery with ink, and then incise each one with a scalpel, sharpened on each side, with an incision reaching to the bone, and let this be across the width of the head (or perhaps "along the side of the head," depending on the precise meaning of "latitut"). 
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you wish, insert the scalpel under the artery and cut it at the incisions on the upper parts.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And let the length of the incision be about the width of two fingers joined together, because when a vein is incised, the blood comes out with a pulsating flow, which spurts out frequently.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery doesn't appear to the touch, then you must measure from the ear a space of three fingers, and then mark with ink, and cut to the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And the amount of blood that should be let is six ounces, and very soon you let out more or less, and all that depends on the apparent strength of the patient and the fullness of his artery.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then examine the wound, and if any part of the pericranium remains on the bone, then incise it so that a hot abscess doesn't develop afterward.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then pack the wound with soft feathers and linen bandages, and then treat it with ointments until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter 3. 
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	On the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When someone suffers from a chronic migraine or acute catarrh, due to harmful moisture and [poor] quality in the tissues of the temples, or ancient vehement dizziness similar to these, and is treated with medical cures and it doesn't help, then we have proven in these illnesses the extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of them as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of the operation and extraction of these is that the patient shaves the hairs which are on the temples; and pay attention to the artery visible in the temple for it is shown to you by its pulse, and it is hidden only in a few men due to the vehemence of cold.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if it is hidden from you, then the patient's neck should be constricted with some cloth; and then rub the place with a rough cloth or steam the place with hot water until the artery appears manifestly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the spatula of which this is the form: 
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you peel the skin with it [the spatula] gently until you reach the artery; and then make an incision there and extract it [the artery] at the upper parts until you extract it from the skin and uncover it from the tunics/membranes which are beneath it, completely.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is thin/small, then wrap it with the tip of the hook/lancet, and then cut a part of it according to the amount by which its extremities are elongated and constricted, and no flow of blood will occur, for if they are not incised, the blood will not rise at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then drain from six ounces of blood up to three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then you must tie it in two places with strong double silk thread or with long cords, and not fear putrefaction before the healing of the wound and the occurrence of blood flow.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then cut the excess which is between the two ligatures/ties; and do this at that time or shortly thereafter.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you wish, cauterize it with a cautery down to the bone with a knife-like cautery until its extremities are incised, and it will serve in place of that same procedure.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is a better procedure unless the patient has a fever or is of a warm complexion; for cautery is among those things that promote the resolution of humors, and therefore it is better in aiding recovery. 
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And after the extraction of the arteries, you must fill the place with old cotton, and powders suitably made should be placed over it, and then it should be treated with drying medications that promote flesh growth and with others until it is healed. 
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you are operating a second time bleeding occurs from the artery, then you should hurry to stop that blood, either with a cautery, or by filling the place with cotton, and press your hand on it until the bleeding is stopped/reduced.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if none of these things are available to you, then place your finger over the area until the blood clots, and wash the area with very cold water until the sharpness/pain subsides, and it is constricted as necessary.
E aquo que es pus leugier en extraccio de arceria es que tu cauterizes la vena am aquest cauteri haventz dos cotels, pus que tu has senhat les dos locs am tenta, e depausa quascus, mot ignitz, entro que pervenguan al os e inscindan la vena en dos locs, per so que sia elonguat aquo que es entre las extremitatz de lu, quar no son consolidadas de tot am aquest cauteri.	And the easiest thing in extracting an artery is to cauterize the vein with this cautery having two blades, after you have marked the two places with a probe, and apply each one, heated by fire, until they reach the bone and cut the vein in two places, so that what is between its ends is lengthened, because they are not completely consolidated with this cautery.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri:	And this is the form/shape of the cautery:
E sia la acuitat dels dos cotels esemps.	And let the sharpness of the two blades be similar/equal.
Mays empero si so mendres acuitat que dos cotels es milhor, quar si so agudas cum dos cotels propera a quascuna freg, e no enscideysso la carn am velocitat.	But however, if it is less sharp than two knives, it is better, because if it is as sharp as two knives it will stick to any wound, and it will not cut the flesh quickly. 
Donc cum en aquels es alcuna grossitut, es tenguda la calor del foc en aquels e la carn es abscindida leugierament.	Therefore, as there is some thickness in them, the heat of the fire is retained in them, and the flesh is cut easily.
E aquesta obra es milhor en tota obra e pus leugiera.	And this work/method is better in every operation and easier.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre dos cotels la quantitat de la grossesa del dit.	And let the space which is between the two blades be the size/width of a finger's thickness.
Capitol quart.	Chapter Four.
De la cura de cors de lagremas agudas e aciduas dels huels.	On the treatment of acute and acidic tears of the eyes. (Alternatively:  Of the body in regards to the treatment of sharp and acidic tears from the eyes).
Quan so lagremas aciduas, e es le cors de aquelas venas las quals so sobre le test del cap deforo, e no comfereys en aquo alcuna causa de la curacio de medicina, e vezes la cara del malaute ja enrogesir e sent en le sieu front deambulacio ayssi cum si era deambulacio de formiguas, e·ls huels de aquel so extenuatz, humitz enayssi que ja les pels de lor son conodutz, e las parpelas so scalfadas per la acuitat de las lacrimas, les antics agro mesties en la curacio de aquelas de aquesta operacio, e nompnero aquela curacio am spassa.	When there are acidic tears, and the source of these is the veins which are on the front of the head, and you find no other cause in this for the medical treatment, and you see the face of the patient redden and feel on their forehead a crawling sensation as if it were the movement of ants, and their eyes are weakened, moist so that their lashes are stuck together, and the eyelids are irritated by the sharpness of the tears, the ancient doctors have often used this operation for their treatment, and I will describe this treatment briefly.
E es que tu comandas al malaute rayre les pels les quals son en le sieu front, e aprop inscideys en le front tres fissuras engualment distans segon la longitut del front.	And you instruct the patient to shave the hairs which are on their forehead, and then make three incisions on the forehead equally spaced along the length of the forehead.
E si’ la longitut de la fissura cays dos ditz: la una fissura sia engualment distant a la longitut del nas en le mieg loc del front, e la segonda segon la longitut un petit del movement dels lacertz les quals so en le lacrimal, e la tersa del autre part.	And if the length of the incision is two fingers: the first incision should be equally distant from the length of the nose in the middle of the forehead, and the second according to the length a little from the movement of the muscles which are in the tear duct, and the third on the other side. 
E guarda te de la incizio de las arcerias las quals so en dos latz, e elongua la tua ma de la continuacio de amdos las mandibulas.	And beware of cutting the arteries which are on both sides, and keep your hand away from the joint of the two jaws (mandibles).
E si’ l’espazi de quascuna inscizio la quantitat de tres ditz ajustatz.	And let the length of each incision be the measure of three fingers placed together.
E si’ a tu una pessa d’espongua apparelhada o draps seccatz motz am les quals exsiccas le sanc.	And have a piece of prepared sponge or very dry cloths with which you dry the blood.
E aprop entremet le spatum de dos agudas extremitatz, del qual aquesta es la forma de la inscisio de lu:	And then insert the spatula with two pointed ends, of which this is the form of the incision:
que es de la partida des templas entro a la segonda inscizio.	which is from the area of the temples down to the second incision.
Exxcorja am aquel tota la codena la qual es entre dos incizios am le ciphac le qual es sobre le os, e aprop fay aquo de la inscizio migera entro a la segonda inscisio.	Scrape with that (instrument) all the tissue which is between the two incisions, down to the pericranium (membrane) which is over the bone, and then do the same from the middle incision down to the second incision.
E aprop stratz ne aquest spatum e entromet en la primieyra inscizio autra vetz un autre instrument le qual es apelat cutellar, agut de una part e del autre no agut.	And then remove this spatula and insert another time into the first incision another instrument which is called a knife, sharp on one side and not sharp on the other.
E pausa le latz de aquel agut deves la carn annexa deves la codena, e le latz de lu leon dintz le os, e empelley aquel entro que pervengua a la fissura migera, e abscindeys am aquel totz les vaysels que descendo del cap als huels.	And place the sharp side of it towards the flesh adjacent to the tissue, and the smooth side of it inwards toward the bone, and push it in until it reaches the middle fissure/crack, and cut with it all the vessels that descend from the head to the eyes.
Mays que sia continuada la inscizio ad aquo appar de la codena, e aprop fay aquo en la fissura migana entro al autra fissura.	But ensure that the incision is continuous with that separation of the tissue, and then do the same in the middle fissure down to the other fissure.
E pus que corr del sanc quantitat engual, exprem les locs de las pessas del sanc congilat.	And after a sufficient amount of blood has flowed, press out (clear) the area of the pieces of clotted blood. 
E aprop pausa en quascuna fissura calgua de coto vielh, e pausa sobre aquels polvils enbegutz en vi e oli e vi agre, e vegas que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then place in each fissure some old cotton, and place over these compresses soaked in wine and oil and sour wine, and watch that a hot abscess does not develop.
E en le tertz dia deslia le liament e aministra gran enfusio de aygua cauda o tebeza, e aprop cura aquo am enguent bazilicon am oli rozat e autres entro que las plaguas sian sanadas.	And on the third day, undo the bandage and administer a large infusion of warm water or lukewarm water, and then treat it with basilicon ointment with rose oil and others until the wounds are healed.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5.
De la cura de lagramas per catartz e als huels descendentz de las partidas dedintz del cap.	On the treatment of excessive tearing (or rheum) caused by cataracts and to the eyes descending from the inner parts of the head.
Quan ad alcu veno catartz agutz e continuantz, e vezes les huels del malaute extenuatz petitz, e ja le reguardament de lor es debelitat, e las palpebras ulceradas e de lor cazo les pels, e en le preon del cap es dolor aguda ledent e extrenutacio consequent, lahoras sapias per aquestz accidentz que las materias e catartz no veno sino de motas venas de las partidas dedintz procedent.	When someone experiences acute and persistent cataracts, and you see the patient's eyes thinned and small, and their sight is weakened, and their eyelids are ulcerated and their eyelashes are falling out, and there is a sharp, throbbing pain in the forehead accompanied by emaciation, then know by these symptoms that the matter and cataracts come from many veins originating from the inner parts.
E la milhor curacio en aquels es aquesta: que comandes al malaute que raza lo sieu front, e aprop inscideys en aquel una fissura al mieg loc del front, un petit per la latitut (e comensa am la fissura del templar senestre entro al dextre templar; e sia inscisio entro al os; e eslongua la tua ma dels lacertz del templas lesquals son maugutz deves la mastigacio), entro que sia le os descubert.	And the best treatment for this is the following: order the patient to shave their forehead, and then make an incision in it in the middle of the forehead, a little wide (and start with the incision from the left temple to the right temple; and let the incision be down to the bone; and keep your hand away from the temporal muscles which are moved by chewing), until the bone is exposed.
Exsicca tot le sanc am espongua o am drap secc e aprop repleys entre las doas labias de la fissura am coto vielh o am draps de li.	Dry all the blood with a sponge or with a dry cloth and then fill the space between the two edges of the incision with old cotton or linen cloths.
E aprop estrenh desus am polvils enbegutz en vi e oli per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then tighten over it with small cushions soaked in wine and oil so that a hot abscess does not develop.
E quan deslias aquo e veses que l’apostema ja es diminuit, lahoras cove que fregua le os entro que comensa en lu nayser carn, e aprop cura aquel am regiment exsiccatiu le qual fassa neysser la carn, ayssi cum si tu prenes de farina de froment dos partidas e de colofania quatre partidas e mescla o, e de lor sia fayt emplastre e sia aministrat en aquestas plaguas a de la carn nativitat.	And when you untie this and see that the swelling has diminished, then you must rub the bone until flesh begins to grow in it, and then treat it with a drying treatment which makes the flesh grow, such as if you take two parts wheat flour and four parts rosin and mix them, and make a plaster from them and apply it to these wounds for the generation of flesh.
Capitol .vi.	Chapter 6.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of things that fall into the ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.	Everything that falls into the ears is one of four kinds, for it is either a mineral stone or something similar to a stone, such as iron and glass, or it is from a plant such as grain or a bean, or it is a liquid substance such as water and sour wine and things like them, or some animal.
E donc quan peyra catz en l’aurelha o autra causa semblant de aquelas causas que no ajustan ne creysso en l’aurelha, e pausa la aurelha al solelh, e si vezes la peyra, lahoras distilla en aquela alcuna causa de oli violat o sizami, e aprop aministra la extraccio de lu, e fay le stornudar am condizi, e oppila las nars deve le aveniment de stornutacio.	And so when a stone or another similar thing falls into the ear, of those things that do not swell or grow in the ear, then place the ear in the sun, and if you see the stone, then pour into it some violet oil or sesame oil, and then try to extract it, and make the person sneeze with pepper, and block the nostrils just before the sneeze comes.
E aprop pausa en le circuit de la aurelha alscunas pessas de drap o lana, e dextendas la aurelha a las partidas desus, quar motas veguadas es foro-getada am aquestas causas.	And then place some pieces of cloth or wool around the ear, and stretch the ear upwards, for many times it is thrown out by these means.
E si no n’es getada, lahoras aministra extraccio de lu am le instrument apelat gesti epicicarios subtil del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is not thrown out, then extract it with the instrument called a subtle ear probe, of which this is the form: 
E si es foro-getada am gesti, bo es; e sino, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am onci subtil de pauca duplicacio.	And if it is removed with the probe, good; and if not, then extract it with a subtle hook of small bend/double curve.
E donc si no es foro-getada per aquo, lahoras fay una canula de aram e entromet la extremitat de la canula en le trauc de la aurelha e claus a l’enviro de la canula am cera e am oli mollificada per so que no sia ubert sino la canula.	And so if it is not removed by this, then make a tube of brass and insert the end of the tube into the opening of the ear and seal around the tube with wax and softened oil so that nothing is open but the tube.
E aprop extratz am le tieu vent am fort atraccio, quar tropas veguadas cum aquo que havem recontat.	And then extract it with your breath by strong suction, for many times it comes out with this that we have recounted. 
Mays si no es foro-getada en aquesta manieyra, lahoras pren de halka alumbat o de vecz aparelhat am le qual son preses les ausels una patita quantitat, e pausa aquel en la extremitat de ray, e aprop envolopa sobre aquel coto decentment pausat.	But if it is not removed in this manner, then take a small quantity of burnt alum or prepared glass, with which birds are caught, and place that on the end of a stick/rod, and then wrap cotton decently placed over it.
E aprop entromet aquel en le trauc de la aurelha am facilitat, e aprop excicca la aurelha de la humiditat.	And then insert that into the opening of the ear gently, and then dry the ear of moisture.
E donc si no es foro-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recontadas, lahoras tu coyta a talhar aquela denant que endevengua apostema caut o espasme.	And thus if it is not removed with all the things that we have recounted, then you must consider cutting it before a hot abscess or spasm develops.
E la manieyra de talhar aquela es que tu al comensament sancnes le malaute de la vena sephasica e extratz del sanc segon la mannieyra de la vertut de lu, e aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas e converteys l’aurelha a las partidas desus, e fen am petita fissura en la razit de la aurelha deves lo greys de lu en le loc be premegut de lu.	And the way to cut it is that you at first bleed the patient from the cephalic vein and extract blood according to their strength, and then have them sit between your hands and turn their ear upwards, and make a small incision at the root of the ear behind their cheek in the most prominent location. 
E sia la fissura de figura lunar entro que pervengua a la peyra, e, la peyra atrobada, osta aquela si podes am instrumentz apropriatz; e aprop cos la fissura en aquela hora am velocitat, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And the incision should be moon-shaped until you reach the stone, and, the stone found, remove it if you can with appropriate instruments; and then sew the incision at that time quickly, and treat it until it is healed.
E si la causa cazent en la aurelha es un dels gras que creysso e so inflatz, lahoras aministra la curacio e la extraccio de lu; mays si no obezeys a tu ad eyssiment, lahoras tu pren spatum teune subtil segon aquesta forma:	And if the thing fallen into the ear is one of the growths that increase and swells, then administer treatment and extract it; but if it doesn't respond to such treatment, then you take thin, dyed linen according to this method:
e aministra am aquel la abscizio de aquel gra lo qual es cazut en l’aurelha.	and administer with it the removal of that growth which has fallen into the ear. 
E no fassas aquo quan cogitas que aquel ja es humectat per la vapor del aurelha, e pausa aquel en motas pessas, e prop extratz ne aquelas am les oncis o am gesti subtil, o ab inscizio ayssi co dit havem, quar es alleujada la extraccio de lu.	And don't do this when you think that it is already moistened by the moisture/vapor of the ear, but put it in many pieces, and then remove them with hooks or with a fine gesture/movement, or with an incision as we have said, for its extraction is facilitated.
Mays en l’aygua la qual es intrada en l’aurelha cove que·l malaute use de sternutacio am condizi al comensament, e omple la sieua aurelha am alcu coto vielh, e jagua sobre aquela aurelha en la qual es l’aygua, e si per aquo es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, lahoras pren tropas peyras teunas e leons segon la longitut del dit, e calfa aquelas en le foc un pauc, e le pacient entrometa una de aquelas en le trauc de la sua aurelha e saute sobre la un pe sieu de aquela partida e percussia am una autra peyra sobre la peyra la qual es dintz la aurelha.	But for water that has entered the ear, it is necessary that the patient sneeze with seasoning at the beginning, and fill his ear with some old cotton, and lie on that ear in which the water is, and if by this it is expelled, good; and if not, then take many dyed stones the length of the finger, and heat them in the fire a little, and the patient inserts one of these into the hole of his ear and hops on the one foot of that side and strikes with another stone on the stone which is inside the ear.
Donc no cesse aquo am peyra entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada.	Then don't stop this with the stone until all the water is expelled.
E ja l’aygua sira foro-getada enayssi que tu prenguas de papier o de gonc i, e met la una extremetat de lu en l’aurelha e estendas l’autre extremitat am foc entro que sia comburit le may de lu.	And the water will be expelled thus:  take paper or cloth and put one end of it in the ear and light the other end with fire until most of it is burned.
E prop met i autre gonc e fay aquo tantas veguadas entro que tota l’aygua sia foro-getada, e stratz aquel am canula ayssi co desus es dit de la peyra extrasadora.	And then put in another piece of cloth and do this as many times as necessary until all the water is expelled, and draw it out with a tube just as was said above about the stone for extraction.
Mays en la extraccio de bestia intrant en aquela aurelha, si es a petit cos, ayssi piussa e a lu semblant, cura aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio; mays si es de gran cos la qual causa apar al sen del vezement, lahoras aministra la extraccio de lu am gesti e oncis, e la causa de lu es pus leugiera de totas las autras causas que cazo en l’aurelha.	But in the extraction of a creature entering that ear, if it is small-bodied, such as a flea or similar, treat it as we have said in the section; but if it is large-bodied, which is apparent to the sense of sight, then administer its extraction with movements and hooks, and its case is easier than all the other cases that happen in the ear.
Mays en la extraccio de verm engendrat en la aurelha, quan tu curas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e en le tractat de distillacios e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu reguardes la aurelha al solelh.	But in the extraction of a worm generated in the ear, when you treat it with what we have said in the section and in the treatise on distillations and your treatment is not effective, then it is necessary that you examine the ear in the sunlight.
E donc si apar aqui alcuna causa dels verms, lahoras extratz aquel am gesti o am onci subtils, mays si no apar deguna causa, lahoras pren una canula dejos streyta e desus ampla de la qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then if some sort of worm appears there, extract it with movements or with fine hooks, but if nothing appears, then take a tube, narrow below and wide above, of which this is the form: 
E entromet la extremitat subtil en la aurelha segon la quantitat la qual suffertar puesca le malaute; e aprop sucgeys am aquela per succio fort, e fay aquo motas veguadas, entro que totz les verms sian foro-gitatz.	And insert the narrow end into the ear as far as the patient can bear; and then suck strongly with it, and do this many times until all the worms are driven out.
Mays si no obezeysso a tu al ayssiment, lahoras tu opila e claus en le circuit de la canula am cera ayssi cum havem dit; lahoras aministre distillacios las quals han ja esproadas les antics en la curacio dels verms, e atrobaras aquo en le tractat de distillacios.	But if it does not obey you thus, then you block and close the circumference of the tube with wax as we have said; then administer distillations which the ancients have already tested in the treatment of worms, and you will find this in the treatise on distillations.
E sia la tua efusio am la qual efundas les olis medicinas en la aurelha am aquest strument del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let your pouring, with which you pour the medicinal oils into the ear, be with this instrument of which this is the form:
E fay aquela de argent o de eram, dejos streyt, en le qual sia un petit trauc, e am pla desus.	And make it of silver or brass, narrow below, in which there is a small hole, and with a flat top above.
E donc sia cum empellent a que es en la conquavitat de la canula de continent aqui on sira necessari.	And thus it will be as a pusher for what is in the cavity of the cannula to constantly [move it to] where it is needed. 
E si vols, pren le ray e envolveys en la extremitat de lu decentment coto, e aprop gieta oli en la concavitat del auziment, o suc de alcuna herba, o aquo que vols de aquestas medicinas en la canula — e aquela es en la aurelha —, e aprop entromet le ray am coto desus e exprem am la tua ma aquel am compressio temprada de lu entro que l’oli sia expellit en la concavitat del auziment e le malaute senta le oli dedintz.	And if you wish, take the ray (rod/probe) and wrap cotton decently on its end, and then pour oil into the cavity of the ear, or juice of some herb, or whatever you want of these medicines into the tube — and that is in the ear — and then insert the ray with cotton on top and press it with your hand with moderate compression until the oil is expelled into the cavity of the ear and the patient feels the oil inside.
E aquo que sia enfundut en la aurelha sia ja scalfat am foc un petit.	And what is poured into the ear should already be slightly warmed by fire.
E guarda te que la causa la qual distillaras en l’aurelha no sia trop frega, quar las medicinas de aurelha no suffertan aquo.	And be careful that the substance which you instill into the ear is not too cold, for ear medicines do not tolerate that.
Capitol .vii.	Chapter 7.
De curacio de opilacio de aurelhas.	On the treatment of blockage of the ears.
Alcunas veguadas alcus enfantz yeysso dels ventres de lors mayres no-perforatz, e aquo ja accideys en alcus homes, opilacio en le meat de la aurelha per plagua o per carn nada en aquela; e aquesta opilacio alcunas veguadas es fayta en le preon del trau de la aurelha la qual no consiec le vezement, e alcunas veguadas es en las partidas defora.	Sometimes some children are born from their mothers' wombs without ear openings, and this also happens in some men, a blockage in the ear canal due to a growth or excess flesh there; and this blockage is sometimes located deep in the ear canal, which impedes hearing, and sometimes it is in the outer parts.
E aquela que accideys en le preon de lu, la qual no comprehen le vezement, es en las majors disposicios de dificil sanacio.	And that which occurs deep within, which affects hearing, is among the most difficult conditions to heal.
E en aquela en qual consegueys le vezement, cove que tu pauses la aurelha del malaute al solelh e reguarda en aquela.	And in the case where hearing is affected, you should place the patient's ear in the sunlight and examine it.
E donc si vezes oppulacio apparent, obre aquela am espatum subtil del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then, if you see an apparent blockage, open it with a thin spatula, of which this is the shape:
Si’ la extremitat de lu en la qual sia petita la latitut, del qual la una partida sia aguda e l’autra no; e le spatum sia de dos latz leon per so que no fassa lizio al aurelha.	Its end should have a small width, one side sharp and the other not; and the spatula should be smooth on both sides so that it does not injure the ear. 
E donc si la opilacio es per carn nascuda en la aurelha o en le meat de lu, lahoras te aquela am oncis subtils e incidiys aquela vehement facilitat entro que sia ostada tota la carn.	And so, if the blockage is due to flesh growing in the ear or in its canal, then take it with thin hooks and cut it with great care until all the flesh is removed.
E si opilacio es en le preon de la aurelha, lahoras pren ray subtil leon e escalfa aquel am foc un pauc, e aprop met aquel en le meat de l’aurelha.	And if the blockage is in the inner part of the ear, then take a thin, smooth root and heat it slightly with fire, and then place it in the ear canal.
E donc si as scentit oppulacio am aquo que le malaute atroba am facilitat, per gravetat de ausir, esforsa la oppressio de lu am facilitat; e guarda te que no plagues les nervis del aurelha.	And so if you have found a blockage with this that the patient feels as a difficulty in hearing, gently force it out; and be careful not to damage the nerves of the ear.
E aprop pausa en l’aurelha drap de li segon la quantitat del ample del trauc lo qual tu as envolvutz en l’enguent egipciac; e fay aquo per alcus jorns entro que sias segur de la consolidacio de la plagua; o que prenguas qualgua e enfon aquela en ayguaros e pulveriza sobre lu segi trissat e usa de lu; e si vezes la aurelha ja esser apostemada, lahoras cove que tu estraguas la qualgua e permutes aquela am autra qualgua la qual tu envoloparas en cerot que sia fayt am oli rozat, entro que sia le apostema caut cedat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then place in the ear a piece of linen, according to the size of the opening, which you have covered in Egyptian ointment; and do this for several days until you are certain of the healing of the wound; or take some alum, dissolve it in rosewater, pulverize it, sprinkle it over ground seeds, and use this; and if you see that the ear has become abscessed, then you must remove the alum and replace it with other alum that you will wrap in a plaster made with rose oil, until the heat of the abscess has subsided; and then treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras submergeys esponga o drap en aygua frega e pausa sobre la aurelha, e usa del autra curacio la qual restrengeys le flux del sanc, la qual es dita en le tractat de distillacio.	But if bleeding occurs, then submerge a sponge or cloth in cold water and place it on the ear, and use the other treatment which restricts the flow of blood, which is described in the treatise on distillation.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cura de athezil le qual endeveno a las palpebras.	On the treatment of a sty which occurs on the eyelids.
Athezil les quals endeveno a las paupebras dels huels alcuna veguada so humitz, alscunas veguadas son secs.	Styes which occur on the eyelids are sometimes moist, sometimes dry.
Donc cove que tu tenguas aquels am tenhalhas o am onci, e inscindas aquels am espatum de las suas razitz, e aprop pausa sobre les locs segi trissat.	Therefore, you must hold them with forceps or a hook, and cut them with a spatula from their roots, and then place ground sedge on the areas. 
Mays si dolor am flux de sanc veno, lahoras tu cauteriza aquels am cauteri lanticular subtil.	But if pain with a flow of blood occurs, then cauterize them with a fine lenticular cautery.
E la milhor cauterizacio es aprop las inscizios e tropas veguadas retornam quan reman alcuna causa de sas razitz; e quan so cauterizadas am foc, aquelas razitz son comburidas e no retornan.	And the best cauterization is near the incisions, and they often return when some part of their roots remains; and when they are cauterized with fire, those roots are burned and do not return.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter 9.
Cura de grandeyssa que veno a las palpebras dels huels.	Treatment of swelling that occurs in the eyelids.
Motas veguadas endeve en las palpebras dels huels alcuna causa la qual es asemblada a grandissa en sa fortalicia e duricia, e per so grandissia es apelada.	Often a condition occurs in the eyelids which resembles a swelling in its firmness and hardness, and therefore it is called swelling.
E es agreguacio de humiditat grossa en la palpebra dejos e desus.	And it is an accumulation of thick humor in the upper and lower eyelid. 
Donc la opperacio en lor es que consideras lahoras si la grandissia es procedent en lu en aquo que apar de la palpebra e es mauguda a tota partida; e la causa de lu es leugiera.	Therefore, the treatment for them is that you consider then if the swelling originates in the eyelid itself and is movable in every direction; and its cause is mild. 
Donc fen sobre aquela am fissura per la latitut, e aprop escorga aquela de tota partida am facilitat entro que evasesca, e aprop suspen aquela am onci e abscindeys aquela.	Then make a longitudinal incision on it, and then carefully peel it off in every direction with ease until it is detached, and then lift it with a hook and cut it off.
Mays si a tu no es apparelhada la incizio de lu si no pus que penetras la palpebra am inscizio pauc a pauc, lahoras aquo no notz en deguna causa.	But if you cannot make the incision all at once but can only penetrate the eyelid with the incision little by little, that does not matter in any way.
E si la figura es gran, lahoras tu l’ajusta am sutura; e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the wound is large, then you close it with sutures; and treat it until it is healed.
E si es pauca, a tu no sobrevindra mal per aquela quar l’anguent de lu restaura aquela e encarna.	And if it is small, no harm will come to you from it because the ointment will restore and heal it.
E si la grandissia es declinant a las partidas dedintz de la palpebra deves la superficia dedintz, lahoras evesa la palpebra e suspen la grandissia am onci, otra que tu indigescas de incizio, e prem aquela de tota part, e si la palpebra per inscizio es alonguada, aquo no notz en deguna causa.	And if the growth is leaning towards the inner parts of the eyelid below the inner surface, then lift the eyelid and raise the growth with a hook, so that you don’t need an incision, and press it on all sides, and if the eyelid is stretched by the incision, that doesn't matter at all.
E aprop la incizio, lava le huel am aygua salada; e cura le loc am aquo que encarna entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, wash the eye with salt water; and treat the area with a healing substance until it is healthy.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De la cura axcirnah en la palpebra desus del huel.	About the treatment of fleshy growths (axcirnah - likely a type of growth or cyst) on the eyelid above the eye.
Axcirnath es grays le qual es engendrat en las tunicas de la palpebra desus, e majorment endeve als enfantz, agrava les huels de aquels et accideyso a lor catartz le mayti; e no podon reguardar la claror del solelh per aquo quar lagremas se coytan ad aquels.	Axcirnath is a growth which develops in the membranes of the upper eyelid, and occurs mostly in children, affecting their eyes and often causing cataracts in them; and they cannot look at the brightness of the sun because of this, for tears flow from their eyes.
E per so tu vezes aquels jaser sobre les lors caras tot temps, e sobre les lors caras dormen; e so a las palpebras de lor dejos les sobrecils humidas, las quals ja ha cuberta imflacio, e iminencia de accernac apparent es en l’uelh; e que quant tu premes le loc am les tieus ditz, tu centes accernac entro aquels.	And so you see them lying on their faces all the time, and they sleep on their faces; and the eyelids below their eyebrows are moist, covered with swelling, and a noticeable prominence of the axcirnath is apparent in the eye; and when you press the area with your fingers, you feel the axcirnath within.
E alcuna manieyra de opperacio es en aquel que le malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop pausa drap de li e de lu fay calgua, e fay de lu cercle segon la quantitat la qual contena arthernach de tota partida, e aprop pausa aquel sobre aquela e prem am les tieus ditz de tota per que sia agreguat arcernac en le mieg del cercle, e aprop fen en le mieg de aquela humiditat am spatum inscident am fissura per la latitut, e la fissura no sia major que la fissura que es fayta en flaubotomia.	And the method of operation is this: the patient rests their head on your lap, then place a cloth on them and create a frame/border, make a circle according to the size which contains the axcirnath completely, then place this upon it and press with your fingers all around so that the axcirnath is gathered in the middle of the circle, and then make an incision in the middle of that moist area with a lancet, making a cut along its width, and the cut should not be larger than the incision made in phlebotomy (blood-letting).
Mays en le preon cove que tu fendas la codena tota entro que pervenguas ad arcernach, quar en las mays desposicios proceseys arcernach per fissura segon la forma de grayseza blanca.	But in the beginning, you must split the skin until you reach the axcirnath, because in later stages the axcirnath develops through the incision like a white fatty substance. 
Donc extratz aquela am draps los quals tu as envolopatz entre les tieus ditz a las partidas deforo e revolv entre la ma dextra e sinistre entro que sia dispargut.	Then extract it with cloths that you have wrapped around your fingers externally and roll it between your right and left hand until it is removed.
E guarda te que no ajustes en la fissura per so que am le spatum no pervenguas al huel e ladescas aquel.	And be careful not to go too deep in the incision so that with the instrument you do not reach the eye and damage it.
Mays si no apar a tu arternach en le comensament de la fissura, mays que tu ajustes en la fissura un petit am fecilitat entro que procesisca arternach; e aprop extratz aquela ayssi quo havem dit; e aprop submargeys draps de li en aygua e vi agre e pausa les sobre le loc e estrenh aquels am polvils.	But if you don't see the axcirnath at the beginning of the incision, then you should carefully go a little deeper in the incision until the axcirnath appears; then extract it as we have said; then submerge cloths in water and wine vinegar and place them on the area and bind them with bandages. 
E so alcus que trissan sal e pausan aquel en la conquavitat de la fissura per so que aquo que es remas de aquela humiditat.	And there are some who grind salt and place it in the cavity of the incision so that it absorbs what remains of the moisture/humidity.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys en le loc apostema caut, lahoras cura aquel am emplastres cedatils entro que sia sanat.	But if a hot abscess develops in the area, then treat it with sedative plasters until it is healed.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter 11.
De manieyras de tactimi del huel.	On the methods of examining/palpating the eye.
Quan en las palpebras dels huels so natz pels ajustatz dejos les pels naturals e so antiquatz, lahoras aquels noso al huel e fan endevenir manieras de malautias ayssi cum lacrimas assiduas e mollificacio de palpebras e tela entro que aquo sia causa de destruccio del huel que s’apela tactinir del huel, e cura se en quatre manieyras: o per cauteri am foc; o am medicina acuta segon que denant es dit en le capitol de cauteri; o es fayt atactini per inscizio e sutura; o per cannas segon que yeu diyre.	When hairs grow on the eyelids, close under the natural hairs, and become hardened, they irritate the eye and cause various diseases, such as constant tearing, softening of the eyelids, and inflammation, which can lead to the destruction of the eye, which is called a sty (tactinir) of the eye.  It is treated in four ways: either by cauterization with fire; or with a sharp medicine as described previously in the chapter on cautery; or the sty (atactini) is removed by incision and suture; or with tubes, as I will explain.
E donc cove que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se; aprop converteys la palpebra del uelh am la tua ma sinistra, e si es convertida, bo es; e sino, entromet agulha en aquela en la qual sia fiel de la partida pus dejos de la palpebra, e fay penetrar la agulha am fiel desus, e aquo sia — prop del marge de la palpebra en le qual naysso les pels — prop dels pels, e tira le fiel a las partidas desus am la palpebra, e converteys aquela am le ray.	And therefore, you must place the patient's head on your lap.  Then turn the eyelid with your left hand, and if it is turned, good; and if not, insert a needle into it, which has thread attached to the lower part of the eyelid, and push the needle with the thread upwards, and this should be near the edge of the eyelid where the hairs grow — close to the hairs — and pull the thread upwards with the eyelid, and turn it back with the thread. 
E aprop fen en la partida dedintz de la palpebra dejos les pels ajustatz am spatum inscidentz del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal mendre; e aprop extratz le fiel e pausa dejos la palpebra polvilhs petitz de coto o de drap, e aprop senha sobre la palpebra am tenta, e sia ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirt.	Then make an incision on the inner part of the eyelid, below the ingrown hairs, with a lancet, from the larger lacrimal duct to the smaller lacrimal duct. Then remove the thread and place small pieces of cotton or cloth under the eyelid, and then bandage over the eyelid with a dressing, and it should be shaped like a myrtle leaf. 
Mays empero cove que sia la figura segon la quantitat de helevacio de la palpebra, quar aquo ja es diversificat en les homes, quar de aquels es le quals indigeys que sia inscidit de la palpebra gran quantitat segon la quantitat per la qual la palpebra es mollificada.	But the shape should be according to the size of the swelling of the eyelid, for this varies in people; for in some, a large amount of the eyelid needs to be incised according to how much the eyelid is swollen.
E aprop fen am le spatum sobre las doas linhas las quals has senhadas, e comensa del lacrimal major entro al lacrimal menor.	Then make incisions with the lancet along the two lines that you have marked, and start from the larger lacrimal duct to the smaller lacrimal duct.
E si’ la tua fissura prop dels pels naturals ayssi cum es la grossetut del rey.	And make your incision near the natural eyelashes about the thickness of a hair.
E aprop met le onci en un dels dos angles de la codena, e aprop excoria aquela tota, e aprop ajusta am la scitura las doas labias am gula o fiel de lana subtil, e abstergeys le sanc, e fay adherir aquo que superflueys dels fiels sobre dos sobrecils am alcunas causas enviscans, si voles far aquo, e sino, non cures.	Then place the hook in one of the two corners of the swelling/growth (codena), and then excise it completely, and then stitch the two edges of the incision with silk thread or fine wool thread, and wipe away the blood, and cause what is superfluous from the threads to stick to the eyebrow with some sticky substance if you want to do this, and if not, don't bother.
E aprop leyssa la sutura dels fiels entro a tres dias o quatre, e aprop cura aquo.	Then leave the stitching of the threads for three or four days, and then take care of it.
E si vols, layssa la plagua ses sutura, e cura aquela am aquo que exsicca e constrenh, quar la palpebra es alevada deves la sigillacio de la plagua e la agreguacio de lu; mays sutura es milor E donc aysso diysso les antics de taxanir.	And if you wish, leave the wound without stitching, and treat it with something that dries and constricts, for the eyelid is lifted/raised by the sealing of the wound and its joining/healing; but stitching is better. And thus said the ancients regarding styes/hordeolum (taxanir).
Mays empero en lu sia sollicitut sobre le malaute, e es de bona operacio, e no es en lu temor.	But however, take care with the patient, as it is a delicate operation, and there is risk involved.
E es autra manieyra en taxmir, e es que senhes sobre la palpebra figura ayssi cum fuelha de mirt, e aprop eleva la palpebra am tres uncis segreguatz e congreguatz segon aquesta forma:	And there is another method for styes (taxmir), which is to make a mark on the eyelid shaped like a myrtle leaf, and then lift the eyelid with three hooks separated and arranged in this form:
Mays si no es possible aquo, tener les uncis, e aquo no es engualhat, lahoras pren una agula en la qual haia fil e met aquela en le mieg de la figura, e entromet le autre fiel prop le lacrimal major, e·l fiel segon prop le lacrimal mendre, e ajusta entre les tieus ditz les fiels am equalitat, e aprop am aquels eleva la tua ma am elevacio engual, eleva tota la codena sobre la qual es senhat ayssi cum havem recomtat.	But if it's not possible to hold the hooks, and this is not leveled, then take a needle threaded with a suture and place it in the middle of the figure, then place another suture near the larger lacrimal duct, and the second suture near the smaller lacrimal duct, and adjust the sutures between your fingers evenly, and then with these lift your hand evenly, lifting the entire fold which is marked as we have described.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then join the two lips of the wound with stitches, and treat it until it is healed.
Mays si accideys apostema deves la tua inscizio o la tua fissura, seda aquel apostema am cerot e a lu semblantz, e am enguentz.	But if an abscess develops near your incision or laceration, soothe that abscess with a plaster and similar things, and with ointments.
E alcunas veguadas endeve a la palpebra que·ls sieus pels sian convertitz, adonc cove que tu uses en aquela de aquo que havem dit de inscizio; mays sutura en quascus es mays artificial.	And sometimes it happens to the eyelid that its hairs are inverted, then you should use on it what we have said about incisions; but stitching in each case is more skillful/refined.
Ataxinir am cannas es segon aquesta forma:	Splinting with reeds is done in the following manner:
e es que tu convertas la palpebra e scindas la figura qu’es dedintz segon que he recontat; e aprop per art fay doas cannas o doas astelas subtils de las quals longitut sia segon la longitut de la palpebra e la latitut de lor sia mendra de la latitut del spatum.	You should turn the eyelid and cut the figure that is inside as I have described; and then skillfully make two reeds or two thin splints whose length corresponds to the length of the eyelid and whose width is less than the width of the probe/spatula. 
E tu ja has inscidit en las extremitatz de quascunas partidas, la on tenes les fils.	And you have already made incisions at the edges of each part, where you are holding the threads.
Aprop agregua quascuna am subtilitat subre aquo que superflueys de la palpebra del huel, e constres las cannas de quascunas partidas am fort strictura, e layssa aquela per alcus jorns, quar la codena per la strictura morira e sira denegada e se poyrira entro que per si meteyssa cayra.	Then carefully add each [splint] subtly over the excess of the eyelid's skin, and bind the reeds on each side with firm pressure, and leave it like that for a few days, because the flesh constricted by the pressure will die and be denied [nourishment] and will rot until it falls off by itself. 
Mays si es tardat, lahoras trenca la am las toroyras, e aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanat.	But if it is delayed, then break it with forceps, and then treat the wound until it is healed.
Donc cum es solidada, la palpebra es elevada e les pels no pungo.	Then, when it has solidified/healed, the eyelid is lifted and the eyelashes do not prick/irritate (the eye).
E aquesta es la forma de doas cannas las quals faras segon aquesta forma:	And this is the form of two reeds which you will make according to this shape:
e haia la quantitat de la longitut e de la latitut ni mays ni mens.	and it should have this quantity of length and width, neither more nor less.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter 12.
De elevacio de pels pungentz en le huel am agula quan le pel es dur.	On the lifting/removal of irritating eyelashes in the eye with a needle when the eyelash is hard/ingrown.
Quan son pels no-naturals, durs e aspres e pungentz les huels, lahoras la operacio en lu es que tu prenguas agula subtil e pauses en aquela fiel de ceda subtil e leon, e aprop que tu ajustes las extremitatz de lu e nozes quascu en manieyra mot subtil.	When there are unnatural, hard, rough and irritating eyelashes in the eyes, then the procedure is that you take a fine needle and place in it a fine thread of silk and linen, and then you adjust its ends and tie each in a very subtle way/with a very small knot.
E sia la longitut dels fiels de quantitat de una palma.	And let the length of the threads be the quantity of one palm (handspan).
E aprop tu compon2 autre fiel subtil dejos lu en breu, e nuza las extremitatz de aquel si tu·t vols.	And then you arrange another fine thread beneath it, short, and knot the ends of that if you wish.
E aprop pause le malaute le sieu cap en le tieu se, e sia prop del solelh per que la tua obra sia declarada, quar es operacio subtil e menuda.	And then have the patient place their head on your lap, and be near the sun so that your work is well-lit, for it is a subtle and delicate operation.
E aprop intromet la agulha en la razit del pel ajustat la qual ha necessitat de engen, e fay aquela penetrar en la palpebra festinantment entro que extraguas aquela desus le pel natural.	And then insert the needle into the root of the offending eyelash which needs removal, and make it penetrate the eyelid quickly until you pull it out above the natural eyelash.
E aprop tire le pel entro desus e intromet aquel en alixati, e sian les pels un o dos o tres e no mays.	And then pull the hair out and insert it into a depilatory (or plaster/salve), and let the hairs be one or two or three and no more.
E aprop tira la tua ma am aquel entro que·l pel sia fora-gitat am alixolati en la palpebra am le pel natural.	And then pull your hand with it [the hair and depilatory/plaster] until the hair is ejected with the depilatory from the eyelid along with the natural eyelash. 
Mays si es atirat alixalati e non es gitat le pel, atiraras alixati a las partidas dejos am le fiel le qual tu has compost am aquela, entro qu’en sia gitat alixalati del trau sobira.	But if the depilatory is pulled and the hair is not ejected, you will pull the depilatory downwards with the bile which you have mixed with it, until the depilatory is ejected from the upper hole.
E vegas aquela am la visio del huel, quar lahoras tu gitaras alixati e lo fiel, e grotan quascu e clautz le huel, e laysse le claus per dos dias o tres, entro que·l pel adheresca al sieu loc e nasque sobre aquel bona carn.	And watch it [the process] with the sight of the eye, for then you will remove the depilatory and the bile, and close each eye and cover it up, and leave it covered for two or three days, until the hair adheres to its place and good flesh grows over it.
E si es mays breu le pel, lahoras tu ajusta un pel lonc dels pels naturals, e es elevat am aquel, o que·l leysses entro que sia alonguat aprop alcu spazi, e lehoras tu eleva aquel.	And if the hair is too short, then you should attach a long hair from the natural hairs, and it [the new hair] is lifted with it [the attached natural hair], or you can leave it until it grows somewhat longer, and then you lift it. 
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter 13
