De la cura de ehacratir la qual ve en la palpebra desus.	On the treatment of ectropion, which occurs in the upper eyelid. 
Quan ve en le huel ehacratir, e es contraccio de la palpebra quan es contrayta en sus, o a dextra o a sinistra partida, per mala consolidacio de plagua o de seccio o de cauteri, e es apelada leporina, e aquesta ahercrati o es natural o accidental, e es fayta per consolidacio de plagua o de seccios o de cauteri, o per semblantz a lor malcuratz.	When ectropion occurs in the eye, and there is a contraction of the eyelid when it is pulled upwards, or to the right or left side, due to poor healing of a plague sore, a cut or cauterization, and it is called "hare eye," and this ectropion is either natural or accidental, and is caused by the healing of plague sores or cuts or cauterizations, or similar poorly treated conditions.
May la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que tu fendas aquela consolidacio e que separes las labias de lu, e pauses en lu en aquo que es entre aquelas una meca de drap de li, e ligues aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	But the way to operate on it is that you cut that hardened tissue and separate its edges/lips, and place between them a linen cloth wick, and bind them until they are healed.
E no cove que tu uses de curacio de lu de las causas las quals exsiccan, constrenho; quar si tu fas aquo retorna alixacratir pus mal que nulh temps no foc habantz.	And you should not use drying, constricting treatments on it; because if you do this, the ectropion will return worse than it ever was.
Usa en aquela de causas que mollifico ayssi cum es fenugrec, e embroca am la aygua en la qual son coytz altea e semensa de li, o enguent dyaquilon, le qual sia liquefayt am alcu dels olis, e submergeys en aquel la meca, e cura am aquel.	Use on it things that soften, such as fenugreek, and foment with water in which marshmallow and linseed have been cooked, or diachylon ointment, which should be liquefied with some oils, and soak the wick in this, and treat with that.
E lo tesaur de la tua curacio es que tu perforsses am tot engen que no sia consolidat segon la forma que foc al comensament.	And the key to your treatment is that you completely prevent it from hardening/scarring again in the way it did at the beginning. 
E aquesta operacio la qual havem dita, no es sino alcuna rectificacio de ehalixacrati que no retorna la forma del loc segon que foc denant.	And this operation that we have described is only a partial correction of ectropion which doesn't restore the area to the shape it had before.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De la cura de ehacrati le qual es fayt en la palpebra dejos.	On the treatment of ectropion which occurs in the lower eyelid.
Aquesta alxacrati la qual es fayta en la palpebra dejos, la qual es nompnada vertadierament alxacrati; e es de lu alcuna natural, autra accidental.	This ectropion, which occurs in the lower eyelid, is what is truly called ectropion; and there is one type that is natural, another that is accidental.
Mays accidental es fayta per plagua o per scissura o per cauteri o per autres semblantz.	But accidental ectropion is caused by a wound or a tear or by cauterization or other similar things.
E la via de la operacio de lu es que tu prenguas una agula en la qual haga fil doble, e fiques aquela en la carn, e que la fassas passar del lacrimal de senestre entro al lacrimal dextre, entro que·l fil pervengua en las doas extremitatz de la carn.	And the way to operate is that you take a needle with double thread, and insert it into the flesh, and make it pass from the left lacrimal point to the right lacrimal point, until the thread reaches both ends of the flesh.
E aprop exten la carn a las partidas desus am la agula e cus aquela am la agula, e inscideys am spatum ample.	And then stretch the flesh upwards with the needle and sew it with the needle, and make an incision with a wide spatula/instrument.
E donc si retorne la figura de la palpebre segon que cove, bo es; e sino, pren le ray e pausa aquel en la figura fenduda, e am aquel converteys la palpebra, e fen las doas fissuras en le latz de la palpebra dejos.	And then if the shape of the eyelid returns as it should, it is good; and if not, take the thread and place it in the split area, and with it turn the eyelid, and make two incisions on the side of the lower eyelid.
E sian las extremitatz de las doas fissuras de dos angles de la inscizio, la qual has fayta entro que concurren, e sia de lor fayt angle entro que quan se congreguan sia fayta figura de lor.	And let the ends of the two incisions be at the two angles of the larger incision which you have made, so that they meet, and form an angle between them, so that when they come together, their shape is made.
E aquesta figura es letra greca: la landa.	And this figure is the Greek letter: lambda (Λ).
E aprop osta la carn aquela per la quantitat que es le latz de lu agut dejos de lu, aquo que siec la palpebra.	And then remove/cut away that flesh for the width of the side of it sticking out below, that is, the eyelid. 
E aprop ajusta las partz seperadas e cos aquelas am le fil de lana; e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit de las medicinas mollificativas e de las calguas entro que sia sanat.	And then join the separated parts and sew them with woolen thread; and then treat them with what we have said about softening medicines and ointments until it is healed.
E si alxacrati endeve per fissura o sutura o cauteri, lahoras cove que tu fendas am fissura plana sobre les pels de la palpebra segon que es precedit.	And if an ulcer develops because of an incision or suture or cauterization, then you need to make a clean incision on the skin of the eyelid as described previously.
E aprop separa am la calgua entre doas labias segon que havem dit.	And then separate [the two edges of the wound] with the ointment between the two lips [of the wound] as we have said. 
En la suma del sermo de la cura de alxacrati quan es desus o dejos, que corra en lu operacio, segon que es preparat de la forma de alxacrati, e aquela es en forma de motas diversitatz.	In summary of the discussion on the treatment of ulcers, whether above or below, the operation should proceed according to the preparation for the type of ulcer, which occurs in the form of diverse swellings/lumps.
E le artifexs savi totz temps prepara engen en quascuna manieyra la qual es possibla a lu entro que fassa retornar la figura a la forma natural, o prop de aquela, e aquel malaute segon que a lu conveneys de la operacio e dels strumentz en las majors disposicios.	And the skilled practitioner always diligently prepares in every way possible to restore the [affected area] to its natural form, or close to it, and [treats] that patient as is appropriate with the operation and instruments in the best arrangements.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De la adherencia de la palpebra am la conjunctiva o am la cornea.	Of the adhesion of the eyelid to the conjunctiva or to the cornea.
Quan accideys aquesta consolidacio a motz homes enayssi que sia solidada la palpebra pus desus am le album del huel, e sia prohibida de la facilitat del movement e de las suas obras naturals, donc cove que tu entrometas la extramitat del ray dejos la palpebra, e eleva en sus aquela, o exten aquela am le unci.	When this consolidation happens to many men, such that the upper eyelid is adhered to the white of the eye, and is hindered from easy movement and its natural functions, then you should insert the end of the probe under the eyelid, and lift it upwards, or extend it with a hook.
E aprop tu inscideys la adherencia am spatum subtil, le qual no sia am acuitat de las inscisios, habantz obtus un petit per so que·l malaute no sia inquietat deves la operacio, e remau le spatum que no ledesca le huel am la sua acuitat.	And then you incise the adhesion with a thin spatula, which should not have sharp incisions, having a slightly blunt [edge] so that the patient is not distressed during the operation, and position the spatula so that it does not injure the eye with its sharpness.
E sia la tua inscizio quays excorjan aquela adherencia am facilitat entro que sia retornada la palpebra segon la sua forma natural e que sia sanada tota la adherencia.	And make your incision in such a way that it excises that adhesion easily until the eyelid is returned to its natural form and all the adhesion is healed.
E aprop tu met en le huel aygua salada am la qual tu laves; o distilla en lu de zunia dissolvut en l’aygua.	And then you put salt water in the eye, with which you wash it; or instill in it egg yolk dissolved in water.
E aprop separa entre la palpebra e l’huel am calgua de li, e pausa sobre le huel lana infuza en album de huou, e aprop le tertz jorn usa de causas consolidativas entro que sia sanat.	And then separate the eyelid and the eye with some lint, and place wool infused with egg white over the eye, and then on the third day use consolidative agents (medications that promote healing) until it is healed.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De inscizio de ungla e de eminencia de carn dels lacrimals.	On incision of the nail and of fleshy excrescence of the tear ducts (lacrimal caruncle).
Sapias que ungla es segon dos manieyras, quar o es nervosa, e es semblant a ciphac dur subtil; o es no-nervosa, semblant a humiditat blanca congilada, la qual quan ferr la toca, o es forsat aquela prendre am onci, es abscindida e le onci no es ficat en lu.	Know that a nail is of two kinds, for either it is sinewy/fibrous, and is similar to a hard, thin film/membrane; or it is non-sinewy/non-fibrous, resembling a frozen white humidity, which when an iron touches it, or it is forced to be grasped with a hook, is cut off and the hook is not stuck in it.
E amdos las specias no comensan sino del lacrimal major entro que va petit a petit que cobre la vista e prohibeys le lum e·l movement de huel.	And both types begin only at the larger lacrimal duct/caruncle from where it goes little by little until it covers the sight and obstructs the light and the movement of the eye.
Mays la manieyra del obrar en la inscizio de lu es que·l malaute pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop obre les huels de lu, e eleva la palpebra am la tua ma, e aprop colligeys la ungla am onci de pauca duplicacio e exten aquela a las partidas desus.	But the way of operating in its incision is that the patient places their head on your knee, and then opens their eyes, and you lift the eyelid with your hand, and then grasp the nail with a hook with a shallow bend/curve and extend it upwards.
E aprop pren una agula e entromet en aquela un pel de cavalh o de buou o de vaqua, o de semblantz, o de fiel fort, o duplica la extremitat de la agulha petit a petit e fica aquela en le mieg de la ungla, e penetra aquela am la agulha, e lia am fiel la ungla; e exten aquela a las partidas desus, e excorja am le pel le latz de la ungla lo qual siec la pupilla.	And then take a needle and insert into it a horsehair or ox hair or cow hair, or similar, or strong thread, or bend the end of the needle little by little and insert it into the middle of the nail, and penetrate it with the needle, and tie the nail with thread; and extend it upwards, and scrape with the hair the sides of the nail which follows the pupil.
E ayssi tu sieguas aquela am le pel entro al derier de lu.	And thus you follow it with the thread/hair to its back/rear.
E aprop tu inscideys le romanent en la razitz del lacrimal am spatum subtil o am petitas forfexs, e leysa la carn del lacrimal natural per so que per inscizio de aquela no endevengua fluxs de lagremas continuabla.	And then you incise the remainder at the root of the lacrimal caruncle with a fine spatula or with small scissors, and leave the flesh of the natural lacrimal caruncle so that a continuous flow of tears does not occur due to its incision.
E alscunas vetz la ungla am le sol onci estenduda o am fiel, ayssi co havem dit, e aprop sia excurjat am spatum leon del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And sometimes the nail, extended with the hook alone or with thread, as we have said, and then be scraped with a lion's spatula of which this is its form:
E guarda te que am le spatum no toques la tunica cornea e que avengua en lu ruptura, e que la pupilla sia perforada.	And be careful that with the spatula you do not touch the cornea and cause a rupture in it, and that the pupil be perforated.
Aprop la inscizio geta en le huel un pauc de sal trissa o di cief fayt de siniar, e leyssa aquel entro al autre dia; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	Then, into the incision/wound put a little ground salt or wound-powder made from pig fat, and leave that in until the next day; and then treat it with what is needed until it is healed.
E si la ungla no es nervoza e no podes metre la agulha, ni es ficada en aquela le onci, lahoras motas veguadas aquesta specia de ungla es curada am medicinas, e es sanada ayssi cum yeu e recomtat en la divisio.	And if the nail bed is not sensitive and you cannot insert the needle, nor is the hook inserted in it, then often this type of nail ailment is treated with medicines, and is healed just as I have recounted in the chapter/section.
E si tu vols inscindir aquela, lahoras tu obre le huel del malaute e pren spatum subtil leon de freul acuitat segon aquesta forma:	And if you want to incise it, then you open the patient's wound and take a thin, sharp steel lion's spatula of this form:
am subtilitat.	with thinness/finely.
E si vezes que aquela es rarificada e es confugida e empren en aquela razit, lahoras distilla de la tua ora en le huel de cief fayt de siniar o am cief rog o am sal trissat, e opila le huel entro a l’autre dia.	And if you see that it (presumably the wound/affected area) is thinned and damaged and eaten away, then instill into that place oil of your choice made from pig fat, or with red oil or with ground salt, and cover the wound until the next day. 
E aprop itera sobre aquela la operacio entro que sia remaugut tot aquo que es de lu, sino que·l contrari apostema caut sia en le huel, quar lahoras tu leyssa aquela, e cura al comensament la apostema entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat the procedure on it until everything that is there is removed, unless a hot, opposing abscess is in the wound, for then you leave it, and treat the abscess first until it is healed.
E aprop itera la tua operacio sobre aquela am razo entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat your procedure on it reasonably/methodically until it is healed.
La emenencia de la carn lacrimal, si notz en le huel per gran nocument, sia suspendut am onci; e inscideys aquela de aquela una partida, e no ultimes la inscizio per so que no inscidesqua fluxs de lagremas.	If the protruding lacrimal caruncle causes great harm in the wound, it should be lifted with a hook; and incise a part of it, but do not complete the incision so that you do not cut into the flow of tears. 
E aprop distilla en le lacrimal cief rog e fayt de siniar entro que sia sanat.	And then instill red oil made of pig fat into the tear duct until it is healed.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter 17.
De inscizio de alguazardenic e de aquo que es nascut de carn ajustada en le huel.	On the incision of an abscess and of that which is born of flesh attached/formed in the eye.
Alcunas veguadas en les huels de alcus es nascuda carn roga, e es sobre-pausada entro que cobre la pupilla, o apropinqua o estrenh sobre las palpebras e fort leu comprem las palpebras a las partidas deforo e es assemblada a roza de balaustra.	Sometimes in the eyes of some people a red flesh grows, and it spreads until it covers the pupil, or approaches or presses on the eyelids and very quickly compresses the eyelids on the outer parts and is similar to a pomegranate flower. 
Mays la operacio en lu es que·l malaute pausa le sieu cap en le tieu se; e aprop obre les huels de aquel e colligeys tota aquela carn am oncis convenientz ad aquo, e te aquo am una forcep o am cesti; e aprop inscindiys la carn el comensament entro que tot sia finit am le encisori, e guarda te del huel que no ledescas aquel deves la tua operacio.	But the operation for it is that the patient places his head in your lap; and then open his eyes and gather all that flesh with hooks suitable for this, and hold it with forceps or with these; and then cut the flesh at the beginning until it is all finished with the scalpel, and beware of the eye that you do not injure it during your operation.
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscides aquelas o am espatum le qual nos havem recomtat en la inscizio de la ungla, o am petitas forfexs am las quals es colligit ascebel segon que vindra la forma de lu aprop aquest capitol.	And your incision, with which you cut those, may be with a spatula which we have recommended in the incision of the nail, or with small scissors with which a sliver is removed, according to the form of it near this chapter. 
Donc cum es complida la tua inscizio e es remauguda tota aquela carn, lahoras omple le huel de sal trissa, o destilla en lu polvera roga e semblantz a lu de las medicinas corrossivas, e pausa sobre le huel deforo coto am album de huou entro que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	Then when your incision is completed and all that flesh is removed, then fill the eye with powdered salt, or sprinkle on it red powder and similar corrosive medicines, and place on the eye externally cotton with egg white until it is safe from hot swelling/inflammation.
E si roman alcuna causa de alguardenici e es senhoragat sanc caut, e temes apostema caut, lahoras leyssa le huel e cura aquela apostema am aquo que ceda aquela apostema, e aprop itera sobre aquel am operacio entro que sia sanat, e semblantment fay en la carn ajustada la qual accideys en le huel de aquesta especia.	And if some cause of swelling remains and hot blood dominates, and you fear a hot swelling/inflammation, then leave the eye and treat that swelling with what reduces that swelling, and then repeat the operation on it until it is healed, and similarly do with the excess flesh which you find in the eye of this kind.
Mays empero tu cove que alienes tota curacio del huel freul per via natural o per via accidental, obran am ferr, e no metas la tua ma en alcuna de aquestas operacios entro que veges que aquel membre sia suffertant aquela operacio.	But however you must avoid all treatment of a cold eye by natural means or by accidental means, working with iron, and do not put your hand to any of these operations until you see that that member is able to tolerate that operation.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter 18.
De colleccio de sabel en le huel.	About/Concerning the collection of sand in the eye.
Sabel so venas rogas las quals son testudas sobre le huel e prohibeysso al vesement la sua operacio, e develican le huel am longitut de dias.	Sand (or Gravel) means red veins that are stretched/spread over the eye and obstruct its vision/function, and weaken the eye over a long period of time.
Donc necessari es al comensament que tu consideres si le huel en le qual es sabel es fort e en lu no es autra malautia que sabel, lahoras tu colligeys aquel sabel.	Therefore it is necessary at the beginning that you consider if the eye in which the sand is, is strong and there is no other disease in it other than the sand, then you may remove that sand. 
E es que tu comandes al malaute que pause le sieu cap en le tieu se, e aprop suspen aquelas venas am un onci o am dos segon la tua prudencia; e sia aquel onci de subtil duplicacio segon aquesta forma:	And you should instruct the patient to place their head in your lap, and then lift/raise those veins with a hook or with two according to your judgment; and let that hook be of fine/thin double-pronged form/make according to this shape:
o so dos oncis gradantment en un cos segon aquesta forma:	or it is two hooks/prongs gradually merging into one body in this manner/shape:
E aprop sian colligidas aquelas venas am forses subtils, am subtilitat, e abstergeys le sanc hora aprop hora, entro que vegas aquelas venas esser remaugudas del huel e sian revolgudas.	And then those veins should be grasped with fine forceps, gently, and wipe/clean the blood from time to time, until you see those veins be removed from the eye and turned/folded back.
E guarda te que tu no ledes le huel am las extremitatz del spatum; e si’ la tua operacio en le miegjorn denant le solelh, e sias mot ferm en la tua operacio que no inscidas sino aquelas venas.	And take care that you do not injure the eye with the ends of the spatula/instrument; and do your operation at midday before the sun, and be very firm in your operation that you incise/cut only those veins.
E quan tu auras complitz, lahoras tu distilla en le huel cief vert o rog per que am sa acuitat corrodesca aquo que es remaugut del sabel.	And when you have finished, then you instill in the eye green or red onion juice so that with its sharpness it corrodes what is remaining of the sand/grit/foreign body.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible colligeys tot en aquela hora, e lahoras tu emplastra tot am aquo que cede la dolor de lu, e leyssa lu per alcus dias entro que sia sedada la dolor de lu e que sia asegurat de apostema caut.	But if this is not possible for you to remove it all at that time, then you apply a plaster with something that soothes his pain, and leave it for some days until his pain subsides and he is safe from a hot abscess/inflammation.
E aprop itera sobre lu segon que la mateyssa manieyra entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat on him according to the same method until he is healed. 
E aquesta es la forma de las forfexs:	And this is the form/shape of the scissors/forceps:
Capitol .xix.	Chapter 19.
De reduccio de arizati al nas.	On the reduction of nasal polyps/swellings.  (Arizati likely refers to some kind of nasal growth or inflammation.)
Quan tu curas arisati am cauteri o am medicina aguda comburent segon que es precedida la narracio de lu e no es sanat, lahoras no es engen en lu sino que fendas sobre le apostema deves la maturitat de lu, e que extraguas tota la humiditat la qual es en lu e·l poyre entro que sia descubert le os.	When you treat nasal swellings with a cautery or with a sharp, burning medicine as previously described and it is not healed, then there is no other option but to cut open the abscess upon its maturation, and to extract all the moisture which is in it and the pus until the bone is exposed/uncovered.
E donc cum es descubert le os e vezes en lu corrupcio o negror, lahoras tu ratz lu am un sturment del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then when the bone is uncovered/exposed and you see corruption or blackness in it, then you scrape it with an instrument of which this is the form/shape:
E es nompnat de aspre cap, e sia feyt de fer indi, e sia le cap redon ayssi cum asir le qual sia fayt punctat per punctacio de lima o aliskalfati per punctacio subtil (ayssi cum es en la forma seguent).	And it is called a rasp, and it should be made of Indian steel, and its head should be round like a hazelnut, which should be made pointed/rough by filing or scraping with fine points (as shown in the following image/diagram).
E pausa aquel sobre le loc corrumput del os, e aprop revolveys aquel entre les tieus ditz, e prem la tua ma petit a petit entro que sapias que aquela corropcio es rasa.	And place it on the corrupted area of the bone, and then rotate it between your fingers, and press your hand little by little until you know that the corruption is scraped away/removed.
E aquo sia fayt alcunas veguadas, e aprop restaura le loc am causas exsiccativas e stipticas.	And this should be done several times, and then treat/dress the area with drying and astringent substances/remedies.
Donc si·l loc es consolidat e es en lu nascuda bona carn e es abscindit le cors de la sania e roman per xl dias, e no es renovat e no es apostemat e no accideys en lu accident, lahoras tu sapias que es sanat.	Then if the area is consolidated/healed and good flesh has grown there, and the flow of pus has stopped and remains so for forty days, and it is not renewed and does not become abscessed and no complications/accidents occur in it, then you know that it is healed.
E sino, lahoras no es en lu engen sino reduzir la fissura a la forma del nas, e segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu descuebras de segon os am ferr o am medicina acuta, e cum sira descubert le os, lahoras tu pren tribo segon aquesta forma:	And if not, then there is no other solution but to reduce the fissure to the shape of the nose, and in this manner: you must expose the bone underneath with an iron instrument or with a sharp medicine, and when the bone is exposed, then you take a drill/trephine in this way/shape:
Sia la extramitat de lu ferr triangulada, e·l fust de lu sia prim extenuat entro a la extremitat ayssi cum vezes assi.	Let the tip of the iron be triangular, and its shaft be thinly drawn out to the tip as you see here. (likely accompanied by a diagram)
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le os, e sia aquel prop del lacrimal; e alongua la tua ma un pauc del huel, e aprop revol la tua ma am le tribo entro que penetre tot le os, e aquel sente le malaute per asso que atroba vent yssir per so quan te la sua ma.	And then place it on the bone, and let it be near the tear duct; and move your hand slightly away from the eye, and then rotate your hand with the drill/trephine until it penetrates all the way through the bone, and the patient will feel it because he finds wind coming out from under his hand.
Donc lahoras restaura le loc am medicinas stipticas exsiccantz ayssi cum t’e eyssenhat.	Then afterwards treat the area with styptic and drying medicines as I have taught you.
Donc cum nays la carn e·l loc es endurazit, lahoras la materia la qual effundia a las partidas deforo retorna al nas, donc aquo es pus leugier sobre le malaute.	Then when the flesh grows and the area is hardened, the matter which flowed to the outer parts returns to the nose, and this is less burdensome for the patient.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20.
De reduccio de la eminencia del huel.	On reducing the swelling of the eye.
Quan le huel emineys am la sua totalitat e no accideys en le vezement nocument ni diminuacio, lahoras cove que laxas le malaute, e aprop que·l segues, e aprop que pausas ventozas en le cervitz ses scarificacio e succa per bona succaccio; e aprop pausa sobre le huel liniment le qual sia fayt de acatra e aloe e enses e sarcocolla, e aprop strenh le emplaustre sobre le huel am motz polvils.	When the entire eye swells and there is no damage or diminishment of vision, then you should bleed the patient, and then purge him, and then apply cupping glasses to the neck without scarification and suck with good suction; and then apply a liniment made of acacia, aloe, incense, and sarcocolla to the eye, and then tighten a plaster over the eye with a soft cloth. 
E la manieyra dels polvils es que prenguas draps de li leons motz, e quascun drap sia duplicat en quatre plecs; e fay de aquels motz.	And the way to make the cloths is to take soft linen cloths, and each cloth should be folded in four layers; and make compresses from these.
E aprop pausa aquels la un sobre le autre segon la quantitat de la qual ha le huel necessitat.	And then place them one on top of the other according to the amount that the eye needs.
E aprop strenh sobre aquels am drap dur am fort strictura; e itera las ventosas am succio ses scarificacio; e aprop osta las ventosas e leyssa le huel streyt le dia e la nueyt.	And then tighten over them with a hard cloth, binding it firmly; and repeat the cupping with suction without scarification; and then remove the cupping glasses and leave the eye bandaged day and night. 
Mays si entretant le liguament es mollificat, lahoras cove que sia mot streyt.	But if in the meantime the swelling has softened, then it should be bound less tightly.  (Implying a looser bandage).
E aprop osta le liament aprop le dia e la nueyt ayssi cum havem dit.	And then remove the bandage during the day and night, as we have said.
E si vezes le huel ja esser redusit, bo es, e sino, lahoras itera le emplastre am les polvils e la strictura e las ventosas entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that the eye is already reduced (back to normal), good; and if not, then repeat the plaster with the powders and the binding and the cupping glasses until it is healed.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De la inscizio de la eminencia de la tunica uvea.	On the incision of the prominence of the uveal tunic (of the eye).  
Quan endeve disrupcio en la tunica uvea, e aprop es eminent e procezeys fora las palpebras ayssi cum un gra de rasim, e es orrazada la forma de home per aquo, e vols aquo inscidir, lahoras la operacio en lu es ayssi cum havem recomtat, que tu entrometas la agula en la razitz de la uvea de la partida dejos en la partida desus, e aprop met la agula autra en la qual sia fil doble de la part del lacrimal, e fay aquela penetrar e leyssa la primieyra agula segon la sua disposicio; e aprop inscideys le loc del fiel doble e leva am aquel la partida de la uvea en le circuit de la agula, e strenh aquela mot.	When a rupture occurs in the uveal tunic (of the eye), and it protrudes and projects beyond the eyelids like a grape, and a person's appearance is marred by this, and you want to incise it, then the operation on it is as we have recounted: that you insert the needle into the roots of the uvea from the lower part to the upper part, and then put in another needle which has a double thread on the side of the tear duct, and make that one penetrate and leave the first needle according to its position; and then incise the location of the double thread and lift with it the part of the uvea around the needle, and tighten it a lot. 
E aprop extratz la agula e pausa sobre le huel lana infusa en album de huou e leyssa entro que cayha le fil am la uva.	And then remove the needle and place on the eye wool infused in egg white and leave it until the thread falls off with the (protruding part of the) uvea.
E aprop cura le huel am aquo que conforte aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then treat the eye with something that strengthens it until the wound is healed. 
E alcunas veguadas aduna de tota partida am cercle de drap entro le huel ajuste eminencia gran, e aprop sia perforat am le spatum subtil que vengua al preon del huel, e corra la humiditat albuginea, e descen le huel e intra tantost.	And sometimes it gathers from all sides with a circle of cloth inside the eye near the large protrusion, and then it is pierced with a fine spatula that reaches the front of the eye, and the albuminous fluid runs, and the eye shrinks and goes in immediately.
E aprop strenh entro que sia sanat.	And then tighten (it/bandage it) until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De curacio de alconati.	On the treatment of elbows (or possibly *alconati*, a specific elbow condition).  It could also mean "of those with elbow problems.
Aquesta malautia que es apelada alconati no es sino sania la qual es ajustada en le huel semblant a aygua dessendent e no es aquela.	This disease, which is called alconati, is nothing but blood which has collected in the eye, resembling dripping water, but is not (water).
Mays la manieyra del obrar en ela es que fasses le malaute sezer sobre la sela aparelada e dreyta, e aprop pren le cap sieu en las tuas mas de doas partz e mau aquel entro que veias la sania pervenir a las partidas dejos, e aprop sia siccada e no descenda, e sia ostat le lum, e·l malaute veia las causas ayssi cum vezia.	But the way to operate on it is as follows: have the patient sit on a prepared and upright saddle, then take their head in your two hands, on both sides, and move it until you see the blood reach the lower parts, then it should be dried and not descend.  And the light should be blocked, and the patient will see things as they saw before.
E si no descendra en jos, sapias que es aygua.	And if it does not descend downwards, know that it is water (and not blood).
Mays si no es preparat le descendement a la sania am aquo que havem dit, lahoras fay le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e aprop pren spatum subtil e fen am aquel sobre le pannicol cernent un petit deves la continuacio de la conjunctiva am la tunica cornea en la corona (entro al loc vuet), entro que sia fora-getada la sania.	But if the descent of the blood is not prepared by what we have said, then have the patient sit between your hands and take a thin spatula, and with this work on the thin membrane [panniculus, perhaps a membrane of the eye], pushing it a little bit down where the conjunctiva meets the cornea (in the corona), into the empty space, until the blood is expelled.
Donc cum es fora-getada, lahoras tu distilla en le huel aygua cauda en la qual has mesclat mel o aygua en la qual ja has bulit fenugrec e mel.	Then, when it is expelled, you should instill into the eye warm water in which you have mixed honey, or water in which you have boiled fenugreek and honey.
E aprop sia curat am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then it should be treated with the other remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De la curacio de la aygua descendent del huel.	On the treatment of watery discharge from the eye. /  About the treatment of tearing/watery eyes.
Ja havem dit las specias de la aygua en la divisio e qual conveneys a perforar am sermo declarant, lahoras aquel segon la sanetat.	We have already discussed the types of watery discharge in the classification and which one requires perforation, explaining it clearly; therefore, [treat] that one according to the remedy. / We have already described the types of watery discharges in the classification and which one needs surgical opening, explaining it in detail. Now, regarding the healing/treatment [of that].
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre un cayrat e lia le sieu huel sa, lu mot stringent.	Then you should have the patient sit between your legs on a square and tie his healthy eye very tightly.
E aprop pausa prop de la palpebra del sieu huel la tua ma senestra, si le huel en le qual es l’aygua es le huel senestra; o am la tua ma dreyta, si le huel es le dextre.	And then place your left hand near the eyelid of his healthy eye, if the eye that has the discharge is the left eye; or with your right hand if the eye [with the discharge] is the right.
E aprop am la tua ma dextra pren almagda, si le huel es senestre; o am la tua ma senestra, si le huel es de dreyt.	And then with your right hand take a probe, if the eye is left; or with your left hand, if the eye is right.
E aprop pausa la extremitat de almagda prop de la corona per la grossesa del ray en le album del huel de part del mendre lacrimal, e aprop enpelleys almagda am vertut e revol la tua ma am aquel.	And then place the tip of the probe near the edge of the iris, about the thickness of a hair away, in the white of the eye towards the smaller tear duct, and then push the probe in firmly and rotate your hand with it.
E aprop penetre en le album del huel e sentas que almagda ja es pervenguda a causa vueda.	And then penetrate the white of the eye until you feel that the probe has reached an empty space.
E cove que sia la masura del cami de almagda al preon la mesura del spazi le qual es de la pupilla entro a la fi de la negror, e es la corona del huel; quar tu veyras am aquel pupilla am la visio de l’huel per la clartat de la tunica cornea.	And the length of the probe's path should be the measure of the space that is from the pupil to the edge of the colored part of the eye, which is the iris; for you will see through it the pupil and the vision of the eye because of the clarity of the cornea.
E aprop pausa almagda entro al loc en le qual es l’aygua, e aprop tu la atira en jos una veguada aprop autra, e donc si la aygua descen tantost, lahoras vetz le malaute aquo sobre le qual huebre la sua vista tantost, e almagda en le sieu huel.	And then place the probe into the area where the fluid is, and then you draw it downwards repeatedly, and if the fluid descends immediately, then at once the patient will regain their sight and [will see] the probe in their eye.
E aprop repausa se un pauc; donc si la aygua es descenduda, lahoras tu depausa aquela autre veguada abantz que almagda ne sia getada.	And then rest a little; if the fluid has descended, then you repeat the procedure before removing the probe.
E donc quan es sicada e no descen, lahoras tu extrat almagda am facilitat, e revol am aquel la tua ma pauc a pauc, e aprop dissolveys en l’aygua un petit de sal clara de gemma e am aquela lava le huel dedintz; e aprop pausa fora le huel coto o stopa o lana infusa en oli rozat e album de huou e ligua am aquo le huel sa.	And when it is dry and does not descend, then you carefully remove the probe, turning your hand little by little, and then dissolve a little clear rock salt in water and wash the inside of the eye with it; and then cover the outside of the eye with cotton or tow or wool infused in rose oil and egg white, and bandage the eye well with this.
Mays nos e aquels que so de nostre temps pause sobre aquel comi trissat am album de huou.	But we and those of our time place on it cumin crushed with egg white.
E si no obezeys a tu almagda al intrament de l’huel per la sua duricia — quar es alcu dels homes del qual le huel es dur mot —, lahoras cove que prenguas le spatum le qual es nompnat alberid del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if the probe does not yield to you upon entering the eye due to its hardness—for there are some men whose eyes are very hard—then you must take the instrument which is called alberid, of which this is the form:
E donc perfora am aquel aquela conjunctura, e no ultimes la tua ma en le trauc, e no es si no que fassas via ad almagda loc subtil.	And then pierce that conjunctiva with it, and do not remove your hand from the instrument, and do nothing but make a subtle path for the probe.
E aprop entromet almagda segon que havem dit.	And then insert the probe as we have said.
E deves le compliment de la tua obra, sia preparat al malaute dormitori descentment fayt en le qual dorma sobre le sieu dos en mayson tenebrosa, e sia prohibit de totz movementz .	And after completing your work, a suitably prepared sleeping area should be ready for the patient, in which they sleep on their back in a darkened room, and are forbidden from all movement.
E pausa en la natura de lu aquo per que sia linida la sua natura, e no maugua le sieu cap a la partida dreyta ni senestra de tot.	And place things in their natural position so that their nature is soothed, and they don't move their head to the right or left at all.
E sia le liament segon la sua disposicio entro al tertz dia.	And the bandaging should be according to his condition until the third day.
E aprop deslia aquel en aquela maysso tenebrosa e exproha la freol vista, e fay li vezer alcunas causas, e aprop retorna le liament entro al dia .vii.	And then untie it in that same dark room and prohibit cold sights, and make them see some pleasant things, and then reapply the bandage until the seventh day.
E no cove que fassas aquo en la hora de las curacios o tantost aprop la infusio.	And you should not do this during the time of treatments or immediately after the infusion/application (of medicine).
Habantz cove que tu alienes aquo per so quar la aygua puega leugierament per gran e vehement de reguardament.	It is fitting that you remove this because the water can easily increase due to forceful and excessive urination/defecation (This translation is uncertain, the meaning of "reguardament" is unclear.  It could relate to something being looked at, urination, or a bowel movement. Given the context, a bodily function seems likely). 
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que deslias le huel denant le vii dia, e rectifica aquel am aquo que ceda apostema.	But if a hot abscess/swelling occurs, then you should untie the bandage before the seventh day, and treat it with something that reduces the abscess/swelling.
Lahoras tu absol la vista de lu e pausa sobre la cara de lu oral per le qual sia regit le vezement de lu dejos lu per alcus dias, lu existent en la mayszo tenebrosa.	Then you should cover his sight and place a cloth over his face through which his breathing can be directed, leaving it there for a few days, while he remains in the dark room. 
E aprop sia gitat de aquela mayzo gradantment e conversa8 en las suas causas.	And afterwards, he should be gradually taken out of that room and spoken to about his affairs/condition.
E sapias que in alchatea no es excusat le discipol de visio alcunas veguadas, e lahoras tu sias ardit sobre la operacio.	And know that in surgery the student is not excused from sometimes watching, and so you should be bold in the operation.
E ja es pervengut a nos de alcu de aquels les quals so al Artach , e alcu disse que fayt foc en al Ayrac magdaam perforat am le qual es succada la aygua.	And it has come to our knowledge from some of those who are in Artach, and some say that fire is made in a perforated clay vessel (earthenware pot?) in Ayrac with which the water is sucked out.  (This likely refers to some sort of suction device or possibly a primitive still.)
Mays empero yeu non e vist degu en la nostra terra le qual haia perfeyt aquo, ni e aquo legit en alcu dels libres dels antics; e es possible que aquo sia novel.	But however, I have not seen anyone in our land who has perfected this, nor have I read about it in any of the books of the ancients; and it is possible that this is a new thing.
E aquestas so las formas de las specias de magdaan per que sia sobre aquelas aquel le qual ignora aquelas:	And these are the forms of the types of earthenware so that those who don't know them may see them: (This likely refers to illustrations of the pottery.)
E sian faytas de eram o de ferr propriament, e sian las extramitatz de lor am aquesta subtilitat triangulada, la extremitat aguda ayssi cum aquela es la forma.	And they should be made of bronze or iron specifically, and their ends should be subtly triangular, the tip sharp, just as this is the shape. (Likely referring to surgical instruments.)
Capitol .xxiv.	Chapter 24.
De la curacio de carn nada en le nas.	On the treatment of nasal polyps (literally, "born flesh in the nose").
Quan en le nas so nascudas carns diversas ajustadas de las quals es alcuna causa la qual es assemblada a scorpio de motz pes, o a polip peys; e aquesta malautia es apelada polipus quar es a semblansa de aquel peys representat.	When various fleshy growths develop in the nose, some of which resemble the many-footed scorpion or the many-footed polyp (octopus); and this malady is called polypus because it resembles that creature.
E de lu es carn cancrosa, lapadea, de fusca color; e de lu es que es carn leon no de color fusca.	And some of it (the growth) is cancerous flesh, flabby, of a dark color; and some of it is lion-like flesh, not of a dark color.  (Note: "lion-like" likely refers to a specific appearance or texture.)
Donc en aquela que es en aquestas carns leon no fraudulenta ni cancroza, cove que fassas le malaute sezer entre las tuas mas e posat al solelh, e huebre las nars de lu, e picoys le tieu onci en aquelas carns.	Therefore, for the kind that is of this lion-like flesh, not fraudulent nor cancerous, you must have the patient sit between your hands and place him in the sun, and open his nostrils, and pick at those fleshy growths with your fingernail. 
E aprop extrat aquela a las partidas deforo, e aprop inscindeys aquo que has comprehendut de aquelas am spatum agut subtil de la una partida entro que sapias que tota la carn ja es ostada; que si roman de lu deguna causa de la qual la abscisio es possibla, lahoras tu ratz aquo am la un dels estrumentz subtils am facilitat entro que de lu romangua denguna causa.	And then pull it outwards, and then cut what you have grasped of it with a sharp, thin spatula from one side until you know that all the flesh has been removed; if any of it remains from which excision is possible, then you scrape it with one of the subtle instruments with ease until none of it remains.
Mays si senhoreja am sanc o accida apostema caut, lahoras tu pausa a lu aquo que cove; o es dels apostemas malignes, lahoras tu coyta e cauteriza aquel entro que sia abscindit sanc e sian ostadas las cavas totas.	But if it bleeds profusely or a hot abscess occurs, then you apply what is necessary to it; or if it is of the malignant abscesses, then you burn and cauterize it until the bleeding is stopped and all the cavities are removed. 
E aprop sia getatz en le nas aprop la inscizio vi agre e aygua o vi.	And after the incision, sour wine and water or just wine should be put into the nose.
Mays si le nas es ubert e de lu procezeys humiditat entro al palat, lahoras sapias que ja es sanat.	But if the nose is open and moisture proceeds from it to the palate, then know that it is healed.
Mays si la humiditat no penetra segon que cove, lahoras tu sapias que dedintz lu es carn nada en los pus sobiras osses de las nars als quals non es pervengut abscizio.	But if the moisture does not penetrate as it should, then know that inside there is proud flesh growing on the bones above the nostrils, to which the excision has not reached.
Donc lahoras cove que entromitas fiel de li al qual sia alcuna grosseza, e nuza en lu motz nuzes, e pausa entre quascun nutz la quantitat del dit o mens, e engene le malaute e entromet una extremitat del fiel en le nars am lo ray o am autra causa la qual es a lu possibla.	Therefore, then it is necessary that you insert ox gall, to which some thickness is added, and mix into it many ground nuts, and place between each application the said amount or less, and lay the patient down and insert one end of the ox gall into the nostrils with a ray or other means possible.
E pus que aquo aura fayt, que atire le sieu odorament entro que pervengua a las canals de las nars, e sia eyssit sobre le sieu golayro, quar tropas veguadas le semblant ad aquesta accio fan les enfantz a las scolas, e es leugiera causa ad aquel que ho vol far.	And after this has been done, let him inhale its scent until it reaches the nasal passages, and let it come out onto his throat, for children at school often do similar things, and it is an easy thing for anyone who wants to do it.
E aprop pausa las dos extramitatz del fiel, una extremitat que iesca sobre le nas et l’autra que romangua en le nas, e aprop aministra serratura de carn am les nuzes que so en le fiel, e fay aquo entro que sapias que las carn ja so am les nuzes del fiel.	And then place the two ends of the ox gall [bladder], one end coming out over the nose and the other remaining in the nose, and then apply ground meat with the nuts that are in the ox gall, and do this until you know that the flesh is [mixed] with the nuts of the ox gall.
E aprop extratz le fiel, e pausa en le nas aprop la abstraccio del sanc una calgua , e fay aquo per tres dias o mays entro que l’enguent corrodo tot aquo que es romas de las carns.	And then remove the ox gall, and immediately after the bloodletting place a plug in the nose, and do this for three days or more until the ointment corrodes all that remains of the flesh.
E aprop en la fi de la causa, pausa en le nas una canula de plom per alscus jorns entro que sia sanat.	And then at the end of the treatment, place a lead tube in the nose for some days until it is healed.
Mays si endigeys de curacio que exsique, usa de aquela.	But if you need a drying treatment, use that one.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument a capipurge fazedor am le qual son distillatz olis e medicinas en le nars:	And this is the form of the instrument for cleansing the head with which oils and medicines are distilled into the nostrils:
E fay aquo de argent o de eram, la qual sia semblant a una petita lampesa uberta, ayssi cum petita conqua, e le meat semblantment.	And make it of silver or brass, which should resemble a small open lamp, like a small shell, and the spout similarly.
E si vols, fay una canula clausa ayssi cum cana, e la cancula del estrument a capipurge fazedor e sia plana, descuberta; a la qual sia manubre en lo derier de lu, am le qual tenguas aquela quan escaufas en lu oli o aquo que tu vols dels sucs e de las causas suctiblas.	And if you wish, make a closed tube like a reed, and the tube of the head-cleansing instrument should be flat and uncovered; to which there should be a handle at its back, with which you hold it when you heat oil or water in it, or whatever you want of juices and absorbable substances. 
E aquestz capipurgi es precios: recipe de enforbi de castor, de balayra blanc, de giengiebre, e piletre de safra, de pebre lonc, de escafragia, de epetum de spic ana unc. vi cumfizeys am suc de bleda e de caul, e sian faytas pillulas, e sia destemprada una pillula am aygua tebeza, e sia gitat en las nars del malaute jasent envers.	And this head-cleanser is precious: take spurge, white hellebore, ginger, pyrethrum, long pepper, storax, and spikenard, six ounces of each, mix with beet and cabbage juice, and make pills, and dissolve one pill in warm water, and pour it into the nostrils of the sick person lying face up.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter 25.
De theyls natz en las extramitatz del nas.	Of boils born at the extremities of the nose. 
Motas veguadas es nat theyl en las extramitatz del nas, e es magnificat e omentat en alscus dias entro en que mot es leg le reguardament de lu.	Many times a boil arises on the tip of the nose, and it grows and swells over several days until it is very ugly to look at.
E per aquo cove que tu inscidas aquel en le comensament de la apparissio de lu, e erediques tot aquel.	And therefore you must incise it at the beginning of its appearance and remove all of it.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc o cauteri o medicina comburent la qual estia en loc de lu.	And then apply to the area either a cautery or a burning medicine that will stay in its place.
Mays si es tardada la sua inscizio entro que sia magnificat, lahoras considera si es lapificat, dur, de fusca color e de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr quar es apostema crancos; quar motas veguadas ad aquel que inscideys aquesta apostema endeve per lu granda malicia sobre aquel le qual aquel havia.	But if its incision is delayed until it has grown large, then consider if it is hardened, firm, dark-colored and with little feeling. Then do not touch it with an iron instrument, for it is a cancerous sore; for many times, great harm comes upon the one who incises this sore, just like what happened to the one who had it.
E si le apostema es de leon tocament e no es de fosca color, e vezes que inscizio es possibla en tot aquel, lahoras evacua le malaute e inscideys aquel senes temor, e cura le loc am aquo que exsique e costrenh entro que sia sanat.	And if the sore is somewhat soft to the touch and not of a dark color, and you see that incision is possible throughout, then have the patient vomit (or purge) and incise it without fear, and treat the area with something that dries and constricts until it is healed. 
Capitol .xxvi.	Chapter 26.
De sutura del nas e de las labias e de la aurelha quan la continuitat es dissolvuda per plagua o per semblantz.	On suturing the nose and lips and the ear when the continuity is broken by a wound or similar things.
Sapias que quan accideys solucio de continuitat en una de aquestas cartillages, pauc confereys en aquela operacio sino en alcus homes.	Know that when you encounter a break in continuity in one of these cartilages, you will rarely achieve success in that operation except in some men.
Donc cove, quan endeve ad alcu alcuna causa de aquelas, que consideres si es plagua fresca am le sieu sanc, e lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, when such a case happens to someone, you must consider if it is a fresh wound with its blood, and then you bring the two edges of the wound together with sutures, and treat it accordingly until it is healed.
E si las labias de solucio de continuitat so ja separadas, e quascuna es fayta sana, lahoras cove que tu excorjes quascuna partida de la sua codena apparent entro que n’iesca sanc.	And if the edges of the broken continuity are already separated, and each is healed, then you must excoriate each part of its apparent skin until blood comes out.
E aprop ajusta las doas labias am sutura e strenh aquelas, e sobre aquelas pulveriza sanc de drago e enses trissat, e pausa sobre la polvera una pessa de emplaustra diafinicon, o de alcu autre dels emplastres consolidatius, e leyssa aquel liat per dos jorns o per tres, e aprop deslia aquel e permuta aquel emplaustre e leyssa aquel entro que·ls fiels per si sian abscinditz, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then bring the two edges together with sutures and tighten them, and sprinkle on them dragon's blood and ground incense, and place over the powder a piece of diachylon plaster, or some other consolidative plaster, and leave it bandaged for two or three days, and then untie it and change that plaster and leave it until the threads [sutures] are cut by themselves, and then treat with ointment until it is healed.
Mays la manieyra de la sutura es que tu agregues la solucio de continuitat o am agulhas ayssi cum havem recomtat en la sutura del ventre, o agregua la solucio de continuitat am fiel ayssi cum a tu e fayt saber.	But the method of suturing is that you either join the broken continuity with needles as we have recounted in the suturing of the abdomen, or join the broken continuity with thread as has been made known to you.
Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De extraccio de aquela causas que veno en las doas labias en las partidas dedintz.	On the extraction of those things that come into the two lips [edges of a wound] in the inner parts.
Motas veguadas endeve a motz homes en las partidas dedintz de las suas labias alcus apostemas durs semblantz a gras de errs, e alscunas de lors son mendres e alcunas son majors.	Many times it happens to many men in the inner parts of their labia [lips, edges of a wound] some hard abscesses resembling pig fat, and some of them are smaller and some are larger. 
Donc cove que tu convertas las labias e fendas quascuna de aquelas duricias de tota part, e aprop la abscizio umpliscas le loc de sagi trissat entro que·l sanc sia restrengut, e aprop sia lavat am vi agre e sia curat le loc am aquo que es stipticitat, entro que sia sanat.	Therefore it is necessary that you turn out the lips [edges of the wound] and cut each one of those hardnesses completely, and after the excision you fill the area with crushed sage until the blood is stanched, and afterwards it should be washed with sour wine and the place treated with something that is styptic, until it is healed.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De inscizio de la carn ajustada en las gengivas.	On the incision of the flesh attached to the gums.
Granre de veguadas nays sobre la gengiva carn ajustada la qual les antics apelero albulus, adonc cove que tu suspendas aquela am onci o que tenguas aquela am las forfecs e inscidas aquela deves la sua razit, e leyssas la sania correr o le sanc.	Many times there grows on the gums attached flesh which the ancients called albulus, therefore it is necessary that you lift it with a hook or that you hold it with forceps and cut it down to its root, and let the pus or the blood run.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc sagi trissat o autra polveras stipticas o excicativas.	And afterwards place on the area crushed sage or other styptic or drying powders.
E si aquela carn retorna, lahoras inscideys aquela segundariament, e cauterisa aquela, quar aprop le cauteri no retornara.	And if that flesh returns, then cut it a second time, and cauterize it, for after the cautery it will not return.
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29. 
De razo de dentz am ferr.	About extracting teeth with iron (instruments).
Quan en la superficia de las dentz de las partidas dedintz e de las de foro e entre las gingivas so ajustadas escorsas aspras, legas, e alcunas veguadas son de nigradas e son faytas citrinas o vertz entro que a la gingiva ve per aquo corrupcio e son faytas las dentz legas.	When on the surface of the teeth, inside and out, and between the gums, rough, thin scabs accumulate, and sometimes they become blackened and turn yellowish or green until the gum is affected by this corruption, and the teeth become loose.
E donc cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute entre las tuas mas e pausar le cap de lu en le tieu se, e ratz las dents en las quals apareysso aquelas escorsas e causas semblantz arena entro que de lor no romangua deguna causa, e aquo fay de la negror e de la citrinitat e de las autras entro que sian mondificadas.	And then you must have the patient sit between your knees and rest their head on your chest, and scrape the teeth on which these scabs and sand-like things appear until nothing of them remains, and do this with the blackness and the yellowness and the others until they are cleaned.
Donc si es ostat aquo que es en aquelas del comensament de la razio, bo es; e sino, lahoras tu itera la razio sobre aquelas al autra dia e al segon e al tertz entro que vengua al derier stament en aquo que tu vols.	Then if what was there at the beginning of the procedure has been removed, it is good; and if not, then you repeat the procedure on them the next day and the second and the third until you reach the final stage of what you want.
E sapias que las dentz han necessitat de motz rezoris de diversas formas e de motas figuras segon que es preparat a la tua operacio.	And know that teeth require many scrapers of different shapes and many figures according to what is prepared for your operation.
E per so quar le razori am le qual la dent es raza de la partida dedintz es autre del razori am le qual es ras entre las dentz segon autras formas, e aquestas formas de razoris sian deves tu preparadas las quals veyras tantost:	And because the scraper with which the tooth is scraped on the inside is different from the scraper with which it is scraped between the teeth according to other shapes, and these shapes of scrapers you should have prepared, which you will see immediately:
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
D’eradicacio de dentz.	On the extraction of teeth.
Cove que tu cures la dent de la sua dolor am tot engen e tardes en tota eradicacio de lu, quar no es denguna causa que suplisqua la veguada de lu quan es eradicada, quar es sustancia sublima entro que es excusacio en la eradicacio de lu.	It is appropriate that you treat the tooth for its pain with all care and be slow in all its extraction, because there is nothing that replaces it once it is extracted, for it is a noble substance so that it is excusable in its extraction.
Mays cove quan le malaute es forsat aquela dent eradicar, que fermament deves tu sia certificat quala es la dent dolent, quar motas veguadas la dolor descep le malaute e cuga que sia en dent sana, e tu eradicas aquela e aprop la dolor no cessa entro que la dent malauta e dolent sia eradicada, quar nos ja havem vist aquo per operacio dels barbies.	But it is fitting, when the patient is forced to extract that tooth, that you be firmly certain which is the aching tooth, because many times the pain deceives the patient and he thinks that it is in a healthy tooth, and you extract that one and then the pain does not cease until the diseased and painful tooth is extracted, for we have already seen this through the work of barbers. 
Donc cum deves tu es sertificat qual es la dent dolent, e que o sabes be, lahoras cove que tu scarifiques en le circuit de la dent am spatum en le qual sia alcuna vertut, entro que sia dissolvut de la dent de la gingiva de tota partida, e aprop mau aquel am les tieus ditz, o am forfexs subtils al comensament petit a petit entro que aquela concucesquas.	Therefore, when you are certain which is the aching tooth, and you know it well, then it is fitting that you scarify around the tooth with a spatula in which there is some virtue, until it is loosened from the tooth and the gum on all sides, and then pull it with your fingers, or with fine forceps at the beginning little by little until you extract it.
E aprop alogua en lu fortz tenalhas grans per bona loquacio o estuptura fort, e pausa le cap del malaute entre les tieus denolhs que be le tengues que no·s maugua, e aprop tratz la dent segon rectitut en manieyra que no trenques aquela, ni al malaute major dolor no dones.	And then apply strong large tongs with good leverage or a strong grip, and place the patient's head between your knees so that you hold it well so that it doesn't move, and then pull the tooth straight out in such a way that you don't break it, nor cause the patient more pain.
E donc si no es foro-getat, lahoras pren un de aquels instrumentz, e met aquel dejos lu de tota part am facilitat e esforsa la remocio de lu ayssi que es feyt al comensament.	And if it is not thrown out, then take one of those instruments, and put it under it on all sides with ease and force its removal in the same way as it is done at the beginning.
Mays si la dent es trauquada o corrosa, lahoras cove que tu comples de drap aquel trauc e estrenguas aquel am la extremitat de ray subtil per so que no sia trinquada en la hora de la tua constriccio sobre aquela am tenalas.	But if the tooth is broken or corroded, then it is necessary that you fill that hole with cloth and tighten it with the end of a thin root so that it is not broken at the time of your squeezing it with tongs.
E cove que tu obres exquesitament am scarificacio en le circuit de tota part de la gingiva e guarda mot la tua fortaleza que no trenques aquela e romangua partida de lu, e retorne sobre le malaute per la malicia que sia majo que la primieyra dolor de lu.	And it is necessary that you work carefully with scarification around the entire gum and watch your strength so that you do not break it and a piece of it remains, and returns upon the patient with a worse affliction than his first pain. 
E guarda te que no fassas aquo que fan alscus ignorantz barbiers en lor fistinacio e audacia sobre la eradicacio de lor, ses que no aministran aquo que nos havem recomtat; quar motas veguadas fan venir sobre les homes malautias grans las quals son pus dificils que sian trinquadas, e las razitz de lor remaugudas totas, o alcunas de aquelas, o que extrayguas aquela am alcus osses de la mandigula ayssi cum motas veguadas havem testificat.	And beware of doing what some ignorant barbers do in their haste and audacity concerning their eradication, without administering what we have recounted; for many times they cause great illnesses to come upon men which are more difficult to cure, and the roots of them remain entirely, or some of them, or that you extract it with some bones of the jaw as we have witnessed many times.
E aprop la eradicacio de lu sia lavada la boca am vi caut o vi agre am sal.	And after its eradication, the mouth should be washed with warm wine or sour wine with salt.
E si endeve fluxs de sanc per aysso, ayssi cum motas veguadas endeve, lahoras trissa alcuna quantitat de zegi e aspergeys sobre la plagua, e si no confereys aquel zegi, cauteriza.	And if blood flow occurs because of this, as often happens, then grind some amount of vitriol and sprinkle it on the wound, and if the vitriol is not effective, cauterize it.
La forma de las forceps e tenalas subtils am las quals es mauguda la dent al comensament sia de longua extramitat, de breu manubre e gros, per so que no sian doblatz quan am aquels deves obrar.	The shape of the forceps with which the tooth is moved at the beginning should be of long extremity, with a short and thick handle, so that they are not bent when you must work with them.
E sian ayssi cum vezes de gros manubre entro que quan estrenhas am aquelas no sian dobladas, sian breus extramitatz.	And they should be like you see with a thick handle so that when you squeeze with them they are not bent, and have short extremities.
E sian faytas de ferr de India descentment faytas de dreytas extramitatz, e en las extramitatz de aquelas sian dentz de las quals las unas intron en las autras e estrenhan per constriccio descent fort, e alscunas veguadas las extramitatz de aquelas sian la forma del bec d’un auzel le qual ha nom ciconia, so es guanta, e son de fort constriccio.	And they should be made of Indian steel, suitably made with straight extremities, and at the ends of these should be teeth, some of which fit into the others and tighten by strong constriction, and sometimes the extremities of these are in the shape of the beak of a bird which is named stork, that is crane, and they are of strong constriction.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De erradicacio de dentz e d‘estraccio dels osses de las mandibulas trincadas.	On the extraction of teeth and the removal of broken jaw bones.
Quan deves la eradicacio de dent le qual es trinquat roman alcuna causa, lahoras cove que tu pauses sobre le loc coto am boder per un jorn o per dos entro que·l loc sia mollificat; e aprop entromet algesti o tenalhas las extramitatz de las quals so asembladas al bec de un auzel apelat ciconia o guanta, la forma de las forceps:	When you must extract a tooth which is broken and some part remains, then you need to place cotton with butter on the area for a day or two until the place is softened; and then insert forceps or tongs whose extremities are similar to the beak of a bird called stork or crane, the shape of the forceps:
Las extramitatz de lor sian faytas dedintz ayssi cum lima o alfagi.	Their extremities should be made with teeth like a file or saw.
E si no obediys a tu a eyssiment am aquestas forceps o tenalas, lahoras cove que tu caves sobre la razit e descrobas tota la carn e entrometas le instrument le qual ha nom atali, so es palanca petita del qual la forma es aquesta:	And if it doesn't yield to you in this manner with these forceps or tongs, then you need to dig at the root and remove all the flesh and insert the instrument which is called atali, that is, a small lever whose form is this:
E sia de breu extremitat grossa un petit, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	And let it have a short end, a little thick, and not tapered so that it is not broken. 
Donc si per aquo la razit es foro-getada, bo es; e sino, ajuda te am aquestz autres instrument dels quals aquestas son las formas: la forma del primier instrument es de triangulada extramitat en la qual sia alcuna grossesa:	Then if by this the root is expelled, it is good; and if not, help yourself with these other instruments of which these are the forms: the form of the first instrument is of a triangular extremity in which there is some thickness:
La forma del segon instrument es que sia de triangulada e de pus subtil extremitat.	The form of the second instrument is that it be triangular and with a more subtle/finer extremity/point/tip.
E ja so ajudatz am aquest instrument havent dos ramps del qual aquesta es la forma aprop la seguent:	And now help yourself with this instrument having two hooks, of which this is the form near the following: (This suggests an image will follow.)
e am autres instrumentz les quals precidero en rasura de dentz; quar juvament es fayt am aquest instrument le qual es asemblat a onci gran, e aquesta es la forma:	and with other instruments which I will describe previously in scraping/filing of teeth; for help is given with this instrument which is similar to a large hook/claw, and this is its form/shape: (Again implying a following image).
de la triangulada extremitat torta o curta, la qual sia alcuna grossesa, e no sia enbegut per so que no sia trinquat.	of the triangular extremity, twisted or short, which has some thickness, and is not filed down/sharpened so that it is not broken/brittle.
E otra sapias que·ls instrumentz de las dentz motz so e semblantment les autres instruments.	And also know that the instruments for the teeth are many and similarly the other instruments.
Mays le artifexs savi e subtil en l’art, atroba per si mateys segon aquo que a lu significa la operacio e las malautias diversas; quar son de las malautias a las quals les antics no diysero ni pausero propri instrument, per las formas de diversas specias.	But wise and skilled artisans in the art will find for themselves, according to what the operation and the various diseases indicate to them; for there are diseases which the ancients did not describe nor establish specific instruments for, due to the forms of diverse species/kinds.
Mays si es trinquat l’os de la mandibula o dels autres osses de la boca, o si poyreys, lahoras sia pes curat sobre aquel en son loc am aquo que es a lu convenient dels instrumentz e de las forceps las quals havem dit en la extraccio de las razitz de las dentz, e ajuda te am gesti del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the jawbone or other bones of the mouth are broken, or if they fester, then let it be carefully treated in its place with that which is suitable from among the instruments and forceps which we have mentioned in the extraction of tooth roots, and help yourself with a lever/elevator, of which this is the form/shape:
E sia en lu alcuna grosseza petit a petit, e sia instringida o tenguda am la boca per que no evasesca o fuga entro que l’os de tot sia foro-getat; e aprop restaura le loc am medicinas convenientz ad aquo.	And let there be some thickness to it, little by little, and let it be tightened or held with the mouth so that it does not escape or move until the bone is completely expelled/removed; and then restore the area with medicines suitable for this.
Mays si en l’os es petita poyredura, lahoras ratz aquel de aquela poyredura e de la sua negror, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a small amount of decay in the bone, then scrape that decay and its blackness, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De la cura de las dentz eminentz sobre las autras.	On the treatment of teeth that stand out above the others.
Quan las dentz so eminentz no segon lor cors natural per aquelas la forma es laga, e majorment quan endeve a las femnas, e majorment a las piuselas venerablas; donc cove que tu consideras: si dent es nada aprop autra dent, e no es possibla sarradura ni linament de lu, lahoras radica aquela; mays que no sia annexa am autra dent, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am aquest instrument del qual aquesta es la forma; e es semblant a morr de porc, e sia feyt de ferr de India de extramitat mot aguda.	When the teeth are prominent, not according to their natural position, their shape is therefore ugly, and especially when it happens to women, and especially to venerable young ladies; therefore you must consider: if a tooth has grown next to another tooth, and closing or filing it is not possible, then extract it; but if it is not attached to another tooth, then you incise it with this instrument, of which this is the shape; and it is similar to a pig's snout, and let it be made of Indian steel with a very sharp point. 
E sia la tua inscizio am la qual inscideyses aquela en trops dias per la duricia de la dent, e que no sia comauguda autra de las dentz.	And make your incision with which you incise it over several days because of the hardness of the tooth, and so that it does not harm the other teeth.
E si es dent eminent expausat a limadura, lahoras lima aquel am lima de ferr de India del qual aquesta es la forma:	And if it is a prominent tooth suitable for filing, then file it with a file of Indian steel of which this is the shape:
E sia tot de ferr de India e·l margua eysament; e sia de motz menutz puntz ayssi cum lima am la qual son faytas agulhas, am la qual la dent sia limada pauc a pauc en motz dias am fecilitat, per so que no sia autra dent comauguda e caga.	And let it be entirely of Indian steel and the handle as well; and let it have very fine points like a file with which needles are made, with which the tooth may be filed little by little over many days with ease, so that no other tooth is damaged or broken.
E aprop lineys aquela en la fi, e ratz aquela am alscus razoris.	And then polish it at the end, and scrape it with sharp razors.
E si es dent del qual una partida es trinquada e lideys la lengua, lahoras cove que tu limescas aquel entro que l’aspretat de aquela fraccio sia ostada e engualhada, e sia aplenada per so que la lengua no ledesca ni la paraula no corrumpa.	And if it is a tooth of which a part is broken and injures the tongue, then it is necessary that you file it until the roughness of that break is removed and smoothed, and it is made even so that it does not injure the tongue nor corrupt speech.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De restauracio de dentz maugudas am fiel de aur o de argent.	Of the restoration of damaged teeth with gold or silver foil.
Quan accideys a las dentz devant concussio e remossio per percussio o per cazament, e le malaute no pot strenher sobre aquo que manga, e tu has curat aquel am medicinas stipticas, e no ha valgut la tua curacio, lahoras per so que no cagan es engen en aquelas que sian strengudas am fiel de aur e no de argent, quar argent se fa vert e aprop se poyreys aprop alscus dias, mays aur nul temps no es mudat.	When front teeth are struck and loosened by a blow or a fall, and the patient cannot clench them to chew what they eat, and you have treated them with astringent medicines, and your treatment has not been effective, then so that they do not fall out, it is wise that they be tightened with gold foil and not silver, because silver turns green and then rots after a few days, but gold is never altered.
E sia le fiel en tal subtilitat e grocesa segon la quantitat que puesca entrar entre las dentz; e la forma de la reccio es que prenguas le fiel e pren lo doble de lu entre doas dentz sanas, e aprop que cresques am doas tortuositatz del fiel entre doas maugudas, o si’ una o motas, entro que pervengua la tela a la dent sana del autra partida.	And let the foil be of such thinness and thickness according to the amount that can enter between the teeth; and the method of application is that you take the foil and take twice as much of it between two healthy teeth, and then you press with two twists of the foil between the two damaged ones, or if it's one or many, until the sheet reaches the healthy tooth on the other side. 
E aprop itera le teyssiment entro a la partida de la qual comenciest, e strenh la tua ma am facilitat e savieza entro que no sia mauguda.	And then repeat the weaving back to the side from which you began, and tighten it with your hand gently and skillfully so that it is not damaged.
E sia la tua striccio am la qual strenhas le fiel deves las razitz de las dentz que no evasesca.	And let your tightening with which you tighten the foil be towards the roots of the teeth so that it does not come loose.
E aprop inscindeys las extramitatz del fiel superfluens am las forceps o tosoyras, e agregua aquelas en quascun loc am gesti, e converteys aquelas e las occulta entre la dent sana e la dent mauguda, per so que no fassa lesio a la lengua.	And then cut off the superfluous ends of the foil with forceps or scissors, and tuck these in each place with a tool, and turn them and hide them between the healthy tooth and the damaged tooth, so that it does not injure the tongue. 
E aprop leyssa aquela ayssi streyta cum roman.	And then leave it as tight as it is.
Mays si es desliada o rumpuda, strenh aquela o aquelas am autra fiel en tal manieyra en tot son temps.	But if it is loosened or broken, tighten it or them with another foil in the same manner at any time.
E aquesta es la forma de las dentz e la figura de la rectacio de doas dentz sanas e de doas maugudas, ayssi cum vezes aquestas liadas:	And this is the form of the teeth and the figure of the straightening of two healthy teeth and two damaged ones, as you see them bound:
E quan se fa que retorno una dent o doas aprop le cazement de quascuna en lors locs, e sian recrescutz ayssi cum havem recomtat, e que remauguan.	And when one or two teeth are returned near their setting in their places, and they have regrown as we have recounted, and they become damaged again. 
E no fa aquo sino bo artifexs e savi.	And only a good and wise artisan can do this.
E alcunas veguadas es aptat alcuna causa dels osses de vaca, e es fayt de lor ayssi cum forma de dent, e es pausada en loc en le qual defayl la dent, e es strengit ayssi cum havem dit, e reman e serveys am aquel per lonc temps.	And sometimes some sort of device is prepared from cow bones, and made from them in the shape of a tooth, and it is placed in the location where the tooth is missing, and is tightened as we have said, and it remains and serves in that place for a long time.
Capitol .xxxiv.	Chapter 34.
De inscizio del liament le qual ve en la lengua e prohibeys loquela.	On the incision of the ligament which comes in the tongue and hinders speech.
Aquest liguament le qual ve dejos la lengua alcunas veguadas o es natural am le qual hom nays, o accidental e accideys per plagua la qual ja es consolidada.	This ligament, which is found under the tongue, is sometimes natural, with which one is born, or accidental, and occurs due to a plague/wound/sore which has already been consolidated/healed.
E la operacio en lu es que huobres la boca del malaute, le sieu cap existent en le tieu se; e eleva la sieua lengua, e aprop inscideys aquel liament nervos segon la latitut entro que sia solvuda la lengua de la sua recencio.	And the operation for it is that you open the patient's mouth, their head being placed in your lap; and lift their tongue, and then incise that sinewy ligament along its width until the tongue is released from its restriction.
Mays si en aquela es alcuna duricia o denodacio, e aquo es stat per consolidacio de plagua, lahoras tu gieta unci e scindeys aquel per la latitut entro que aias inscindit le liament e sia dissolvuda la nodacio.	But if there is any hardness or knotting in it, and this has occurred due to the healing of a plague/wound/sore, then you cast hooks/grasping tools and cut that across its width until you have incised the ligament and the knot is dissolved/untied/released.
E guarda te que no sia fayta fissura en le preon de la carn e que scindas aqui arceria e vengua flux de sanc.	And take care that no fissure is made in the underlying flesh and that you cut an artery here and bleeding occurs.
E aprop sia lavat le vestigi de la inscisio am ayguaros o am vi agre o am aygua frega; e aprop pausa dejos la lengua licini; so es meca la qual tengua le malaute dejos la lengua en quascuna nuoyt per so que no sia consolidat autra veguada.	And then the site of the incision should be washed with rosewater or with sour wine or with cold water; and then place lozenges/medicated tablets under the tongue; that is, a wick/plug which the patient holds under the tongue every night so that it is not consolidated/healed closed again. 
Mays si accideys flux de sanc, pausa sobre le loc vetriol trissat; mays si le sanc ventz, lahoras cauteriza le loc am cauteri lantiginos le qual conveneys ad aquo.	But if bleeding occurs, place crushed/powdered vitriol on the area; but if the blood continues to flow, then cauterize the area with a lenticular/lens-shaped cautery which is suitable for this.
E aprop aquel cura am las autras causas entro que sia sanat.	And then treat it with the other remedies until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	On the extraction of a ranula [cyst] from under the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.
