Sometimes an abscess resembling a small lump occurs under the tongue, preventing the tongue from its natural function; and it quickly grows until it fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the procedure for it is that you open the patient's mouth facing the sun and examine the abscess.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you see it is a dark or black color, hard, and the patient feels no sensation in it, then do not touch it for it is cancerous.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if it is inclined to whiteness, in which there is moisture, then put your hook into it, and incise it with a subtle spatula, and cut it on all sides; and if blood comes to you at the time of your operation, then you place crushed vitriol (copper sulfate) on it, until the blood is stopped.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then return to your work until you have completely removed it; then wash it with sour wine and salt; and treat it with the other treatment appropriate to this until it is healed. 
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter 36.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	On the extraction of an abscess from both ears and of that which grows in the throat and of other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When swelling occurs in the throat, that is, glands that are clustered together, which protrude outwards and are called tonsils, which when you treat them as we have said in the (previous) section and it is not healed, then you consider if the abscess is hard, of a dark color, with little feeling, then do not touch it with an instrument (iron/knife).
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	And if it is of a red color and the root is large, then do not touch it with an instrument because of the blood flow; rather leave it until it is matured (ripened), and then either you will lance it, or it will rupture by itself. 
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, round, and its root is thin, then that is the one that should be incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the procedure for it is that you consider, before your operation, whether the swelling has subsided from its heat with complete rest or if it has diminished with some decrease; and then have the patient sit before the sun, and their head be in your lap, and open their mouth, and the assistant taking an appropriate instrument between their hands presses down the patient's tongue with it, of which this is the form:
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	And it should be made of silver or brass, and be thin like a knife.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Then when you press the tongue with it and the swelling is shown to you, and you direct your gaze upon it, then take a hook and insert it into the tonsil, and pull it outwards as much as you can.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Besides this, pull some of the membrane [or: one of the layers/coatings] and then incise it with an instrument of which this is the form:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and it is similar to forceps, however its extremities are curved, so that the opening of each one is towards the other, very sharp, and which should be made of Indian steel, tempered. 
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then incise it with a spatula of which this is the form: And let it be sharp on one side, not sharp on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And after you have incised one slit, incise the other in this same manner of incision, and after the incision the patient should gargle with cold water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But if there is a flow of blood, gargle with a decoction of pomegranate rind or myrtle leaves and things similar to those with styptic properties until the flow of blood is restricted, and then treat it until it is healed. 
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And sometimes other abscesses arise in the throat besides those behind the two ears, and incise these as I have said in the incision of two slits, similarly. 
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And I once treated a woman with an abscess which had arisen in her throat, which abscess tended towards a dark color, with little feeling, which had already closed her throat, and the woman was breathing with a narrow passage, and it had already prevented her from eating and drinking water, and she would have died if it had continued for a day or two more.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had risen so much that it had pierced two branches until it came out through two holes/openings.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Then I took care of it as if it were a fistula and inserted a hook into one of them [the holes], and pulled it [the hook], and a large portion was drawn out, and then I incised it where I understood it connected to the other hole, and then I opened her mouth, and held down her tongue, and then I inserted the hook into that abscess.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then I cut away a large part of it, and only a little blood flowed from it.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Then the woman's throat was cleared, and she immediately began to drink water, and then took food, then I did not cease to incise that abscess many times for a long time, and an abscess formed in its place, which I incised until it was gone.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Then I used a cautery and cauterized his throat, then there was scarring; and then I left and didn't know what God did with them/him after that.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter 37.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On the incision of the uvula when it is abscessed.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When a catarrh descends to the uvula, and it is abscessed and long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is thick and round in the lower part, then it is called buba/buboe.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	But when it is treated with what we have said in the section/chapter, and your treatment is not effective, and you similarly see that pus is indeed gathering there and it is subtle, then you must incise the one that is aggregated and round; and if it has that length, and is sanguine, of a dark or black color, and there is no feeling in it, then you must consider/be careful with its incision, because in that there is danger to the patient.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you see it in the manner that I have described, regarding its whiteness and length, you should have the patient sit and depress their tongue with an instrument, of which I will describe the form, and then place the hook in the uvula, and pull it down and incise it with one of the two instruments which are mentioned in the incision of the tonsils. 
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And you must not incise it beyond what is added above the natural boundary, because if you incise more of it, you will injure their speech.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And after the incision, use what we have recommended in the incision of the tonsils, and treat it until it is healed. 
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	But if the patient is frightened by its incision, you should use ingenuity in its cauterization without fear, and the method of cautery in this case is only with sharp/corrosive water, which is to say that you place the patient's head in your lap, and then depress their tongue with the instrument which we have mentioned, and then take some of the water which we have described in the chapter on cauterization, make a burning coal with it, and apply it neither thickly nor thinly, and with it fill the cavity of the instrument of which this is the form:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let its tip be concave, in which the medicine is placed, like the concavity of a radish spoon, and place the instrument with the medicine on the uvula, and have the patient lie on their side so that saliva or mucus runs from their mouth because of the internal medicine, so that none of it descends onto their throat and harms it.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then hold your hand with the medicine, and press it onto the uvula for the space of half an hour until you see it blackened and dried by the biting action of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take cotton and wrap it around the tip of a radish, and submerge the cotton in the medicine, and insert the radish with the cotton into a cannula until the cotton adheres to that cannula, and do this as many times as necessary until you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the uvula, and then leave it, for it will dry and fall off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you deem it necessary to repeat the medicine, repeat it, and then wipe around the cauterized uvula with cotton soaked in egg white, and cleanse with it what is around it from the medicine, and let it be washed with cold water, and be treated externally with an embrocation, and internally with gargles until it is healed.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this type of treatment is safer than incision and less fearsome.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the uvula is treated with something more subtle than cautery and incision, for it is treated with fumigation in this manner: take calamine, hyssop, origan, rue, Arabic gum, chamomile, borage and similar herbs, and combine all these things, or some of them, in a pot, and submerge them in strong wine, and boil; and let the pot be well sealed with lute, and let there be in the middle of the pot a hole, over which is placed a concave instrument of brass in this manner; let it be made of silver or brass.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And let the tip be inserted into the patient's mouth so that the vapor rises to the uvula through the cannula, until the uvula is very much obscured/darkened (likely meaning: until the swelling reduces).
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	And then repeat this many times until it is dry, and beware not to do this treatment at the beginning of the appearance of abscesses, for it would aggravate the abscess too much, and you should not do this, but you should wait for the clear manifestation/development of the abscess before cauterizing.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	But if this instrument is not available to you, then take a reed and place an eggshell at the end of it, so that the patient's mouth is protected from burns, for the eggshell prevents the vapor from burning the mouth. 
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good and healthy/safe.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter 38.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the extraction of thorns and of that which adheres to the throat/esophagus and of other things.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	Many times a fish bone or some other thing gets stuck in the throat/esophagus.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then you must extract what is apparent from these, on which your sight falls, after you depress the tongue with an instrument in front of the sun, so that what is in the throat can be revealed to you. 
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And that which does not appear and is hidden from you in the throat/esophagus, you must make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because very easily the thing attached to the throat/esophagus will be expelled by vomit; or have the patient swallow a piece of turnip or a lettuce stem or a mouthful of dry bread; or take a piece of dry sea sponge, and tie it tightly with thread, and then have the patient swallow it, because when it comes to the place in which the thorns are, and it is pulled out, then they are expelled.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	And further, take an eel, tie it with thread, and insert it inside and suddenly pull it out; or take a leek, insert it suddenly, and suddenly withdraw it. 
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	But if they are not expelled by these things which we have mentioned, then use a lead instrument according to this form/shape:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And let it be a little thicker than a ray (fish), and at its end let there be a concavity which you insert into their throat with ease.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And let him/her hold his/her head elevated upwards, and be careful that you touch his/her throat bone, lest he/she be harmed, and with that you push the bone or the thorn, or the physician places it with his hand.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	But it is better that the patient insert it themselves, because of their knowledge of the location of the attached object, and push it down, and pull their hand with the instrument upwards, all this according to the prepared quantity until it is expelled.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter 39.
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of a leech attached to the throat/gullet.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When a leech is medicated with what we have said in the section on healing with medicines and it does not come off, then observe the patient's throat/gullet in the sunlight, after you have compressed their tongue with the instrument that we have recommended to you.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Then, if you see the leech, extract it with a small hook or with gentle, appropriate movements/gestures.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if it is not possible for you to extract it with that, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the patient's throat/gullet, and then place a heated iron in the cavity of the cannula, and do this as many times (until the leech is dead and detaches from the throat/gullet) and the patient should abstain from water all day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a glass full of cold water, and have him open his mouth over it, and wash his mouth with it; and do not swallow any of it, and pour the water with your hand, hour after hour, because the leech falls off as soon as it senses the water. 
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not expelled by what we have recommended, then fumigate the patient with zedoary or with asafoetida using the instrument that we have recommended for the fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, and it will fall out.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And there is another method of operating with fumigation for this: you take a pot in which there are burning coals and the pot is covered with a lid in the middle of which there is a hole, and the end of the instrument is placed in that hole; and then the fumigation should be added on top; and have the patient put his mouth at the end of the cannula, and close his mouth so that the fumigation is not expelled until you know that the fumigation has reached the leech, for the leech will immediately fall out. 
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not fall out, then you repeat the fumigation many times, and have the patient abstain from drinking, and have him eat salty things and garlic, and not drink water, and thus it is necessary that with this regimen it will be expelled.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument with which a leech is extracted from the throat when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps as you see, except that there is some curvature in it:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	which is placed in the throat, and the end of it is similar to a stork's beak, which is toothed, and roughened with a file, so that, when it grasps something, it does not let go.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40.
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the discussion on opening abscesses and their incision.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are of many types, in many ways, as mentioned for each of them in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their perforation and incision in two ways, one of which is by the type of abscess itself; and by the humors it contains.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is due to the locations in the body in which they occur, for an abscess occurring in the head is different from an abscess occurring in the buttock; and an abscess occurring in a fleshy area is different from an abscess occurring in a joint; and each of them has its own treatment by surgery. 
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And further, there are some abscesses which should not be perforated except near the maturation of the pus within them or their completion.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	There are other abscesses which should be lanced when they are raw, and not matured to their completion, such as abscesses that are near the joints, because when an abscess occurs near a joint, its being is prolonged until it can putrefy what is around it, and very quickly the ligaments or nerves of that joint are corrupted, which causes contraction of that limb; or it is an abscess near a principal member, and if you delay lancing it until it is matured it will harm the principal member; or it is near the anus, then lance it immature; and you should not lance it raw, of incomplete digestion, except the one that is near the anus, so that its core does not putrefy and be elongated to the parts inside the anus, and become a fistula, or that it result in a condition that is not healed.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But you should know the time to lance the abscess, and that is when it is matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that it is matured when the pain and fever cease, and near the decrease of redness and throbbing, and the sharpness of the head of the abscess, and the other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And because it is necessary that you know the perforation should fall in the lowest place of the abscess and where it is most conducive to healing from the swelling. 
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the lancing should always be along the length of the flesh or body, if the abscesses are in the parts of the hands or feet, and in the area of the muscles, tendons, or arteries; and, lastly, in all similar places where there is no bending; because in those that are bent, use lancing appropriate to that limb.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy place, it is better to leave it unlanced until its digestion is fully confirmed, as we have said; for if you lance it before that, the course of its pus and much filth is prolonged, and its edges harden very easily, as does its depth.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some abscesses are lanced across the width of the flesh or body out of necessity, or according to the needs of the limb.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should make a small incision for small abscesses, and a large and wide incision or multiple incisions for large abscesses according to the variation in the size of the abscesses.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And there are other abscesses in which the skin must be held concave and incised, when it is made like bread and made at the point that it already protrudes, as happens with many furuncles and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And some of these are incised with a three-angled incision; and of these there are some which are incised in the shape of a myrtle leaf, such as abscesses in the corners (of the eye/mouth?).
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of them there are some in which a round or crescent-shaped incision, and similar ones, is used.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But one which is not like these superficial erysipelas abscesses, you should incise with only a superficial, or flat, incision.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And it is necessary when the abscess is large and has already collected much pus, that you lance it and do not worry about extracting all the pus at that time; having extracted some of it, then cover the abscess until the next day, and then extract a larger amount, and then do this many times gradually until it is all drained. 
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of a cold nature, or a pregnant woman, or a small child, or an old decrepit person, because the vital spirit is often dissolved with the outflow of the pus, and the patient dies very easily, and you are to blame.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore, observe this chapter with great care, and then the incision in which you lance these abscesses, you must clean the wounds and then consider if the wound of the abscess is small, or is a flat incision, then you apply lint or old cotton; and if the abscess is large, and the openings of the incision are many, then you must place a wick in each hole until they join together. 
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a part of the skin is cut off or you have hollowed it out in the surrounding area, then you must fill it with old cotton or thread made from linen cloth, as when you have extracted bits of cloth or roots, without moisture; and bind it until the third day; and then proceed and treat it with the appropriate ointments until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if bleeding occurs during your operation, then you apply cold water and sour wine in which you soak a linen cloth, and place it over the site of the bleeding many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding persists, then you must administer the regimen and treatment and powders which I have described in many places of this our book and section.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in winter, and the location of the abscess is a place of many nerves, then you should soak powders in warm wine and oil, and place them over the areas. 
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the areas are fleshy, then you must place powders soaked with water and oil or with wine and oil, and all of this should be cold until the third day, as we have said, and then you should loosen the abscess and cleanse it and apply in its treatment what is suitable for it until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the treatment of abscesses generally, but following the method of distinction I have already spoken about each abscess in what manner is the way of its treatment by individual chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the incision of abscesses which occur in the back of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	On the back of the head, small abscesses, specifically nodes, which contain tunics that are made for them; and their types are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And among them are pimples, and of those there are some that contain a moisture resembling file dust.  (This likely refers to a gritty or viscous pus).
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And among them are some which contain a moisture resembling dust, and similar to them; and among them are some that are stone-like, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the incision of all, and in the extraction of these there is no danger, as long as the removal of these does not go against an artery.  (i.e., as long as you don't cut an artery).
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in incising these is that you probe them with an instrument, the shape of which is seen here, which is called a probe/lancet, until you know what it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what it contains is moisture, then you cut it with an incision along its length by a superficial cut according to this shape/manner:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begin the incision from the line B to the line G. Then when the moisture is evacuated, you excoriate/scrape that skin which contained the moisture, and leave nothing of it at all, for it returns too often, if anything of it remains.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then submerge/soak cotton in Egyptian ointment, if it is available, and if not, in water and salt; and fill the wound with this and leave it until the next day, for with this you will corrode all that remains of that pellicle/membrane/thin skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then repeat with the cotton and Egyptian ointment a second and third time if you need to, until you are confident that nothing of that pellicle/membrane remains; then treat the wound with ointment until it is healed. 
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the abscess/boil contains fatty lumps/nodes, then you incise/cut it in this manner/shape:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with an incision having the shape of a cross, and place hooks between the two lips/edges of the incision and peel/strip it from all sides, and exert your strength in extracting the tunic/membrane which contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if it offers resistance to you, then do what I told you first/initially. 
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, do the same for the hardened/calcified abscess regarding incision and treatment as we have told you; and incision on a hardened/calcified abscess is easier, for it has little blood and little moisture/fluid.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are some of these abscesses which are in the head in some men, in which there is no moisture at all; which is why I incised an abscess on the head of an old woman and found the abscess like a dull, rough, white stone, which could not be broken, and if someone were to be struck with it, it would cause injury.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in other abscesses occurring in the head, other than this one, this chapter does not apply, such as the abscesses that come on the heads of children behind the roots of the ears, but the incision of all of these should be a superficial incision.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And place the perforation of these on their lowest part so that the body may be relieved of the corrupted blood/pus at the lowest points.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then treat them with that which is appropriate for their healing/treatment.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the incision of scrofula which occurs in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these abscesses occur in the neck and in the armpits and in the groin/elbows; and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck, there are many that are generated among them, and every scrofulous tumor of these is within its own tunic/membrane, just like in the nodes and abscesses of the head, as we have recounted.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the types of these scrofulas are many, for some of them are stone-like, and some of them contain humors/fluids, and some of them are malignant which do not respond to treatment/cure. 
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in the one that you find of good disposition by touch, whose apparent color is close to the color of skin, and is movable in every part, and is not attached to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the trachea/windpipe, and is not deep, it is necessary that you incise it with a superficial cut from the upper part to the lower part of the body along the line G between the line B, and flay/peel it on all sides, and extend the lips of the skin with a hook, or with many hooks if you need them, just as we have said about the abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more prudent that the vein or nerve not be incised/cut.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the scalpel/blade not be too sharp, lest you injure your hand with the incision, or disturb the patient, and cut what is not necessary to cut; for if you incise a vein or artery and are hindered from your work, then place on the wound ground vitriol or other powders which stop the flow of blood, and constrict the wound, and leave it until the acuteness of the abscess subsides and the wound is softened and begins to suppurate/drain pus.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is cut off/stopped.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Then return to your operation until you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire with your finger/probe whether there remains any matter from the other small scrofula/swollen glands, then incise them and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if there is a large vein at the root of the scrofula, it is necessary then that you do not incise that scrofula at its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	First, it is necessary that you tie it with doubled thread tightly and that you leave it until it falls off by itself without harm/injury.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old cotton which you have already submerged in Egyptian ointment, and then treat it/dress it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you incise the entire scrofula, then it is necessary that you bring together the two lips of the wound and sew them immediately as long as there is no superfluity/excess remaining.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that some superfluity/excess remains due to the size of the scrofula, it is necessary that you try to incise the root of it, and extract it and administer sutures as has been said/described.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And those scrofulas that contain humors, perforate them with a superficial perforation where it appears to you to be the place of its maturation, and place the perforation in the lowest part of the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer perforation, cauterize with ointment and similar things, so that it corrodes what remains of the corruption/infection.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound is already cleansed, then you treat it with flesh-generating ointment until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter 43.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the incision of the hair of the abscess occurring/incident within the throat/gullet.  (The "hair" likely refers to a thin surgical instrument or a type of thread/suture.)
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients discussed this incision in the epiglottis/uvula, but no one in our land has seen it done.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the writing/transcription of their discourse/words.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men having quinsy/tonsillitis, the removal/extraction of the epiglottis/uvula must be avoided, as no benefit is derived from it because all the veins, including the major ones of the patient, are located there. 
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have hot abscesses in the mouth or throat or both ears, when the illness is not in the trachea/windpipe, the incision of the epiglottis/uvula should be used to avoid death, which would be caused by suffocation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we wish to do this, we should incise the epiglottis/uvula below three or four of its rings/circular ridges, with a small incision, widthwise, between two rings, so that the incision is superficial, not in the cartilage, and this place is suitable for incision, because it is devoid of flesh and the blood vessels are distant from it.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the physician is timid/fearful, then he should stretch the neck/throat skin with a hook, and then cut the skin until he reaches the canal/trachea, but avoid the blood vessels if he sees any sign of them.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then incise superficially as we have described; and the incision of the trachea/windpipe is indicated by the breath which comes out of it along with what is broken off from it, and by the loss of voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Then when the swelling/crisis has subsided, at which time perforation is feared, rejoin the two edges of the skin of the wound, and sew only that without the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that promote flesh growth until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis said that the summary of the discussion we have recounted is simply that you should see that some of these abscesses/swellings have already obstructed the patient's throat, and the patient is near death, and their breathing is cut off, and some go to incise the epiglottis so that the patient can breathe through the site of the wound, somewhat, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this reason they recommend leaving the wound open until the harmful matter of the disease has been consumed/expelled; and its harmfulness lasts for three days; and then they recommend sewing up the wound and treating it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I myself have seen is that a maidservant took a knife and put it to her throat and cut with it a part of the trachea/windpipe, and I was called to treat her, and I found her as silent as the dead, and I uncovered the wound and found the blood that had come out of the wound was minimal/slow.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Then I was assured that she had not cut a vein or artery, and the air was coming out of the wound, and I treated her until she was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And nothing happened to the maidservant except hoarseness in her voice, and after a few days she returned to a better state / recovered.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the cutting/incision of the epiglottis there is no danger/fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter 44.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	On incision/cutting upon a swelling/abscess which occurs on the throat externally, and is called a hernia of the throat/goiter.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This swelling/abscess called a hernia of the throat/goiter is a large swelling similar to the color of the body, and is common in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is of two kinds, for it is either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And the natural kind is not appropriate/necessary to treat/cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental kind is of two types, of which one is similar to fatty lumps/nodes, and the other type is similar to a swelling which is caused by a knotting/dilation of an artery, and in that one there is danger/cause for concern.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And it is not appropriate to treat/operate on it with iron/a knife except in the one that is small. 
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you probe it and examine it with your finger, and if you find it similar to fatty nodes, and it is not attached to any of the veins, then you incise it just like the nodes, and remove it with what it contains from the skin and sac/cyst; and if not, then its entire nature is examined, and then treat the area with the appropriate treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the incision/cutting of the types of lumps/nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are many types of nodes, and I have already mentioned all their types in the division/classification.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And it is necessary that I recount the difference between a node and a growth/protuberance, as it may cause doubt/confusion.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, I say that with a growth/protuberance there is heat and fever and vehement pains until the boiling/inflammation of the superfluity/excess is calmed; and when putrefaction is complete, then the fever, the pain, and the heat cease. 
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But with a node there is no heat nor fever nor pain, and take as an example the lipoma/fatty cyst which is in its own sac/cyst. 
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is the same color as the body, and its beginning is like a pea and it forms like a blister, be it larger or smaller, and they [nodes] are of two types, for either they are fatty and contain moisture, and the colors of the moisture are many, as I said in the classification.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, it is necessary, when you come to the treatment of a node, that you examine/explore it and investigate it at the beginning with an instrument which is called a probe/sound, according as its form will appear in the chapter which is next/follows this one.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And the manner of examining abscesses and all nodes is this: that you take this instrument and insert it in the most humid place which you find in the abscess, and you will turn your fingers with it little by little until you know that the instrument has penetrated the skin/membrane.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then spread out your hand according to the size of the abscess, and then remove the probe and consider what has come out in its track/groove.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the moisture is ejected in a stream/flowing, whatever color it may be, then you incise it with a superficial incision as I have said about other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if no moisture comes from the track of the probe, then know that it is fat/a fatty tumor.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And cut on it with an incision in the shape of a cross like this:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	as I have taught you, and lift it with hooks, and peel the skin on all sides with ease, and keep the skin or sac, if you can, over it and draw out that infected blood with the knot.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is ruptured during the operation, it is not possible to extract that infected blood, and this happens many times, and then you remove it in pieces until nothing of it remains.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	Because if any of it remains, little or much, the node will return according to the most/the larger part (that remains).
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that some small part of it remains, then fill the wound with some sharp corrosive powders and bind the wound, and place over it something to absorb the discharge/pus, and treat it with the other treatment until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large node/growth, then you sew its two edges/lips and treat it with something that promotes flesh growth.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if there is a pulsating vein in the opposite direction, or a non-pulsating one, then you must burn and fill the place with ground vitriol and bind it tightly for two or three days until the wound putrefies and the boiling of the blood subsides; and then return to incise what remains of the node.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter 46.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	Of the forms of instruments necessary for incision and perforation.
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	Of these are the forms of the scalpels, and they are of three kinds: some are large, some are medium, and some are small.

La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:	The shape of a medium scalpel is this:

Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.	They are made of iron or steel, with suitably squared ends, so that they facilitate entry into abscesses. 
E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	And these are the shapes of the probes/lancets, and they are called albereds [possibly a type of surgical instrument], and one of them is called a berid [likely another surgical instrument].
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	And they are of three types, because of their size: large, medium and small.

La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The shape of a medium probe/lancet, its form:

Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	It is fitting that they be used for these abscesses and ulcers and fistulas and buboes, especially those that are among the bones and from other causes. 
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And they are made round, thick, smooth, like large needles with which saddles are sewn, and they are made of yellow brass, or of brass or of iron, or of silver. And the best are when they are made of yellow brass.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	And probes are made of black lead, which are suitable for opening fistulas in the cavities of which there are twists/turns, so that they can be reflected with their flexibility within those twists/turns.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	And they are of three kinds, for some of them are long, and others medium, and others short, according to the size of the width of the fistula and its narrowness.
Forma del experient gran de plom:	The form of the large lead probe:
Forma del experient migier de plom:	The form of the medium lead probe:
Forma del experient petit de plom:	The form of the small lead probe:
Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.	The shapes of the hooks are of many kinds, for some of them are simple, having only one curve, and they are of three kinds: large, small and medium.
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	And of these are sharp hooks, and they are of three kinds. 
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And of these are hooks having two curves, and they are of three kinds.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And of these are some having three curves, and they are of three kinds.
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	And all of these are necessary in their place.

Forma de unci simple migier:	The form of a simple medium hook:
Forma de unci simple pauc, forma de lu:	The form of a simple small hook, its shape:

Forma de unci orp migier, forma de lu:	The form of a medium hook for removing bone fragments (or a medium bone hook), its shape:
Forma de unci orp pauc, forma de lu:	The form of a small hook for removing bone fragments (or a small bone hook), its shape:
Forma de unci gran havent dos curvaturas:	The form of a large hook having two curvatures:
Forma de unci migier havent dos curvatas:	The form of a medium hook having two curvatures:
Forma de unci pauc havent dos curvaturas:	The form of a small hook having two curvatures:
Forma de unci gran havent tres curvaturas:	The form of a large hook having three curvatures:
Forma de unci migier havent tres curvaturas:	The form of a medium hook having three curvatures:
Forma de unci pauc havent tres curvaturas:	The form of a small hook having three curvatures:
E aquestas so las formas dels scalpels am les quals son seccatz e scorjatz les nodes e le apostemas, e so de tres specias, quar de aquels es gran, migier, e pauc.	And these are the shapes of the scalpels with which the nodes and abscesses are dried and scraped, and they are of three types, because of them there is large, medium, and small.
Forma de scapel gran:	Shape of a large scalpel:
Forma del scapel migier:	Shape of a medium scalpel:
Forma de scapel pauc:	Shape of a small scalpel:
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The ends of these with which the incision is made are sharp and the other ends are blunt, and they are not positioned in such a way, but so that the fear of incising a vein or nerve may be easily avoided in the scraping of the nodes, and by these the patient may be healed and find a little tranquility through the burning which comes after the scraping of the abscess.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	And these are the shapes of lancets, and they are of three kinds: large, medium, and small, as you will see.
La forma de magda gran:	The shape of a large lancet:
Forma de magda migier:	The shape of a medium lancet:
Forma de magda pauc:	The shape of a small lancet:
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	They are made of brass and are similar to a ray with which alcofol is made.  (Note: "alcofol" likely refers to a distilled liquid, possibly alcohol used for medicinal purposes.)
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And it has at its pointed end a hidden blade, and in that it runs to the parts inside and outside, when you want, as you see. (This likely describes the retractable blade of the lancet.)
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The shapes of blades, which are hidden among the aforementioned, divide [or are used for] the perforation of abscesses, and the patients do not perceive them, and they are of three types: large, medium, and small.
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	And these are their shapes:
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The shapes of cupping glasses with which the flow of blood is cut off, and they are of three types: large, medium, and small; their shapes:
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	Let them be made of yellow copper, round with some length, and let them be thin/fine.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And it is necessary that you have these types of cupping glasses: large, medium, and small, so that with them you may quickly cut off the flow of blood in times of need, even when at first you have no medicine/remedy.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use them to cut off blood in every part of the body, and use them only in fleshy places, such as in the calves of the legs and thighs, and in the muscles of the arms, and of the breasts and of the belly and of the buttocks, and similar fleshy and moist areas.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And sometimes other small instruments are made from these, resembling the peels of figs, according to this form/manner; by which the blood is cut off when it is done by phlebotomy, either by incision of a vein or of an artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes they are made round according to this form/manner:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the treatment of men's breasts which resemble those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes the nipples of some men are swollen by the fulfillment of sleep when they begin to be hairy, and then their nipples are swollen, and become similar to the breasts of women, and remain apostematous (infected with pus), ugly.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And to him who has this, it is necessary to incise them with a crescent-shaped incision in this manner, from the line B to the line G, and then excise all the thickness/growth, and then fill the wound with incarnative (flesh-forming) medicine, and then join the two lips of the wound with sutures, and treat it until it is healed. 
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the nipple hangs down and is softened by its size as happens in women, then it should be split on both sides above, with two incisions similar to a crescent moon shape, each of which is contained within the other after the end of each one, so that the larger line contains the smaller one in this way, from line B and line G.  And then excise the flesh which is between the two edges of the wound, and remove the fat, and administer what we have said about the suture and the powders that are necessary in the treatment until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision of what should be incised because of the restlessness of the patient, and because of blood flow, then it is necessary that you fill the wound with cotton submerged in corrosive ointment and leave it there until it corrodes what remains of the fat, and then treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	On the perforation/lancing of abscesses that come under the armpit/in the axilla.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that occur under the armpit are of the type of scrofula, hard, which contain a skin/membrane that is like a sac.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And of these there are some that contain fluids/humidity; and those that contain fluids must be incised with a crescent-shaped incision according to this figure: from the line G to the line B. And when all that is in the abscess of pus/infected matter is evacuated, then you fill it with old cotton/lint and leave it until the next day. 
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then the cotton/lint should be removed and it should be treated with a suitable ointment until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess is of the type of nodes/lumps, and of scrofula, then you cut/lance it as we have said in the section on scrofula, in the same way.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	But if the plague/infection is spread out so that putrefaction emerges/occurs, then administer cautery to it as we have said previously about this.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the cutting/lancing of abscesses that occur because of an artery or vein. 
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured, and the skin/tissue over it has healed/closed, then many times an abscess occurs. And the signs by which it is known that inflammation and abscess are due to the artery or vein are these: for when the abscess is due to an artery, it is long, aggregated in the depth of the body; and when you press the abscess with your fingers, you feel a sort of whistling/creaking/crackling sound in it.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is due to a vein is round on the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And cutting/lancing this abscess is a mistake, especially in those that are under the armpits, and in the elbows, and in the neck, and in many places of the body; and it is very large, therefore its treatment with iron (surgical instruments) must be avoided, and that which is in the extremities, or on the head, should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.
