But on that which is there because of swelling of the opening of the artery, you will make a long incision in the skin/tissue; and then open the incision with hooks and [find] the artery, and free it from the membranes/tunics until it is exposed/uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then put a needle on it and make it penetrate through to the other side, and tie the artery with a double thread in two places,—which procedure I have shown you in the extraction of the two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then puncture the place which is between the two ligatures with a spatula/blade until all the blood that is in it comes out, and the abscess is dissolved/drained.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer a treatment in which pepper is generated/used until the ligatures fall off; and then treat it with ointments suitable for this until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess due to a cut vein, then you must hold with your hand as much as possible of the abscess along with the skin, and then insert the needle under the area which you have held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and let there be a double thread in it until you pull it from the other side, and then tie the abscess with a good ligature as I have told you in the tying of a grape in two parts with two ends of the thread. 
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you are afraid that the thread will come out, then insert the thread with the needle under the whole abscess near the incision of the first needle, and tie your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in its middle area so that when what is in it has come out, you then cut the excess skin, and leave that which is tied.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then put on it a powder which you have soaked in wine and oil, and then administer the treatment which is made with socks/bandages and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter L (50) of the abscess which occurs because of a twisted/sprained nerve.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as an abscess occurs in an artery and in a vein, similarly an abscess occurs in the nerves when there is an impact on them or occurs through excessive work, and similar things.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is done most often in the areas of the joints or the heel, or in any place in which the joints are strained/moved.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a serious abscess, and it is similar to the color of the other flesh, and it is without notable features/manifestations most of the time, and when it is pressed forcefully, the patient feels a sort of numbness in it.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And the abscess is not joined/fixed to the surrounding flesh, and because of this it is beneath the skin, and it can be moved in every direction and it does not go to the areas in front or behind. 
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, those [abscesses] that are in the joints should not be invaded with iron (i.e., surgically treated), for contraction would very easily follow.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But [for] that which is on the head or on the forehead, split the skin with a spatula/spatula-shaped knife. 
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then grasp it with forceps and cut it out by the roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then you lift it with a hook, and peel/excise it, and then stop/stanch [the bleeding]; and close the wound with sutures, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 51 (or 50 if using a zero-based numbering system).
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	On the incision of an abscess which occurs from a hernia that occurs in the belly/abdomen. 
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	It happens to some men many times in their bellies and in other parts of their bodies that growths appear which are called fungals due to their similarity to fungi/mushrooms, whose roots are thin and the head/top of which is large; and sometimes their edges are inverted/turned inward, and there are those that are small, and there are those that are very large/magnified.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one, and in his belly there were two growths which were more similar to fungi/mushrooms, and there was no difference between those white ones, of slender roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And their edges were inverted/rolled inward and split/cracked, and moisture flowed from it constantly.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Then I incised them and found in one approximately eighteen ounces in weight and the other approximately six ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the procedure for their incision is that you consider then if the patient is humid/has excess moisture, and the color of the growth is white, moist, of thin roots; then you incise it with a broad spatula/knife, and have cauteries in the fire in your presence, because many times much blood is expelled from its cut; and if blood comes to you, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient weak and fearful, refrain from incising with iron/a knife; but then take recently made white lead (lead carbonate), and constrict/bind the growth with it, in the manner which we have described; and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And next tighten the stricture of the lead wire/thread; then, do not cease tightening the lead a great deal against the growth, until it is severed and falls off by itself without effort/intervention.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the growth has thick roots, then in its incision there is some cause for fear and anxiety, and especially in the one that is in the abdomen/belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you incise half of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then treat it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to presume to incise a growth which is dark colored, with little feeling, and of hard consistency/texture, for that one is truly cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will return with a discussion of cancer after this.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the treatment of umbilical hernia/protrusion. (Literally: Of the treatment of eminence of the navel)
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	An umbilical hernia is caused by many reasons; either by fissures of the peritoneum (ciphhac) which is over the abdomen, and from there the tissues or intestines emerge as occurs in other ruptures; or by blood which flows from a vein or artery as previously stated, or by trapped wind/gas.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is due to a fissure of the peritoneum and protrusion of the tissue, then the color of the swelling is similar to the body's color; and it is smooth without pain, and appears in different locations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is due to a protrusion of the intestine, then the appearance of that is, compared to what we have described, more vehemently different, and when you press it with your fingers it is hidden, and then returns; and it is very sensitive to the touch, and it becomes much larger after bathing and strenuous activity/work. 
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is caused by fluid/humidity, then it is smooth and is not hidden when pressed with your hand, nor is it constricted, nor does it make a gurgling sound (crepitus).
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is caused by blood, then with these signs the swelling appears, tending toward black.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is caused by dead flesh, then the swelling is heavy, large and hard, and is fixed in one spot/position/size.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is caused by flatulence, then its touch is smooth.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the procedure for it is that you consider then if the protrusion of the navel is due to blood from an artery, or from a vein, or from flatulence; then you must refrain from treating it, because in that case there is danger and fear, just as I taught you in the chapter in which I discussed swellings/abscesses of arteries and veins.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the protrusion of the navel is due to the intestine or the membrane/tissue, then you must order the patient to hold his breath, and stand upright/extended; then probe with a  probe around the entire navel, and then order him to stand facing you between your hands upon his feet, and then wrap broad bandages around the navel over the place you probed; and then extend/pull out half of the swelling upwards with a large hook; and then tie/bind it around with strong thread or silk, and tie it up properly.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then open the middle of the extended swelling above the binding and insert your finger into that opening and search for the intestine; and if you have found it or secured it with the binding, then you must pull softly/carefully and push the intestine back into the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the membrane/tissue, then take it with a hook; and cut away its excess/superfluous parts.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if you encounter an artery or vein, then avoid/go around that area, and then return to your procedure; and take two needles and thread them with strong thread and insert the two needles around the area that you have made around the swelling in the form of a cross, making them penetrate; and then constrict the swelling in four places over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and leave the area until the stretched flesh rots and falls off by itself; or cut it when it has thinned and rotted, and then treat it with the appropriate ointments until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the swelling of the navel is from flesh growing there or from moisture/fluid, then you must drain the swelling as we have said and remove the blood or fluid, which you find there, and then treat it with what is necessary and what will strengthen/heal the area.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53.
De curacio de cranc.	On the treatment of cancer/gangrene. (The word "cranc" could refer to either depending on the context.)
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already discussed, in the section on types of cancer/gangrene, how it can be treated with medicines, and that treatment with iron (surgical instruments) should be avoided so that it does not ulcerate; and we have discussed cancer/gangrene generated in the breast and precautions for its treatment.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes cancer/gangrene is in a place where its eradication is possible, such as cancer/gangrene which is in the breasts or in the thigh and in similar members, [and they recommended] to remove it all, especially when it is small and just beginning. 
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, you should not attempt it, for I could not heal any such case, nor have I seen another who has, nor [anyone who] has achieved this.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation, when it is indicated as we have said, is that you should first prepare and bleed the patient and purge him of black bile sometimes, and then bleed him, if a manifest plethora is found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient with the appropriate preparation in which surgery is involved, and then insert into the hole hooks which are suitable for it; and then excavate on all sides with the scalpel, carefully searching until no trace of its roots remains.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow, and do not stop it lightly, and press the areas, and wipe away all the thick blood with your hand or with a suitable instrument.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if you encounter troublesome bleeding from a vein or artery incision, then cauterize it until the flow of blood has ceased, and then treat it with other appropriate treatment until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 54.
De curacio de ydropici.	On the treatment of dropsy (edema/swelling).
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recounted, in the division (of the subject), the types of dropsy/edema caused by water, and the signs of each type, (and) its treatment with medicines. 
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And the one that is treated with iron (surgical instruments) is only the type called ascites, and  treatment with iron instruments is not applied to tympanites nor to anasarca, because that is fatal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this type of dropsy, tympanites, with medicines and your treatment is not effective, then consider, for if the patient is already weakened, or has another disease in addition to dropsy, such as a cough or stomach ailment and similar things, then refrain from treating with iron (surgical instruments), because it is dangerous.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient is of robust constitution, and has no other disease but dropsy alone, and is neither a child nor old, then the manner of the operation is that you lift the patient between your hands, and an assistant should press his belly with his hand, pushing the water to the area below the navel, and then take a pointed spatula shaped like this:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	It should be long, sharpened on both sides, with a pointed tip like a spatula; but however, let there be a slight, gradual shortness in it, so that during the operation you do not penetrate the intestine with it and injure it. 
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider if the accumulation of dropsy is on the side of the intestines, for then it is necessary that you distance yourself with the incision from the navel by the amount of three fingers in the area below, to his right, above the groin. 
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the accumulation of dropsy is due to a disease of the liver, then your incision should be three fingers to the left of the navel.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the accumulation is caused by the spleen, then your incision should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And your incision must not be on the side on which the patient intends to lie, so that the excess fluids do not flow to that cold place.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then pierce the entire skin with the instrument, and then insert it into that incision, and lift your hand with the spatula between the skin and the peritoneum (abdominal membrane), and you will scrape it; about the size of a fingernail or thereabouts.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the peritoneum until the spatula reaches the empty space, where the water is.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then remove it and insert an instrument of this shape: 
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it is similar to a thin silver cannula; it is made of silver or brass or latten, which has a small hole in its lower part, and three holes on its sides: two on one side and one on the other; and its end is sharpened like a pen, as you see:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at its top end is a small ring, for when the instrument reaches the water, you immediately pull on the instrument via the ring, thus evacuating a moderate amount of the water at a time, for if you evacuate more than necessary at once, the patient may quickly die from the depletion of their animal spirit, or they may suffer syncope, which is near death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate it according to the patient's strength and as indicated by the patient's condition, the strength of their pulse, and their general well-being.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then remove the instrument, and stop the flow of water, which is immediately stopped by the string which blocks the hole above the nape of the neck, which I told you to pierce in that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then repeat the procedure the next day if you see the patient tolerating it, and remove a small amount of the water, and do this carefully for several days, and beware of making a mistake until only a little of the water remains.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear for the patient, and leave a large amount of water, then treat them by burying them in hot sand, and frequent sweating in a bath, and waiting in the sun for a long time; and treat them with desiccative medicines until they are healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize over the stomach, spleen, and liver after the extraction of the water, as I have described previously.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter 55.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	On the treatment of children born without openings for urine.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes a child is born from its mother's womb without the opening of its urethra being perforated (or the hole is narrow, or not in its proper place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, one must seek to perforate it as soon as it is born with a very subtle probe, in the following manner:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then place in the hole a thin lead nail and tie it, and keep it for three or four days. 
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when it wants to urinate, it should be removed so it can urinate; and then put it back. 
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you don't put the lead in, it is possible that the urine, which goes over the area, will not allow it to close. (Implying: ...will not allow the perforation to remain open/heal properly.)
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But one whose opening is narrow should be treated with a lead nail, as we have said, for several days until it is widened/enlarged.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in whom the opening is not in its proper place, are called hypospadias, which occurs when the opening is located beneath the tip of the penis, so that he cannot urinate downwards, until he lifts the penis with his hand upwards; and he is not able to procreate, because the semen cannot reach the womb directly, and it is a very serious condition.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of the operation on him is that the patient should be laid on his back, and then stretch the tip of his penis with your left hand using strong traction, and incise the very tip of the penis at the location of the prepuce with a sharp knife, like the cut of a pen, or as if you were shaving away a portion, so that the middle of it becomes similar to the tip of the penis and so that the opening falls in the middle where it should be. 
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And beware of blood flow during your operation, because this happens often; and stop it by whatever means stops the bleeding, and treat the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter 56.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	About phimosis, which occurs in the prepuce at the tip of the penis and involves corruption, blackness, and adhesion of the prepuce to the glans penis.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	This phimosis often occurs in the penis and is a growth of loose flesh.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And of this, one kind is malignant and the other is non-malignant (benign).
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	For the benign kind, you should lift it with a thin hook and cut it off until it is completely removed; then apply tow soaked in Egyptian ointment; and then treat it with diafinicon ointment until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the phimosis is malignant, of a dark/livid color, then you must apply cautery near the incision and its base/root.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.	But if the phimosis is in the foreskin of the head of an uncircumcised penis, and one part of the phimosis is inside the foreskin and the other part is outside, then you must remove the phimosis that is inside first, until it is healed/firm; and then you treat the outside part, because when you treat it at the same time as the foreskin, there's a risk that it might tear. 
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And if blackness and decay also occur in the genitals and foreskin, then you must scrape all that has blackened and is decaying or already corrupted; and then spread over it a mixture of honey, ground pomegranate peel, and crushed and sifted orris root (iris).
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And then treat it with the other medication until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if there is a flow of blood, then apply lunar caustic (silver nitrate) as follows:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Because beneficial cautery has two uses together, that is for the flow of blood and for the wound when it is infected/decaying.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the tip of the penis is corroded and completely destroyed, then you must insert a lead cannula into the opening of the foreskin so that the patient can urinate through it.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the foreskin to the glans penis (and this adhesion does not happen except in one whose foreskin is intact, and upon whom circumcision is not required; and when adhesion happens from a wound or from an abscess), it is necessary that you scrape with a blunt instrument until the ligament is dissolved and the glans penis is released from every part.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to distinguish them precisely, then you must scrape some part of the glans penis and the foreskin with a blunt instrument, and this is because the foreskin, when it is thin, is very easily perforated due to its thinness.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And then separate between the foreskin and the glans penis with a thin cloth, which has already been soaked in cold water so that they do not adhere again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then let it be treated with a styptic solution until it is healed.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter 57.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	On the cleansing of children and the treatment of what happens to them from circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a break in continuity like other wounds: but rather, since it is of our doing and of our will, and it is performed specifically on children, it is necessary that we assign to it a better and gentler procedure leading to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore, I say that the ancients did not discuss circumcision in any of their books, because they do not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired it through experience, which is why I have found the majority of surgeons and barbers using circumcision and cleansing with a razor and with forceps; and they use binding with bile and incision with the fingernail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have tried all these methods and I did not find better cleansing with forceps, with binding with bile than cleansing with the fingernail, because many times it avoids the skin underneath, since the foreskin has two layers, and the lower layer remains, and it is very easily forced to another incision and certain pain. 
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And with the cleansing which is done by a cautery, and is finger-shaped, which cobblers use, the incision of the tip of the penis is not safe, because it easily enters its opening.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the procedure with the fingernail, you very easily encounter resistance and ruin your work/procedure.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the foreskin of the child is short by nature, and many times it is born in such a way that it does not need cleansing, and I have seen this.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But regarding the cleansing that is done with forceps and binding with bile, experience has revealed its goodness to me, because the forceps are of proportional incision, because the sharpness that is on top is like the sharpness that is underneath; and thus when you press your hand, two sharpnesses are proportioned, and they cut according to a comparison at one time; and compression is made by the bile with a figure containing the foreskin of the penis on all sides, with which you completely avoid error.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first procedure is that you have the child—especially if he is one of those who understands a little—held still, so that you do nothing but tie the bile to his penis only, and leave it until the next day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then make him happy in every way that you can, in a manner he understands. 
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then have him held firmly between your hands, and don't hesitate; and hide the forceps in your hand or under your foot, so that the child does not see them, nor any of the other instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then put your hand to his penis and blow into the foreskin, and pull it back until the head of the penis has emerged, and then cleanse it of any dirt that has accumulated there.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the marked place with doubled thread, and then tie a second knot a little below it, and then hold the said penis firmly and indicate the location to be cut between the two knots and make an incision.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then gently lift the foreskin and expose the head of the penis; and then let the blood flow little by little, for it is better; and apply powder on top, and over the powder place a cloth on which has been spread egg yolk cooked in rose water with fresh good rose oil; and leave it on until the next day; and treat it with dressings until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The form of the forceps for cleansing, this is the form:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Let one end be blunt and the other sharp, so that the nail's root is not extracted, and let the length of the two sharp points be equal to the length of the two handles.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the error in cleansing is that you might too easily remove the inner foreskin, completely, or part of it near the incision.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore it is necessary that you stretch it with your fingernail, away from the swelling of the area, and then incise it evenly. 
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your fingernail, then draw it out with a hook and incise it.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if three days have passed, and the swelling remains under the penis after it has become infected, then you leave it until the inflammation subsides, and the skin peels easily, and then incise it as you have been instructed. 
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And beware of the head of the penis, because that would not be good for it/him. (The pronoun "lu" can refer to both the penis and the patient.)
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And then treat it with the consolidating wound powder which we have described in the treatise on powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is incised from the buttock excessively, and you follow the aforementioned steps, this will not harm it/him. (Again, "lu" likely refers to either the buttock area or the patient.)
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	And then continue to treat it as we have described until it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter 58.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	On the treatment of urine retention in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is caused by obstruction due to stone or by clotted blood, or by pus or by flesh, and similar to those [cases] of which we have spoken about the methods of treatment in the [previous] section.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved, and you see that the retention is caused by a stone that is already in the neck of the bladder, then it is necessary that the patient be bent over their knees. 
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And then place their feet on their back and extend their belly from the upper part of their back, and have the patient hold their breath as much as possible.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Then the neck of the bladder is constrained to expel the stone towards the back parts, so that the urine is released. 
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if [the blockage] is not dissolved with what we have said and the cause is severe for the patient, then you must administer extraction with an instrument which is called a syringe, of which this is the form:  Let it be of silver and let it be a thin, hollow tube, like the quill of a bird's feather, with the thinness of a long ray [i.e. thin and long] similar to a palm and a half [in length], to which there is a thin cane at its tip.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the way to extract the urine with it is that you take a doubled pig's bladder and tie wool or cotton to its end with a good knot; and insert the ends of the bladder into the lower part of the syringe, and cut with scissors if any of the wool is superfluous, but insert it into the tube forcefully.  Then anoint the syringe with butter and egg white.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And have the patient sit on a chair, and rub his bladder and penis with moist oils, olive oil and rose water.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then insert the syringe gently until it reaches the root of the penis; then bend the penis up towards the navel; and then push the syringe inside it; and then push it in until it reaches the bladder, and the patient will feel it has reached the empty space, and this isn't done according to this method if the passage has a crookedness/bend.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then slowly expand the bladder with the wool, because the urine will follow the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then remove it and apply a dressing to the urinary opening and use the syringe.  Don't stop doing this and use the syringe until the bladder is emptied and the patient finds relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter 59.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	On the method of irrigation/washing of the bladder with forceps and similar instruments that are suitable for this.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When an ulceration or abscess occurs in the bladder, or clotted blood, or constricted putrefaction, and you want to instill waters and medicines into it, then it should be done with an instrument which is called forceps/clamp, and this is its form:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	except that at its tip it is blunt, that is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in it there are three holes: two on one side, as you see.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning is a concave/hollow place, into which is put that which is injected, and let it be according to the quantity that fills it, without addition, until, when something is drawn out with it from the fluids, let it be drawn in, and when it is expelled, with it let it be drawn in, and when it is expelled forcefully, as does forceps with which naphtha/Greek fire is thrown in sea battles. 
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore when you want to inject fluids into the bladder, insert the tip of the forceps into the liquid, and pull with it that which is pushed to the upper parts, because the liquid is drawn into the concavity of the forceps.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then insert the tip of the forceps into the penis as we have described for the syringe; and then inject the liquid with that which you inject, because that liquid reaches the bladder immediately, and the patient feels it.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	Form of the thin clyster/enema with which the bladder is clysterized, and this is the form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And let it be made of silver or tin, of which the highest part/head should be similar to a small feather/quill, and under it a tube/cannula inside with a tie/binding.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And then take a sheep's bladder, and put in it the liquid that you want to administer as a clyster/enema into the bladder, and then tie it between the two with a strong ligature with double thread, and warm that liquid over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then insert the tip of the clyster/enema into the penis.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then squeeze your hand over the bladder with the liquid with downward pressure until the patient feels that the liquid has reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not have a bladder available, then take a piece of parchment and make a circle of it; and perforate it all around its edge; and then thread a strong string through these holes, so that it is gathered/wrapped; and then tie the circle as one ties a sulphur bag, after you have placed in it what you want of the liquids, and oils, and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then tie it to the instrument and do with it as you did with the bladder, and squeeze it with your hand until the liquid reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter 60.
De extraccio de peyra.	On the extraction of a stone (likely a bladder stone/kidney stone).
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already discussed in the division the types of stone and its treatment with medicines, and the difference between stone generated in the kidneys and stone generated in the bladder, and the signs of it.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have spoken of the stone in which [case] one operates by hand, and incision/cutting.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder proper is that which is fixed in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And I am narrating that with clear explanation and brevity.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Thus I say that stone generated in the bladder occurs mostly in children; and among its signs is that the urine which comes from the bladder is like water in its thinness/clarity, and sand appears in it; and the patient rubs their penis, and often it hangs down, and then is erect; and with this, the anus protrudes in many of them/these cases.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And the healing of children from this is easy until they have reached fourteen years; and it is a difficult cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in young people it is easier because of that/for this reason, since it is between/among those (ages). / But in young people it's moderately easy because they are between those two ages.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And for the one in whom the stone is larger, the cure is easier; and if it is small, it is the opposite of that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, when we come to the treatment of this, it is necessary at the beginning of it that we cleanse the patient with a clyster which extracts all the filth which is in their bowels/intestines; because that filth sometimes prevents the descent of the stone from being discovered.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then the patient should be taken by his feet and shaken and moved vigorously so that the stone descends to the neck of the bladder, or that it sometimes jumps from place to another.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then make him sit between your prepared hands, and his hands should be under his thighs, so that the entire bladder is made to incline to the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then search for it and all of that outside/externally.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Then if you feel the stone in the space/area, then immediately prepare yourself with an incision on him/it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not completely locate it by your touch, then you must anoint your index finger of your left hand with oil, if the patient is a child, or the middle finger if he is a fully grown young man, and insert it into his anus/rectum.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And search for the stone until it is under your finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And turn it little by little into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press on it with your finger, and expel it outwards towards the place where you made the incision.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And order the assistant to press the bladder with his hand; and order another assistant with his right hand to extend the genitals upwards, and with his other hand to hold back the scrotum which is below the genitals, towards the area where the incision is made. 
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then insert a well-sharpened scalpel, of which this is the shape:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and cut what is between the anus and the genitals, not in the middle, but towards the side of the left thigh; and the incision should be over that stone and your finger should be in the anus, and make a transverse incision, so that the outer incision is wide and the inner narrow, according to how much protrusion of the stone is possible, and no larger, because your finger, which is in the anus, easily compresses the stone towards the incision, and it is expelled without difficulty.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that some stones have angles and edges, which makes their extraction difficult.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that kind which is like an acorn, and is round, it is easily extracted.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore, if it is one that has angles and edges, insert it into the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not thus expelled, then you must be ingenious about it, or you must tighten upon it with a tool, decently, the end of which is like a file with which you tighten upon the stone, and do not let it escape; or insert beneath it a subtle instrument with a curved extremity. 
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot (remove it) thus, then enlarge the hole a little, and if you see a flow of blood, staunch it by applying crushed vitriol.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if there is more than one stone, then at the beginning you push your hand to the opening of the bladder and then incise upon it; then push it a little toward this (opening); and similarly do if there are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very large, then it is ignorance to incise it with a large incision, for one of two things will happen to the patient: either he will die or he will suffer a continuous dripping of urine, because the area is not completely healed.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But continue to push it out until it is expelled, or work at breaking it up with forceps until you extract it in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Then when you have completed your operation, fill the wound with powder of aloe and dragon's blood, and bind it.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place over it a cloth soaked in oil and wine, or in rose oil and cold water, so that hot swelling may be reduced.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	Then lay the patient on their back, and do not undo the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when you have untied it, wash the area with water and a little oil, and then treat it with diafinicon ointment and diabazlicon ointment until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound there occurs a hot, burning, and corrosive swelling, and it appears as if the blood were congealed in the bladder, and because of this urination is impeded (and this is known by the discharge of blood with urine), then insert your finger into the wound and extract that blood, for if it remains, it provokes corruption and putrefaction of the bladder.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the wound with sour wine, water, and salt, and with an appropriate remedy for every type, with that which suits it for healing until it is healthy. 
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And it is necessary during the whole treatment that you bind both thighs and adjust the medicines that are placed on the area. 
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and is in the meatus of the penis, and is stuck there, and thus urination is blocked, then treat it with what I recommended before you resort to incision, for too many times incision has been blamed for this condition; and I have already tested this, and that is that you take a perforator of polished iron, of which this is its form:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	with a triangular tip, sharp, fixed in wood.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And then take bile, and with that tie the penis below the stone so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And then insert the iron into the penis, perforating easily until the perforator reaches that stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And turn the perforator with your hand in that stone little by little, and you enlarge its perforation until you make it penetrate to the other side; for the urine is immediately released. 
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then press your hand over what remains of the stone on the outside of the penis, for it is broken up, and is cast out with the urine, and the patient is healed. 
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this treatment is not suitable for you for any reason that prevents it, then tie one thread below the stone, and another thread above the stone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And then cut down on the stone in the penis between the two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then remove it.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then untie the ligature and cleanse the congealed blood which is found in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And the thread ligature below the stone is not necessary, except so that it doesn't return to the bladder, and the other ligature above [is necessary so that] when the thread is untied [after] the removal of the stone, the penis returns to its place and the wound closes.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary for you, when you tie the thread above, to lift the penis to the upper parts, or that it returns towards your abdomen, and the wound closes as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter 61.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	On the extraction of stone from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Stone is rarely generated in women.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if a stone appears in any of them, then its treatment is difficult, and prohibited in many ways.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the woman is easily ashamed/modest.  (Or possibly "easily embarrassed")
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you don't find a well-bred woman who will reveal herself to the physician when she is chaste, or is one of the women having husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you will not find a woman well-versed in this art, especially the operation by hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the location of the incision for a stone in women is far from the location of the stone, therefore you need a deep incision, and in that there is danger/risk.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity compels you to it, then you must take a well-learned female physician, and she is rarely found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of her, then seek a chaste and subtle physician, or employ a well-trained matron skilled in women's matters, or a woman who has learned part of this art through training.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Then have her present, and command her to do everything that you tell her, from the examination for the stone at the beginning; which is that if the woman is a virgin, then she should put her finger in her rectum and search for the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Then if she finds it, she should hold it under her finger, and then you order her to incise over it.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin, then instruct the matron to insert her finger into the patient's vagina and search for the stone, after she has placed her left hand over the bladder, and compresses it well. 
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Then if she finds it, she should gradually move it away from the opening of the bladder downwards with the tip of her finger using her utmost skill until it reaches the root of the thigh.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And then incise over that location halfway between the vagina and the root of the thigh on whichever side it is stopped, and feel for the stone in that area, and her finger must not be moved from the stone, holding it underneath.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the incision should be small at the beginning; and then insert the probe into that incision, and if she feels the stone, then enlarge the incision according to the size that she knows the stone will be extracted from. 
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that there are many kinds of stones: for some of them are small and large, smooth and rough, long and round, and having branches.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you should know how many kinds there are so that you can indicate what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see a flow of blood, apply crushed vitriol to the area and keep it there for an hour until the bleeding stops, and then return to your operation until the stone is extracted.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And make sure you prepare the instruments that are mentioned in the extraction of stones in men, so that you may be helped by them in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see a flow of blood, and you know that the expulsion of blood is from the artery that is incised, then you apply powder to the area and compress it with bandages and a tight dressing, and do not repeat this; and leave the stone and do not extract it, for the patient will very quickly die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then treat the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Then, when the acuteness of the bleeding has subsided after a few days, and the area can bear it, then you return to your operation until the stone is removed.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter 62. (Capitol is likely a variant spelling of "Capítol," meaning "Chapter")
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	On the incision/cutting over an inguinal hernia.  (Hernia "acoza" likely refers to a specific type, possibly inguinal given its location near the "coyssas" (thighs) in the previous section.)
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	A watery hernia is nothing but an accumulation of fluid in the white tunic, which is under the chain/cord of the genitals containing the testicle, and is called a tunic (or membrane).
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And sometimes it is in the very membrane which nature has prepared for it in the area of the testicle, so that it looks like there is another testicle; and the spermatic cord is between the white tunic, which we have mentioned, and it is nothing but a swelling.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is by a weakness which occurs in the genitals, because of which this matter is poured into them, and sometimes occurs from a blow made on the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this fluid has many colors, for its color either tends towards yellow/citrine, or bloody/sanguine, or red, or is black and fecal-like, or is watery white, and this is what is most common.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known where this accumulation of water is are these: for if it is in the white tunic, which we have mentioned, then the abscess/swelling is round, inclining a little to length like the shape of an egg, and surrounds the testicle, for the fluid contains it on all sides.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the fluid is in its own membrane, then the swelling is round with part of the testicle and therefore one thinks that it is another testicle.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the fluid is between the testicle's cord and the white tunic, then one feels a lump/mass underneath.  (Literally: "then you feel underneath the feeling/lump")
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And when you want to know the color of the fluid, then you test the color of the fluid in the swelling with a square instrument, the form of which has been described before; and according to what comes out on the mark of the instrument, judge what is inside it. 
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore, when we come to its treatment with iron (a surgical instrument), then it is necessary that we order the patient to be phlebotomized (bled) if this is possible for you, and see that his body is full (of blood - i.e., not anemic).
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And then he should be laid on his back on something a little high/raised, and place many cloths under him.
