E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	And I have already seen a woman in whose womb a dead fetus was, and then on top of that fetus she became pregnant again, and then the other fetus also died.
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	It happened to someone that after a long time an abscess formed in their navel; and it swelled until it opened, and it began to discharge pus (or matter from the arm - less likely given the context).
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	And I was called to treat him, and medicated him for a long time, and the wound did not heal.
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	Then I applied on him some strongly drawing plasters, and a bone came out of him, and after a few days, another bone came out; and I was very surprised, as there are no bones in the belly (in that area).
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	And then I thought that they were the bones of the dead fetus.
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	So I investigated the wound, and extracted many bones from it, the woman being in thousands of difficult situations [positions/childbirth pains?], and yet lived in such a manner for a long time, a little pus still running from it.
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	And I do not affirm this to be strange, but rather that in this there is science and help in what the skillful physician administers with his hand for healing. 
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	Of the forms of the instruments that are necessary to extract the fetus.
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	Form of hook with which the mother [womb/uterus] is opened:
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the form of a clamp in which the labia are held, to which holding are two hooks at two ends of two shafts.
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	But this hook must be more subtle than a constrictor, and be made of ivory or boxwood.
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	And let the width of each shaft be two fingers and the edge of each one finger, and the length of each is a palm and a half; and in the middle of the two shafts are two fittings of the same wood that are already fixed, the length of which is half a palm and a little more, and the width of each is two fingers, or a little more.
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	And these two additions are inserted into the mouth of the womb so that it may be opened with them when you turn the two prescribed hooks.
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	Another similar form, more subtle and lighter:
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	Let it be made of ivory or boxwood shafts in the likeness of forceps.
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	But however, at its extremity there are two additions as you see, and the length of these additions is about a palm, and the width of each is two fingers.
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	And when you want to open the womb with these, then have the woman lie on the bed with her feet hanging, [with] the space between her thighs open.
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	And then open your hand with the instrument just as you do evenly with forceps, according to the amount you want to open the mouth of the womb until the midwife does what you want. 
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	The form of vertigo, which the ancients described:
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	A method of impulsion with which the fetus is pushed:
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	A method of reduction with which a large head is constrained/reduced.
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	And it is similar to forceps, which have teeth at the end, as you see, and sometimes it is made long like forceps according to this form, as you see, which has teeth like a saw's teeth, with which it is incised and constrained/held.
Forma de amesidat pauc:	A method of slight/small reduction:
Forma de unci havent una spina:	Form of a hook having a spine/point:
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	Form of a hook having two spines/points:
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	Form of forceps which have saw-teeth, with which the head of the fetus is held/grasped.
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	Form of a spatula having two extremities with which the head is cut off.
Forma de dos espatums latz:	Form of two broad spatulas.
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	All these instruments are practiced/used, and the more the types of these are multiplied and prepared by the artificers/craftsmen, the easier it is for their operation and the more highly they are regarded by men due to their quantity/availability.
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	And do not neglect to prepare any of these instruments, for the need for them is unavoidable/inexcusable (i.e., you must have them).
De extraccio de la segondina.	On the extraction of the afterbirth (or placenta).
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	When the afterbirth is retained after childbirth, then you must order the patient to hold her breath, and then make her sneeze with pepper, and tightly close your hand over her mouth and over her nostrils, and if by this means it is expelled, it is good. 
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	And if not, then you take a pot and pierce a hole in the lid and place in it herbs that open the mother's womb, such as calamint, rue, dill, chamomile, gum arabic, cassia bark, and centaury.
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	All these herbs or some of them should be submerged in water in the pot, and place it on the fire.
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	And then place a reed pipe in the patient's womb, and hold it there until the steam comes to the womb's cavity.  (Note: "mother" here likely means womb, as in referring to the source of the issue)
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	And then make her sneeze as we have said, and the afterbirth will be expelled quickly.
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	But if this treatment remains and it (the afterbirth) hasn't come out, then you instruct the midwife to submerge her left hand in sesame oil or marshmallow mucilage, and then insert it into the vulva and search with it for the afterbirth, and when she has found it, then take it and draw it out little by little.  But if it is attached to the lining of the womb, then insert her hand as we have described, and when she has found the afterbirth, extract it bit by bit as instructed so that the womb doesn't tear due to forceful pulling. 
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	Before, it is necessary that it be moved to the right and left sides with ease.
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	And then the amount of pulling should be adjusted, for it will yield and be freed from adhesion.
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	And if the opening of the womb is constricted, we have already described the treatment with sneezing and the medicinal application of herbal oil.
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	But if it is not expelled with all the methods that we have described, then take care not to exert yourself with repeated attempts at extraction, but rather it is necessary that what has come out of it to the opening of the womb be tied to the woman's thigh, and then anoint it with ointment and tetrapharmacum; for this will cause it to rot within a few days and it will be dissolved and expelled.
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	But when it rots, a bad odor rises from it to the head and stomach, and this harms the patient; and therefore suitable fumigations should be administered for this.
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	But some of the Ancients have also tried fumigation with dead nettle and dried figs.
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	Form of the instrument with which the woman is fumigated for the retention of menses and the afterbirth:
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	It should be made of glass or bronze.
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	And the narrow end should be placed in the vulva and the wide end over the fire, and the fumigation material placed on the embers of the fire. 
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	And keep it there until the fumigation material is consumed, and then repeat with another.
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	Treatment of an imperforate anus in an infant. 
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	Many children are born without an anal opening, and their anus is thin and closed/sealed.
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	Then the midwife must perforate that membrane with her finger; or else, perforate it with a sharp instrument, taking care not to touch the surrounding tissue/muscle.  (The word "lacert" likely refers to muscle or flesh near the anus that should be avoided).
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	Then place on it wool soaked in wine and oil; and then treat it with ointment until it is healed.
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	But if you fear that it will close up again, then place a cannula in the opening for many days, and remove it when the child needs to defecate.
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	And sometimes blockage of the anus occurs due to the hardening/scarring of a plague sore or abscess; then it is necessary that this hardened tissue be incised, and then be treated as we have said regarding the treatment and lead (treatment).  (The "lead" here might refer to a lead instrument or a lead-based ointment, details are unclear from this sentence alone.)
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	On the treatment of fistulas that occur near the anus. (Or perhaps more broadly, "below/in the lower body")
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	Fistulas that occur in the lowermost parts are swellings and lumps which occur near the anus externally or in the perineal space.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is one fistula or many.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	And when this swelling is old, and a watery white fluid or thin pus flows from it, some of these fistulas sometimes penetrate (deeper tissues).
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	And these penetrating ones are recognized because there is discharge and flatulence from them; and sometimes the patient suffers from the discharge, and worms often emerge from them. 
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	And some of these fistulas sometimes penetrate into the bladder in the perineum, and into the urethra; and some of them penetrate into the hip joint and into the hollow of the buttock.
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And how a fistula penetrating into the anus is distinguished from a non-penetrating one is that you put your index finger into the anus, and insert a thin probe of bronze or iron into the fistula when there is no tortuosity (or winding path).
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	But if there is tortuosity in it, then insert a thin probe of lead or horsehair into it until you feel the probe or the hair with your finger (in the rectum). 
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel it at all and no discharge, worms, or flatulence comes out of the opening, as we have said, then know that it is non-penetrating, and then proceed with the treatment.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula penetrates into the bladder or into the urethra, the sign of it is a discharge of urine from it and the prevention of this so that the area may be healed with medicine. 
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	But if it penetrates into the hip joint or into the bone and causes pain in the surrounding area, then the sign of it is that the probe goes in there if there is no tortuosity to the bone, and (there is) increased pain in the area surrounding the part; and that pus constantly comes out of it; and that medication is of no use in it, nor is it healed with ointment.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all these penetrating fistulas there is no complete cure, and the treatment of these is work and vanity for the foolish physicians who are fixated on it/them.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in that which is not penetrating and not old, healing with iron is hoped for according to what I will explain to you, and what I have already tried.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And the patient lies between your hands on their back and raises their legs up, their thighs bent towards their stomach, and then insert a lead probe, or of bronze if there is tortuosity in the fistula, until you know the place where the probe reaches.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if the patient feels it around the anus/rectum, then you must insert your index finger into the anus/rectum.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel in your finger the now uncovered probe penetrating by itself, other than what you feel between your finger and that siphac (membrane/tissue) or flesh, then know for certain that it is penetrating; and then do not work on it, for there is no healing in that, as we have said. 
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	But however, some say that it is healed in some men late/slowly.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And the medication by which healing is hoped for in him is that you ignite a thin cautery according to the width of the fistula, as has been described before, and insert this ignited cautery into the fistula until it reaches around the anus/rectum; and then repeat this two or three times until you know that all those fistulous attached tissues, which resemble the shaft of a bird's feather, have been cauterized.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And then treat it with compresses soaked in butter until all those cauterized tissues come out, and then treat it with medicines that generate and consolidate flesh, and if it is healed, good; and if not, then it is not healed at any time by any other treatment.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the probe enters, but does not penetrate all the way to your finger which is in the anus/rectum, and between your finger and the probe there is a thick veil of flesh or membrane, and you see the fistula in such a way that the surface of the intestine is dry, then dry the intestine from the beginning of the fistula, and dry it with the probe, letting it be in the fistula until the dried area reaches the place where the end of the probe reaches, and through the probe, it (the fistula) is freed and evacuated/drained. 
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then clean those fistulous tissues, which are similar to the shaft of a bird's feather, and let nothing of them remain.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	But if you see a flow of blood that comes between you and your work when you cauterize those tissues, then the best and easiest instrument is to cauterize with fire or with a sharp medicine, because cauterizing with fire combines two good properties: that is, cauterization of those attached tissues, and stopping of the blood [and] drying of the humors.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And then treat it with compresses soaked in butter or crushed cabbage until the area produces pus, and then at that time treat the wound with ointments that generate and consolidate hard flesh.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And these are medicines in which there are astringent and drying properties; when it is thus restored, it is healed and you do not fear recurrence/relapse. 
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula already reaches into the depth/rectum of the anus and is elongated from the surface of the body, then insert your finger into the anus and examine it with that.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And then if you feel the probe and between you and it there is a thin membrane or flesh, and it is close to penetration, at that time there is no treatment for him except by way of faith and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	This can be administered in one of three ways: either cauterize it as we have said; or dry it until you reach its cavity so that it is possible for you to insert the necessary medicines and the appropriate treatment; and do not proceed much with cutting so that you do not incise the muscle containing the anus/rectum, and thus involuntary defecation happens to the patient; and then treat it with what we have said for it will be healed very quickly; or stretch that membrane and clean it after you dry it near the anus, as we have said, either with a probe or another sharp-ended instrument, and then clean those fistulous tissues that are in the incision as far as you can by scraping; and then endeavor to make the restoration of the whole wound by cutting, and if the upper orifice is not consolidated/closed, and the fistula remains open in the area of the anus, it will be easier afterwards for the patient. 
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes the fistula is treated in this way: when you insert the probe into the fistula, and it is at the side of the anus, around the surface of the body with the buttock [or perhaps *along* the surface of the body towards the buttock] and at the margin of the anus, then take a probe with a perforated end, which is like a needle for preparing leather/hides [cuirs/skins] in this manner:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert into it thread wrapped in five threads or around them; and then insert a probe with thread into the fistula until it reaches its cavity/depth.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	But if it penetrates the margin of the anus from the inside, then you pull the thread out of that hole so that you insert your finger into the anus; and pull out the end of the thread and tie the two ends together, and tighten each one, and leave it for a day or two, and then repeatedly cut the thread into the flesh, tighten it well until those tissues that are between the two ends of the thread are cut and fall off.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And then treat the wound until it is closed and healed.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	But if the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate, in whatever way is prepared for you, except that it be deep in the perineum, because it is not up to you to do this so that you do not cut the muscle; and then continue with that until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The form of a thorn-shaped spatula with which the fistula is opened: the curvature of which is very sharp and the other part is not sharp, so that you do not cut what is not necessary, as you sometimes do.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	On suturing hemorrhoids from which blood flows in their incision.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are of two kinds, for either they are located between the buttocks resembling embers/coals, or they are like grape seeds.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And of these, some are small and large, and blood flows from them constantly, and there is one, and there are many, and they are outside the anus, and at its edges.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	But however those that are outside the anus are according to the limbs of little humidity, from which flows a light yellow water or a little blood with a continuous scab/crust, and are according to the color of the body/skin. 
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the treatment for the one that is inside the anus is that you order the patient to sit down and strain until the anus protrudes and the hemorrhoids appear to you. 
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then cover yourself and lift them with hooks or hold them with your fingernail, and then cut them down to their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	But if the hooks cannot hold them because of their moisture and softness, then grasp them with a rough cloth or with cotton or with a woolen bandage, and extract them with your fingers, and then cut them and sprinkle on them some hot powders near the incision, so that they act on them in place of a cautery; or cauterize them as described previously in the chapter on cauterization.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then treat them with the other treatment until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the anus does not obey and protrude, then give the patient an enema with a small bite (irritant), and let it be washed with that water which is in the anus so that it obeys and protrudes easily when the patient strains.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, then their cause is minor, and you should take them with your fingernail, or take them with a hook, and cut them, and then treat them with what we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And the one that you have incised, you must administer sutures to them in this manner: take wrapped thread and insert it into a needle and then draw the hemorrhoids to the upper parts, and make it penetrate with the needle into the root of the other part, and wrap the two ends of the thread in the lowest part of the needle, and laterally; and tighten the hemorrhoid with a strong tightening, and then knot the thread and remove the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do this to all of them, and leave one of them and do not sew it, so that the excess blood flows from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	And then place a cloth soaked in rose oil or ointment on the anus; and place it on the backside and tell the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then leave it until it falls off; and when it has fallen off, treat them with ointments or other treatment until it is healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	On the treatment of fistulas.
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Many times they occur because of the drying of a crack or by constriction of (bodily) nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And when they are old and medicine is not effective, then you must scrape them with the point of a spatula or with your fingernail until they are made moist and the pus crust on top is removed, which prevents them from healing; and then treat them until they are healed.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you scrape them more vehemently than the first time until they bleed a lot and are excoriated; and then treat them until they are healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	On the treatment of a whitlow, that is, a nail abscess. 
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	Know that a whitlow, that is a nail abscess, is nothing but a round lump, the color of flesh, resembling the head of a small nail, and it occurs throughout the body, and mostly on the parts under the feet and on the fingers, and therefore causes excruciating pain. 
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And then it must be incised around the nail, and held with forceps or a hook, and eradicated from its root; and then treat it.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, cauterize it as described in its chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	But a wart is a small, rough, round, and callous eminence on the surface of the body, and many times it comes on the hands of children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And its treatment is to stretch and incise it, or to constrict it with a thread or skin until it falls off.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, cauterize it, as we have said, with fire or a sharp medicine. 
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And now inverted and non-inverted ones are eradicated with the instrument which I will describe.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	But a "formica" (ant bite/boil) is a small, felted or callous, large eminence on the surface of the body, occurring frequently on the penis, and when the cold encounters it, it is felt there like the bite of an ant, and is found around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And its treatment is that you take a tube of a goose feather or a vulture feather, and let it be strong, and place it on the formica so that the circle of the tube contains its edges; and then turn your hand with the tube until you incise what is within the circumference of the formica, and place it within the substance of the flesh, and eradicate the formica from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, do this with a tube of copper or iron according to this method:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	Let the upper part of the tube be drawn to a point, blunt (that is, not perforated), enveloped so that the apprentice's grip on it is facilitated, as is its rotation. 
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you wish, cauterize the formica as was previously described in the cauterization of a "atheil" in the chapter on cautery.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	On the form of the instruments that are used to give an enema. (Cristeri likely refers to an enema or clyster)
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes an enema is made of silver, or brass, or cast or hammered copper; and sometimes it is made from these instruments small and large according to those to whom they are administered, for the one that is administered in the treatment of small children should be small; and for those whose rectums are fragile or painful, their enemas should be small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of a large and small enema:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The head of the cannula above, on which the bag is tied, should be wide in this manner; and it should have a distinction where the bag is tied, as you see.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And its lower extremity, which is inserted into the anus, should be blunt (that is, not open) but smooth, tapering to a point; and on one of its sides there should be two holes, and on the other side one hole, and the width of the hole should be according to the thickness of the liquid, and a little larger.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the bag in which the medicines are placed should be made of animal bladder or sheepskin, and its root (or neck) should be one palm (long).
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be perforated with many holes as shown; and let the space between the holes be the width of a finger.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those holes strong raw gall from about ten gallbladders, or thereabouts; and attach the bag with it; and when the bag is placed in position, let it be tightened at the top of the syringe between two distinctive marks with strong constriction, and then cauterize each hole: But the way to cauterize with it is that you fill the bag with the medicine, which should be warmed according to the patient's tolerance; and be careful that it is not too hot nor too cold.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	And then the patient should lie supine on their back, and raise their legs up and place under them a leather or linen sheet; and then anoint the end of the cautery with oil or egg white or fenugreek mucilage or similar; and then insert it into the anus gently, and then the assistant should take the bag and squeeze it strongly with both hands at the same time until everything in the syringe is evacuated into the intestine; and then remove the syringe and the patient should raise their legs against the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces him to defecate, let him hold it as long as he can; and if he sleeps with it for a whole night, it is better for his recovery.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	But if you cauterize him for diarrhea and his defecation pains him, then you repeat the cautery until he is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if there are hemorrhoids or harmful abscesses in the anus, then the syringe should be very subtle and smooth, like the syringes with which children are treated.
De curacio de las plaguas.	On the treatment of wounds/sores/plagues. (The word "plagues" here is likely referring to a wider range of skin afflictions than the modern meaning.)
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	I have already said in the section on the treatment of wounds what was pertinent to the book, and thus I describe the treatment of these with my hand and with medicines according to their complexity/completion/perfection (depending on the exact nuance intended by "conpliment").
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, I say that wounds are categorized according to how the wounds are made and according to the location where the wounds occur.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes by which wounds are often made are like the throwing of a stone, or incision by sword or knife, or striking with a lance, or with wood, or with an arrow, or similar things from many causes.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	But the wounds that are in the locations of the body are like a wound which falls upon the head, or the neck, or the foot, or the belly, or the liver, and similar ones on the limbs.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And I am recounting the treatment of some wounds so that you apply that reasoning and rule to other wounds.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And I will begin with the simple wounds of the head, for the discussion of the compound ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, I say that when a simple wound occurs on the head, and there is no fracture, then consider: if it is from the throwing of a stone or something similar, and it has only broken the skin and it is a large wound, and you fear the development of a hot abscess on that patient, then you should immediately phlebotomize the cephalic vein, and do not delay this; and draw blood from it according to the strength of the patient if there is no cause preventing phlebotomy, especially if the blood that has come out of the wound is little.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And let the phlebotomy be on the opposite side of the wounded area; and the patient should beware of repletion and wine and coarse foods.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	But if some reason prevents bloodletting, then his food should be reduced and he should not go near meat or wine. 
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And place on the wound, if a hot abscess develops on it, cotton infused in rose oil alone or in wine in which a styptic has been steeped.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	But if you are sure of a hot abscess, then place on the wound, if it is recent, his own blood and, provided the air has not changed it, the powder which I will describe shortly.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed it (the blood/wound), then apply some ointment until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the wound is large, or made by incision with a sword or something similar, and its edges are not joined by stitching, then join them with sutures, as I will explain regarding their suturing.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	But if the wound is already exposed to the bone and hangs, and there is little holding it except for a small tendon, then incise it and then treat the wound with medicines and restore the flesh back in place like a chain, and order the patient to avoid foods that are thick: head cheese and soft cheese and things like them, until he is recovered. 
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find putrefaction in the sinew/tendon and it is not adhering to the bone, then you incise all that is rotten and remove it, and then treat it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	But if in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which a flow of blood might occur, and it is not stopped by medicines, then you examine the artery, and if you find it uncut, then you incise it with a spatula, or tie it off; and if necessity compels you and you cannot do what we have said, then cauterize it until the bleeding is stopped.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these wounds are simple and small, then their cause is insignificant; so you sprinkle this powder on them, for it strengthens them before the air changes them/infects them.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the method for the powder is this: take one part incense oil, two parts dragon's blood, three parts unslaked lime; let it all be very finely ground and sifted, and fill the wound with it, and let it be bound with a good bandage until it adheres well to it, and is coagulated with the blood.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then bind it on top with pillows/cushions/compresses and leave it, and do not untie it while it is like this, that is not abscessed/inflamed, for the medicine must not be removed from it until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And sometimes use only lime, when incense and dragon's blood are not available to you.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And also perform this same procedure on large wounds when it is appropriate that they be covered and bandaged, and these are fresh wounds with their blood, which the air has not altered/infected.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered/infected them, and especially when it is in the summertime, then the application of this powder is not intended, but then treat them with what we have said, so that you place some digestive ointments on them, or that you put barley flour powder with water and honey on them until they expel pus; and then treat them with the other treatment until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	But if a bone fracture occurs with the wound, and it is small, then you treat it with plaster.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And I will describe the treatment of head fractures in what follows.
De las plaguas del col.	Of neck wounds/injuries. (Literally: "Of the wounds/plagues of the neck.")
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	But if the wound occurs in the neck, then there is no difference in medication between it and a simple head wound.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	But if the nerve or artery of the neck is incised, then, if it is a nerve, there is no treatment for it except to avoid treating it with something that causes strong constriction, such as cinnabar and vitriol (which is like copper sulfate) and similar things, because they harm the nerves and constrict them.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not put anything cold on the wound at all, because the substance of the nerves is cold and it is continuous with the brain, which is the highest of all the members/organs.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if this [the wound] is treated with mild medications, such as washing it with fresh water, sometimes infused with rose oil or plain oil, and red ochre when washed with fresh water, and other mineral stones in this manner, and moist ointments. 
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the wound is large, then administer sutures, or bring the edges of it together, and then treat it with powders until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the wound is deep or you find putrefaction in the lowest part of it, then pierce it in the most depressed place. 
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if an artery has been incised in the wound and there is a flow of blood, then separate or dry it, or tie it off, or cauterize it if necessity compels you to do so.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	But if you have incised the vertebrae of the neck, or all of it, and the veins of the neck are saved, then you should join the edges of the skin with a suture over the neck bone and do not touch it; rather, smooth it and return it to its natural shape, and then tighten it with a proper bandage, and leave it for some days; and then treat it with ointments that have styptic and stimulating properties until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	But if the wound has already caused damage to the bone, then you should clean it, and if there are bone fragments in it, remove all those that you can; and what you are not prepared to remove, leave it until the wound putrefies, and it becomes separated and its discharge is eased.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the wound is recent then sprinkle on it the powder which has been recommended to you.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	But if a fistula has formed in the wound, then treat it with that which will be mentioned later in its own chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	Regarding wounds of the neck, or similar ones, when made between the shoulders, and caused by a sword or a knife or a lance or similar (weapons).
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a wound from a lance or a knife, and you see its depth, then further consider if air comes out of the wound when the patient breathes; then you should know that the wound is mortal.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if it is not deep and the wound is fresh with its blood, then in the first hour you apply powder, and do not bind it tightly so that the blood is not retained in its depths and returns to the heart and kills the patient, but apply a drawing ointment, and loosen it twice a day.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if you do not have the ointment at hand, then place old cotton in the opening of the wound so that it absorbs the fluids that come out; and have the patient sleep on the wound so that what is collected in it will drain.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	But if three or more days have already passed since the injury and the patient does not experience spasms, nor heart tremors, nor difficulty breathing, and you see that his other conditions are good, then know that the wound is not life-threatening; and then treat it with baths and other treatments until it is healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	But if its healing is hindered, and it remains open, then know that a fistula has formed; therefore treat it according to its chapter.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the wound is by incision of sword or knife, and it is simple on the surface of the foot or the back, then treat it with what has been described previously regarding sutures, if it is large, or with powder, if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	But if it has already damaged the bone, and pieces of it have been cut out, then you should enlarge the wound and try to extract those pieces, if they are detached.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	But if they are not detached, then leave them until the wound becomes putrid, as their extraction will be easier.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other accidental wounds in the other limbs, the treatment and cure is the same as what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of wounds of the abdomen/belly.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The disorder/illness which occurs in the abdomen is either great, or small, or middling.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	Of the great [disorder/illness], sometimes the intestine or sinew of the intestine comes out, for which insertion of them and their suture must be more forceful and more subtle.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And a small rupture is made difficult in another way, and so it is that their reduction is more difficult if you do not take care to insert them into their place immediately, for it opens and swells making their entry difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best rupture is the middling one, because the reduction of the intestine is not difficult in that [one], as it is difficult in the two aforementioned types.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And know that suturing of the abdomen is done according to four methods, but two sutures are common, which are suitable for sutures of other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And two other unique sutures are common to the other wounds, however they are more specific to the suturing of the abdomen.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I will explain each one to you with exposition and clarification.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore, I say that when the wound is small and some part of the intestine has exited through it, and it is difficult to reduce it, then this is due to one of two reasons: either because of the smallness of the rupture as we have said, or when the intestine has become inflamed due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And so, when this is the case, you must warm it by submerging a sponge or wet cloth in plain warm water, or boil it in water with squinanth, cyperus, and spikenard, and foment the intestine with it until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And sometimes do this with wine, which has astringency, and is better than plain water in resolving inflammation. 
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And so, when you see the inflammation is resolved, then moisten the intestine with water in which althea and mallows have been boiled, for by this its entry is eased with little effort.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if its entry is hindered despite this treatment, then enlarge the rupture a little with an instrument with which hemorrhoids are incised. 
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is better, when it is suitable and there is no incision, and there is no need to resort to drying due to necessity and failure.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, this is its form:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of it curved and sharp, and the other part not sharp, and the tip slender, but not with the slenderness of a spatula, rather let it be slightly blunt.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And then when the wound is enlarged and the intestine comes out, then its reduction must be according to its natural form, into its proper place, if it is possible to do so, for it is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	But when the rupture is large, and is in the lower part of the abdomen, then you must make the patient lie on their back, and place their legs higher than their head; and if it is in the upper part of the abdomen, then you place their head and feet higher than the parts below. 
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly if the rupture is on one of the two sides of the abdomen, then always direct your attention and consideration to this, so that the part where the wound is located is higher than the other. 
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus you must manage this in large wounds and in medium wounds.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small wounds, place that which is prepared by you, and then have the assistant, who is positioned between your compassionate hands, hold the entire rupture with his hand and bring the edges together, and then uncover from that area, next to the one who is sewing the suture, any nearby foreign matter.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suturing: take the needle, or count the needle's length according to the size of the wound; and then leave [a space] from the edge of the rupture the width of a ring finger, and push the needle through, but do not include flesh at the two ends of the stitch, with the two ends of the thread which is below the stitch on the inside parts, until you make it penetrate that part; and you have already joined two ends of the stitch and two ends of the thread, making four strands.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then tightly grasp [the flesh] with a double thickness around the circumference of the needle, and sometimes on both sides together, and then join the two edges and the wound by appropriate approximation; and then leave the width of a finger and insert another needle there, and then tie it with thread just as you did with the first needle; and do not cease doing this if necessary with the needles until you have completely closed the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be medium between thick and thin, for thin needles cut the flesh too easily; and thick ones are difficult to insert into the stitch, and therefore they must be medium in thickness and thinness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And the needle must not be inserted too close to the two edges of the wound, so that the flesh is not easily cut and the wound reopens before it heals.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And the stitches should not be too long so that they do not hinder the healing of the wound.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then cut off the ends of the needles so that they do not injure the patient while they sleep; and you will place spread-out cushions all around the suture, which will hold the ends of the needles; and leave them there until you know that the wound is healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And this type of stitching with needles is in every way more suitable for small wounds, because one needle or two, or thereabouts, is sufficient for closing them.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	But the second suture is common: and that is that you close with stitches the four edges of the wound and the two edges of the tear, all at once, with a needle on which is wrapped thread of equal thinness and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then when you have penetrated these four edges with the needle, bring the needle back out on the same side where you began, so that the drawn thread closes from the most superficial part of the wound downwards, so that the stitching is like the stitching of cloth with which clothes are tightened/sewn. 
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And leave between each stitch the width of the little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this stitching men know.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with such stitching I sewed up the wound which had happened to a man in his belly, who had been wounded with a knife, and the rupture of the wound was greater than a palm, and about two palms of intestine from the middle part had come out and the rupture was in the middle of the limb; and then I reduced it after the intestine had been out of the wound for twenty-four hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the wound was healed in the space of fifteen days or thereabouts, and I treated him and he is healthy; and after this he lived for many years, and is restored to his normal activities/health.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	And the other doctors had judged that he would not be healed; and by a miracle it was, for I did not treat him with ointment, for it was in a place where ointment was not found nor any medicine, but I placed old cotton on the wound twice a day and washed it frequently with honey water until it was healed.
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will describe two specific kinds of stitching according to Paul(us)'s account/narration.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And you should begin with a chain stitch, and insert the needle from the outside part to the inside part.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	And then when the needle penetrates the flesh and into the same laceration lengthwise and along the length of the whole body, leave the end of the thread where you have inserted the needle; and push the needle through the other end from the inside part to the outside part in the other extremity of the wound.
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	And then when you have made it penetrate, then make it penetrate again in the same extremity of the wound from the outside to the inside; and leave the end of the thread that is on this side, and make the needle penetrate the other extremity from the inside to the outside.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And make it penetrate with that penetration with which you make it penetrate the thread in the extremity of the wound which is on its side until it penetrates completely.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And then begin on this same side and sew it with the end of the thread that is on the other side, and pull the needle from the flesh which it penetrates, and then put it back into that flesh and sew the end of the thread which is on the other side with this extremity of the wound; and pull it from the flesh which is on its side. 
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this once and again, and do this one time then another time until you sew all that is outside according to this example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the summary of this manner of suture is that you sew with a furrier's stitch with which one sews furs, so that you sew the thread once from the side of the extremity of the flesh, and that you leave it the other time until you have completed it.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	But the second type of proper suture, which is likewise called "Gauls" - this is from his speech and recounted by him - is that you sew it according to the likeness with which some doctors sew it, so that they join each part to its corresponding part fitting to it by nature; and they apply the extremity of the other part of it and the extremity of the wound to the other extremity of it, and this is done according to what I have told you.
