Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	It is necessary that you stick the needle into the edge of the wound nearest to you on the outside part, and make it penetrate to the inside part in that place, and leave two ends of the thread; and then turn the needle and make it penetrate from outside to inside through the two ends of the thread.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And then turn them each, and make each one penetrate from the inside part to the outside part in the two edges of the other wound that are on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suture is better than the common simple suture, and it is the suture of which there was previous mention.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the speech of Gaul. (Or, this is what Gaul said.)
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And moreover some say, suture of the belly is rectified with two needles, that is, you insert a thread into each of them, and begin by inserting the needle on your side, and make it penetrate to the other side according to the suture of those who sew hides/leather in the same way.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when a rupture is in the middle of the belly, then its suture is more difficult than [those of] other places of the belly.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the treatment of plague is [like/the same as] the treatment of other plagues/infectious diseases.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	This is because when you treat the fresh plague/wound with its blood, before the air alters it, and you reduce the swelling and sew it and dress it properly, then you apply incarnative (flesh-generating) powder over it.
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And if the air has already altered the plague/wound, then apply some ointments, which are available to you, until they form a hard scab and the threads fall out, and [the edges] are consolidated/joined together; and then treat it as you would treat other wounds/sores until it is healed.
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	But if you do not have the medicines at hand, then apply old cotton over it as soon as it begins to produce pus/discharge, and change it twice a day, as you have been taught, until it is healed, for you will not need any other medication in many cases when the wounds are simple.
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	But if you fear that the plague/infection will spread and harm the principal members/organs, then you should soak wool fleece in oil of moderate quality, or in rose oil, and place it around the areas between the elbows and under the armpits.
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	And if he feels pain or putrefaction in his intestines, for this often happens, then administer an enema with astringent black hellebore wine, especially if the decay has reached the intestine and a passage has formed penetrating into its cavity.
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	And know that an issue with the large intestine is easier to heal than one in the small intestines.
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	And it is difficult to heal because the intestine which is called "jejunum" does not fully recover from a wound that occurs in it; and this is because of the large number of veins that are in it and because of the size of the vessels within them, and because of the thinness of its wall, and because of its proximity to the nerves.
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	But if it is the omentum that protrudes from the wound, and you find it fresh/newly protruded, reduce/replace it according to your method with which you similarly replace the intestines.
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	But if some time has passed and it has already turned green or black, then you must constrict it with bile on the area that is blackened, so that a flow of blood comes, because there are veins and arteries in the omentum.
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	And then incise what is beyond that ligature, and place the two ends of the bile hanging from the part below the wound outside it, so that the pulling of it towards the decay of the omentum and discharge from the opening of the wound will be eased for you.
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	Remembrance/Reminder of the wounds when they happen in the intestine.
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	When a rupture occurs in the intestine and it is small, then it is possible that it be restored in some men, because of this I saw one who had been wounded in his belly with the thrust of a lance and the wound was on the right side of the stomach, and the wound was old and had become a fistula, and from it issued excrement and flatulence/gas.
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	Therefore I continued the treatment of him even though I wasn't confident in his healing, but I persisted diligently in treating it until he was healed and the place was consolidated/closed.
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	And after I saw the place already healed, I feared that some bad accident might befall the patient in his belly; but no bad accident happened to him for that, and he remained in his best condition eating and drinking, and then he entered the bath and exercised his usual/said routines.
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	And some experienced [physicians] have said that when a wound happens in the intestine and it is small, then it must be bound in this way: you take ants with large heads; and then bring together the two lips of the wound and place one of these ants, having its mouth open, over the two lips of the wound; then when it bites down on them and closes its mouth, cut off its head, for it will adhere and will not be dislodged.
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	And then place another ant near the first, and don't stop doing this with ants one next to the other along the length of the entire wound.
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	And then return/reduce it and sew the wound; and those heads will remain attached to the intestine until the intestine is healed; and no harm will come to the patient.
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	And it is also possible that the intestine be sewn with fine thread which is made from animal intestine attached to it, after it has been threaded onto a needle; and you take the end of this intestinal thread, and it should be very clean/thinned, and then tie the end of it with thread from it, wrapped around, and then thread this thread onto needles and sew the intestine with it, and replace it in the rupture.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	And this method of suturing with ants is only by way of trust and hope. 
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	But if the wound is large and wide, especially if it is in one of the small intestines, for then there is no remedy but alleviation, and it cannot be completely healed.
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	On the treatment of scrofula and fistula.
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	Know that every wound and abscess, when it becomes chronic and old, and becomes an ulcer, and is not consolidated and constantly emits pus and is not cut out, then, in whatever limb it may be, is universally called a fistula and we call that scrofula. 
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	And a fistula, in truth, is a hard, white, felted lump, which is not painful and which has a cavity like the cavity of a bird's feather; and for this reason it is called a feathery ulcer, that is, a quill.
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	And in some men it is moist, which emits pus; and the moisture is very easily cut away in a few hours. 
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	And sometimes this moisture is thick, and it is scant, and it is coarse, and it is thin.
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	And I have already said before in the division, when I discussed wounds, that any ulcer that is not healed nor has bare flesh in it, is so only for one of nine reasons: of which one is either due to lack of blood in the body; or due to the poor condition of the place; or because between it and the edges there is hard flesh preventing the growth of flesh; or because it is of thick consistency; or because that ulcer itself is putrid within and the matter that is sent there is of poor quality; or because the medicine is unsuitable for its treatment; or when corruption falls on the region, and it is pestilence; or due to the nature of the region, as happens in Saragossa, where the digestion of illnesses is difficult, and the healing of abscesses is delayed by nature; or because there is one bone, or many bones in it.
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	I have already shown all these causes, and their signs, and their treatment with medicines in the division.
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	And it is necessary that I make you know the treatment of a fistula which is done by means of an operation with the hand.
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	And know that fistulas occur in all the limbs of the body; for there are fistulas that reach the large veins and arteries, or the nerves, or the skull, or the intestine, or the bladder, or to any of the ribs, or to any of the vertebrae of the back, or to any of the joints composed by composition such as those of the hand and foot; and there are those that cause damage to the nearby principal limb and similar ones.
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	And so those of these fistulas that are in this manner are among the illnesses difficult to heal, and do not receive treatment, and occupying oneself with them is labor and ignorance.
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	And if there are any fistulas whose depth does not reach these places that I have mentioned, and you hope and trust in its treatment, and you want to arrive at knowledge of it, then take a probe of brass or iron, and if the fistula goes straight, you will explore it with it.
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	But if the fistula is tortuous, then investigate it with a thin lead probe, because lead, with the lightness of its body, is easily bent and curved along the tortuosity.
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	And if the fistula has many horrific movements/openings, it is not possible for you to explore it with a probe.
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	Then inject the opening through its orifices, for the liquid with which you inject it will go towards the other orifices and run out of them.
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	And then inquire carefully, according to whatever way it is possible for you to know if there are bones or nerves there, and if the cavity of the fistula is deep or shallow, or if it is a fistula that has many orifices. And be about all this with the sum of your strength, with your questioning, with which you question the patient, and the discovery of pain through your compression with your hand on the place, and indications of the symptoms and of the causes incidental to the abscess/fistula.
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	And when you have considered all these matters with true attention, then proceed to the treatment with confidence: and you should consider then if the fistula is clearly superficial or in a safe place, far from a joint, or from a nerve, or from an artery, or from a vein, or from one of the places which I have told you.
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then you dry the fistula according to what was said before in its description, and remove that which is in it, the discharge and corrupted flesh, and that which has grown in the opening of the flesh, or of skin and the like, and treat it until it is healed.
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	But if the fistula is of deep profundity, and is straight, then it is necessary that you incise it deeply as much as is possible for you, and then cleanse it of all its corrupted flesh; and then administer bandages soaked in sharp/caustic medicines, and insert them into the cavity of the fistula, which you have grasped with an instrument.
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	And do this a few times until the sharp/caustic medicine corrodes everything remaining in the cavity of the fistula from the corruption.
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	And then restore it with ointments that generate healthy flesh until it is healed.
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	But if it is not healed by this, then you cauterize it as we have described.
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	But if the cause of the fistula is bone and you are certain of this, then you will examine it and dry it as we have recommended, unless you are prevented by some vein or nerve or principal member, as we have said.
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is exposed to you and there is any corruption and blackness in it, then you scrape it until all the corruption is removed; and then treat it with something that will make it flesh again until it is healed.
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	And if it is not healed and emits discharge as it did before, then know that you have not reached all of the corrupted part; and then you uncover it again and carefully carry out its scraping and cleaning with your utmost strength, and then restore it. 
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	And then if it is healed, it is good; and if not, then know that the corruption is in the deep recesses of the body, which you have not been able to reach, and then you have no choice but to leave it alone.
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	And if the corrupted bone is small, or you are able to extract it, then extract it with fine forceps suitable for this purpose.
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	And if there are many bones, then carefully extract all of them, and leave nothing behind using all your strength.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	But if some sort of humidity obstructs you, and there is no danger or risk of error in cutting them, then cut those ligaments or flesh if they are there, and free the bones.
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	But if you are not prepared to remove the bones at this time, then apply to the wound something that will make the wound rot, and leave it until the flesh and ligaments around those bones have decayed, and make sure the wound does not heal, and keep the incision you made during your operation open.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Meanwhile, if you are worried, place on it cotton soaked in ground soap with oil, or cotton soaked in Egyptian ointment, or in some of the green ointments, because when those ligaments rot, and the bones are separated from them, their removal and extraction will be easier.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	But if it is a large bone such as the bone of the leg or thigh or similar, and only its surface is corrupted, then scrape it with a rasp only on the surface until the blackness and corruption are removed, and then heal the wound. 
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	But if a large part of it is corrupted, and the corruption has already reached the bone marrow, then it is necessary to cut it open and completely incise it up to the place where the corruption has reached, and then treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I will tell you what happened to a man in his thigh, so that you can use it as an example and aid in your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	There was a young man, about thirty years old, who experienced pain in his thigh, and from the inner parts [the pain] moved on the matter within the body until the matter reached the thigh, and it was matter of an abscess with a large abscess, and he had no external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And then the time was prolonged with this due to the error of the physicians until the abscess opened, and many substances rushed out of it, and its treatment was then applied until the leg became fistulous, and many orifices were made in it, all of which emitted putrefaction and bodily fluids.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then a multitude of physicians treated him for about two years, and there was no wise hand among them in the art, until I was called.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw his leg and the substances that flowed from those orifices in large quantities; and the man's body was already quite weakened and his color was jaundiced/yellowish. 
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then I inserted a probe into one of those orifices and the probe reached the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	And then I quickly examined all the orifices and found them reaching the bone from all parts of the leg.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then I took a knife and incised over one of those orifices until I uncovered a part of the bone, and I found it corrupted, and it was already earthy and corrupted and blackened; and a part of the leg was already corrupted so that it had penetrated into the marrow.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then I scraped what was uncovered and prepared of the exposed bone for me. (Alternatively: And then I scraped the exposed and prepared part of the bone that was uncovered for me.)
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I thought that the corruption, which I excised and scraped, was not in the bone, and I had already eradicated it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And then I applied a restorative treatment to the wound with consolidating medicine for a long time, and it did not heal/consolidate.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And then I reiterated and uncovered the bone a second time, on top of the first uncovering, and I found continuing corruption in the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I scraped away what appeared to me of that corruption, and then I endeavoured/tried hard to treat and restore it, but it was not restored/healed.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I uncovered it again and I didn't stop incising the bone little by little, piece by piece, and I forced its healing, but it was not healed until I had incised around a palm's width of it, and I extracted that with its marrow, and then I treated that with medicines, and it healed/closed easily and was cured.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And there was no need for repetition in its operation and cutting except for the disposition of its fragility and because of its low tolerance and fear of death, for he suffered at all times from an excess of evacuation and a bad syncope/fainting.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And thus he was healed by a complete healing, and there is no hard flesh in place of bone; and his bodily disposition became good and his strength returned; and he goes about his business and suffers no adverse effects in walking nor harm in any matter.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if there is a protruding bone in the body already broken/fractured, then you must cut it in this way: take a bandage and tie it tightly at the extremity of that protruding bone, and order someone to pull it upwards; and place a woolen bandage thicker than the first bandage; and then tie it over the flesh that is below the bone, and extend its end so that you draw the flesh to the lower parts, and you uncover the flesh over the place which you want to saw so that the saw does not injure the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a piece of wood or a board suitably under the bone, for when you do this the saw is prevented from cutting the healthy flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And the sawing must be done over the corrupted place little by little, for if there is corruption in the cavity of the bone and it does not appear to the senses, you will be obliged to saw it again.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	And if the bone is corrupted and not protruding, rather one part is continuous with the other, and the corruption is in the middle or in part of it, then you uncover the flesh completely on all sides; and then place wood underneath, and then saw it from the first part where the corruption is located until the sawing is continuous with the other part. 
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And the sawing should be done a little at a time, according to the location of the corruption, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in the joint, incise that corrupted joint, and saw the bone where it is connected to the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption lies in the area between two joints, then there is no set rule, but rather ingenuity is required. (Implies the surgeon must use their judgement/skill).
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the palm of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, it is necessary that you investigate how the corruption appears to you, and that you open it, and clean it according to every means possible to you, and with every bit of ingenuity you can muster, so long as you do not encounter a vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know that the incisions and the saws for incising these bones are numerous according to the location of the bones, and their preparation, and their thickness, and their thinness and their size, both large and small, and their hardness and their porousness; therefore, it is necessary that you prepare for each type of operation the instrument appropriate to that operation. 
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that this operation instructs you about the kind of instrument you should use; when you have great study and long experience and knowledge of the methods of this art, and experience with many kinds of illnesses, for then you will have for yourself that which is fitting, the instruments for every disease.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And I am teaching you, at the end of this chapter, the number of instruments that you will set out simply, with which you will proceed to your goal, which you will test on others.
Forma de serra:	The shape of a saw:
Forma de autra serra:	The shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	The shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	The shape of another large saw:
Forma de ray:	Shape of a ray (or radius/spoke):
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this ray be in the shape of the head of a star-shaped nail, and its points be in the shape of the points of alstefegi (likely a type of nail or pointed tool).
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is only necessary that with this the heads of the joints be rubbed when they are corrupted, or the mouth (opening/wound) is large and wide. 
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Shaped like a razor, larger than the others: 
Forma de razori menor:	Shaped like a razor, smaller:
Forma de razori lat:	Shaped like a broad razor:  (or "wide razor")
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	Shape of another saw properly made:  it should be made arched from above and its sharpness of iron, and its handle of boxwood, suitably crafted.
Forma de lu:	Its shape: (or "The shape of it:")
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	Shape of a razor in which there is a concavity: (or "...which has a hollow")
Forma de razori autra subtil:	Shape of another subtle razor: (or "...fine razor", or "...thin razor")
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	Shape of another razor with a curved extremity/tip: (or "...with a curved end")
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	Shape of a small razor resembling a tentacle/probe: (or  "...looking like a tentacle/probe")
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	Shape of an incisor with which bones are incised/cut:
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of another, smaller incisor/knife:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another incisor; this one resembling a ray (fish), and its extremity/tip is like a saw, and is shown in many places in the discussion/chapter of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a ray (fish) which is suitable for the discussion/chapter of that which is perforated/pierced in the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extremity/end is triangular and with a sharp point/tip.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian steel (iron), and similarly it is necessary that all the things that we have said about razors and incisors and saws (apply to this).
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	On the incision/cutting of extremities and the sawing of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities may rot either due to an internal cause or an external cause, or when you have treated that corruption/infection by applying those medicines and the treatment is not effective, or you see the corruption spreading through the limb without any apparent cause, then it is necessary that you incise/cut that limb up to the point where the corruption reaches, so that the patient may escape death or a worse affliction/damage of the limb through this.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of the one to whom this happens is that the limb becomes black as if burned by fire, or if near the blackness the rot spreads within the limb, consuming it and spreading throughout the body; and then attend to it with an incision/cut.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the cause of the corruption/infection is a bite or sting from some venomous creatures such as a sea scorpion, viper, or a spider (rutela - likely a type of venomous spider) and similar creatures.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption/infection or bite is at the tip of the finger, then you should incise/cut the finger and not give space for the corruption to spread into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if it happens to the hand, then you should incise/cut it at the wrist joint, and not give space for the corruption/infection to spread into the forearm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if it affects that (the forearm), then you should incise/cut the arm up to the elbow joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption spreads further and you see it around the elbow, then in that case the patient's death is likely; and to administer other treatment beyond this point is a waste of effort/resources (literally: quantity of virtue/power).
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do with the foot, when corruption affects a toe, then you should incise/cut it back to one of the ankle bones/joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the arch of the foot, then you should incise/cut the whole foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it progresses into the knee, then you incise the leg up to the knee joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached above the knee, then there is no remedy but resignation, and leaving the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the manner of incising the limb or stitching it is that you tighten a ligature on the part below which you want to cut, and tighten another ligature above the location; and have an assistant stretch a ligature on the lower part, and have the assistant stretch another ligature above; and you separate the flesh which is between the two ligatures with a flat spatula until all the flesh is exposed; and then it should be incised or stitched. 
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary that linen cloth be placed around it on all sides so that it doesn't touch the area itself, and so that further injury and a hot abscess don't afflict the patient.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if there is a flow of blood when you operate, then you cauterize the affected area carefully, or place on it some powders that restrict the blood; and then return to your treatment until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the wounded limb with a bandage in a suitable place, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I will recount to you what happened to a man in his foot, this same accident which I have recounted to you, which is that blackness occurred in his foot with a burn that resembled a fire burn.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption occurred first in his toe until it spread to the whole foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepared himself, after seeing the treatment go to the limb with such vehemence that he was overcome with pain and burning, and he himself cut off that foot at the joint, and was healed.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time he had the same corruption in the index finger of his hand. 
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then he came to me, and I endeavoured to drive back that excess with what I applied on his hand, of the medicines, after cleansing his body; and the excess was not driven back and began to spread to the other finger until it began in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he asked me to cut off his hand, and I did not want to do this, hoping for the reduction of that excess, and more because I feared his death following the cutting off of his hand, for the patient's constitution was declining.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he despaired of me, he returned to his land and it reached me that that man prepared himself and cut off his entire hand, and was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this account except so that it may be helpful concerning what befalls this illness, and that it may be a sign by which it is signified and according to which one should act.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the treatment of sinuses and the method of administering enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshy member and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it forms a collection of pus, and then it ruptures and is perforated, and the pus comes out of it, and the place remains empty as if it were a vessel, and the skin that is above it is like thinned cloth, and it has not reached a further state of decay, and it does not affect the bone or nerve or ligament, it is called a sinus, and is not called a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But however, if the space is prolonged until the decay presses upon some member, then it is called a fistula and not zukem (possibly an ulcer or similar affliction).
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment for it is that you incise that skin entirely as it is rolled up, especially when it is thinned and has become like cloth, and take care that it doesn't adhere to the site due to its decay/infection.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the skin will adhere and that that decay/infection will not have spread further, and on the surface the skin looks healthy, then you treat that with an enema/clyster.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And consider the sinus, and then if it is large, and the discharge that comes from it has a foul odor, then administer an enema with an Egyptian medicine which is made of oil, sour wine, and ginger in equal parts, and they are put together in a vessel, and cooked over fire until the medicine becomes red and reaches the thickness of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then take of it what is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and administer an enema with that into the sinus, and constrict its opening, and leave the medicine in it for the duration of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then extract it by pressing/squeezing; and do this for as many days as necessary until the sinus is cleansed and the foul odor is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is treated with an enema of ash water, when this medicine is not available to you; and you should take the ash of vines, and pour water over it; and then strain it and administer it as an enema until you are confident that the sinus has then been cleaned. 
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine nor the ash water, then administer an enema with water and honey and ground ginger mixed in, or administer an enema with wine and honey mixed, because it is a property of honey to cleanse and wash, and the wine makes the sinus contract, especially when the wine has an excess of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this a few times and you are sure that the sinus has been removed, then administer an enema with that which makes flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you should take diachylon ointment and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine; or you can administer an enema with other medicines and ointments that have the properties that I have already described in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the opening of the sinus is narrow so that the enema cannula cannot be inserted, then you should gradually widen it with a small iron tool, and place lint wrapped in Egyptian ointment or basilicon ointment in it until it is widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly, if the opening is too wide, then you should bring the edges of it together with sutures and leave an opening just large enough for the enema to enter without difficulty.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening from which the discharge flows is elevated in its upper parts, then dry it in the lowest place that is there so that the discharge flows downwards, because when the discharge is held back in the depth of the sinus, flesh will be generated in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if you cannot dry the sinus around the lowest bone as you wish, then you must prepare the limb with a preparation so that the discharge will flow easily, as is suitable for you, and that no part of the discharge be retained in it. 
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that are suitable to be placed on the sinus, spread them on linen cloth, for the purpose you intend.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be large enough to cover the whole sinus; and then cut with scissors, directly at the opening of the sinus, a hole slightly larger than the opening of the sinus; then spread on another linen cloth some ointment of lilies, according to the size of the hole, and place it over the [first cloth] some distance away from the opening of the sinus so that the exit of the discharge from it is eased, and do not remove the cloth except every few days, once [per period].
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But [change] the one that is over the opening of the sinus constantly so that what accumulates there from the discharge comes out.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know whether that which flows from it, of the discharge, is much or little, or is healthy [digested], or unhealthy [undigested].
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And in this way you examine the area of that sinus, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if there is an abscess there.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the matter that is released upon the opening of the sinus is sticking, or is close to sticking, then you may loosen it on the second or third day, and when you loosen the wound, then change the cloth for another and renew the ointment. 
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if a subtle/thin virus comes out of the sinus near the area, then do not despair of its adhesion, for its healing is near, because there are some men in whom the generation of flesh in their wounds is slow, and there are those in whom the opposite is true.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if for many days undigested discharge has come out of the sinus, then know that the sinus is not closing/healing; and if the closure of the sinus is delayed and the cause is prolonged, then you adjust by drying the medicines, and if the medicines are moist in their substance and in their virtue, they are dried thus as diachylon ointment, when a surplus of the addition of wax is included in it.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last thing with which it is treated is that you take diachylon ointment and dissolve it in rose oil, and old wine equal in quantity to it is poured over it, and then you mix that with it, and use that. 
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it acts similarly, when there is no discharge, diachylon ointment, honey that is cooked until it is thickened, and use that; or that you take myrrh and aloe and incense, and grind everything and sprinkle it on the honey when it is on the fire, and then spread this on cloth and tighten it over the sinus; or spread it with the honey which you have cooked until it is thickened, and sprinkle it on cloth and tighten it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes long birthwort and roots of lily of the valley are administered with it (and it is lily of the valley) and orris-root powder and centaury, and use these simples either by themselves or mixed, grind these and sieve and sprinkle on the honey which I have mentioned; and use it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinus is prolonged, and is not healed by this treatment, then know that the corruption is deep within it, and already makes an inquest into the bones or into the other hard members or to the ligaments; then you treat it with fistula treatment, as is said above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	On the treatment of panaritium (whitlow) and ingrown nail and addition of finger incision and cutting.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	A panaritium is an abscess which arises under the nail of the thumb or the big toe, and easily arises on the other fingers or toes, and when it is prolonged and its treatment is neglected, or it festers from a hot abscess, or is corrupted, and it emits discharge until it corrodes the roots of the nail, and easily corrupts it entirely, and easily spreads its corruption to the bone until it has a foul odor, and the extremity of the finger or toe is damaged, and its color becomes dark.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And so when you have that with what we have said in the division and do not complete your treatment, then it is necessary that you incise with iron all the excess that remains of the nail and then cauterize the wound immediately, because a hot cautery is very helpful in this.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is healthy and the nail is healthy, and the additions (edges) of the nail now compress the flesh on the inner parts, and begin to prick and injure it, then it is necessary that you place a thin sliver under the angle of the nail that pricks the flesh, and lift it up and incise that flesh with ease, and place upon what remains of the flesh corrosive burning medications until it is all removed; and then treat it with ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption has already reached the bone, then it is necessary that you incise that bone and extract it, for it will never be healed while the corrupted bone remains there.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the corrosion and the corruption spreading into the finger, then you should incise it at one of the joints according to the aforesaid procedure, and immediately treat it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail suffers a blow or abrasion, and severe pain arises in it, then you must first phlebotomize the patient, and then immediately lance the nail with a sharp knife with a transverse cut from top to bottom, and be careful that the cut does not reach the flesh that is under the nail, for you will cause the patient severe pain, and it will also lead to the growth of excess proud flesh in the area; and then treat the place with something that reduces pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But an extra finger, which is born on the hands of some men, very easily becomes fleshy, and very easily bones grow in it, or very easily a nail grows in it.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born at the root of the joint, or they originate at some of the joints of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But the one that is born at some joint of the finger is not bad, and the one that is born at the roots of the joints is very easily made bad/infected.  (Or perhaps, "easily becomes worse.")
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those that are born fleshy, the removal is easy, and that is that you cut it off at its base with a broad knife. 
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But of the one that is born at the root of the joint, the treatment is difficult; and so refrain from cutting it off.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But in the one that is born on the finger near the joints, it is necessary that you first cut the flesh around it with a circular incision down to the bone, and then saw it with one of those saws suitable for this, and then treat it until it is healed. 
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But [regarding] consolidation, which occurs to the fingers amongst themselves many times, either by a birth defect of the man who is born thus, or by consolidation of a wound or by burning with fire, or similar things, then it is necessary that you cut that consolidation until the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place between them cloths soaked in rose oil so that they are not consolidated/joined together easily/prematurely, and separate them, or place between them a thin sheet of lead until it is healed as it should be. 
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly if consolidation/joining occurs in some fingers with the palm, then you cut that consolidation/joining as is prepared and appropriate to the shape of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Regarding the incision of varicose veins, these are varices (varicose veins).
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varices are varicose veins, and they are convoluted, thick veins full of melancholic superfluities which occur in many parts of the body, and their most frequent occurrence is in the legs, and especially in the legs of travelers, laborers, and porters.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, it is necessary that you administer a purging of the body of black bile sometimes with strong expulsive medicine, and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	But their treatment with iron (surgical instruments) is according to two methods: one is that they be incised and that black blood be drawn out, and the other method is that the vein be lifted and extracted completely.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision of it (the varicose vein) is according to this method: first foment the leg with hot water until the thick blood, which is foul, is dissolved from the leg, and then constrict the patient's leg from the highest part of the thigh down to the part below the knee with a bandage, and then cut the vein in one place, or in two, or in three with a wide incision, and then elevate the black blood with your hand from the lower part of the leg upwards, and from above downwards, until the quantity of blood you want and see fit has come out, and which the patient's strength will tolerate.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bandage it (the leg), and order him (the patient) to abstain from foods that engender black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment by phlebotomy (blood-letting) when the veins are full and the patient notices it.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But their elevation (vein removal) is according to this method: you who shave the patient's leg if there is a lot of hair on it, and then put him in a bath and foment his leg with hot water until it reddens and the veins are swollen; or let him be exerted by strong exercise, if a bath is not available to you, until the limb is heated.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cut the skin on the right of the vein by an incision lengthwise or behind it below the knee, or at the lowest part of it, below the heel.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then open the skin with hooks and scrape the vein all around until it appears to the touch, and it is from its appearance that you see it red declining to black.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then when you pull back and away from the skin you see it white, like a cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then you put the thread underneath it until it is lifted and pulled away from the skin, and suspend it with a hook or thread.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then make another cut near that cut the space of three fingers, and then scrape the skin of the part above the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then lift it and cut it in the second cut along the length of the cut, then pull it out and lift it until it comes out through the second cut, and then pull it out of the cut that is above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you pull it out of the cut that is highest or most above all the cuts, until it is all out; and then cut it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if it doesn't obey you in pulling and lifting, then insert a needle with strong, doubled thread and tie it and pull it out, or insert the thread under it and turn your hand in every direction until it is pulled out. 
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful that it is not cut; because if it is broken, it is very difficult for you to lift it and harm will have come to the patient because of it. 
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when you have completely removed it, then place wool soaked in wine and rose oil and regular oil on the area of the wound, and treat it until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vein is contracted, having tortuosity, to which there is wrapping around the parts, and it is not according to straightness as we have said, then it is necessary that you cut above it at every point of tortuosity and at the places of wrapping, and then suspend it with hooks until you lift the whole thing.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And beware in your cutting that you do not incise the vein and that you do not wound it, because it will be difficult for you to lift it; and use your prudence in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of the incision with which the vein is cut:
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of a golden hook:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not sharp like the hooks nor is it of pointed extremity so that it does not wound the vein; and it has the substantial flexibility of a lion, for if it were thin, it would cut the vein by its thinness; having superfluous thickness as we have said. 
De extraccio venae cruris.	On the extraction of a leg vein. (Or: Concerning the removal of a vein from the leg.)
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in hot countries such as in al-Ategi in the land of the Arabs and in the hot and arid lands of India with little moisture and in which neither grass nor tree grows.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is very easily generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its formation is from putrefaction that comes under the skin, like how serpents and worms and parasites and maggots arise within the body, generated between the skin and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And a sign of the approaching arrival/development of this vein is that vehement inflammation occurs in the leg; and then the area blisters; and then the vein begins to emerge from the location of that blister, which looks like a plant root.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And then when the end of it appears, then you must wrap around it a piece of lead weighing one drachma to two drachmas, and tie it and leave the lead hanging from the leg. 
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as something comes out of it to the outside parts, wrap it in lead and tie it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if it is very long/extended, then you incise a part of it and wrap the remainder; and do not incise its root until it has come out, because if you incise it, it retracts and goes into the flesh and causes an abscess and rotting in the place and a bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.
