And he who wishes to bandage his arm and dissolve/reduce his blood a second time, must, if the phlebotomy is for a large evacuation, and his constitution is cold, evacuate the blood little by little, that is, according to the strength of his constitution, on consecutive days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But he who wants to bandage his arm, and let his blood [flow] a second time, and his body is strong, then let him do this about seven or nine hours after the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But he who wants to draw the blood from his body away from the part to which it flows, must be bandaged on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But that body in which there is much heated blood and is acute and causes fever, must have its blood let all at once and a large quantity should be drawn and the opening enlarged until syncope occurs, after you have observed all the conditions of phlebotomy; and you should place your hand on his pulse on the side away from the bleeding, so that death does not occur instead of syncope, because this happens many times when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And it is not appropriate when you want to untie the arm and evacuate the blood a second time, since the opening of the vein has already closed and the outflow of blood is difficult, that you press upon it with vehemence and that which is bent is extended forcefully, for this is very bad.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Leave it alone until it is phlebotomized a second time; or remove what is coagulated from the blood at the opening of the vein with the sharpness of the lancet; or place on it some al-faruq theriac, or dragon's blood, and compress it lightly until the blood flows out.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is infected/abscessed, then leave it alone and do not touch it until the infection/abscess has subsided.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if necessity compels you to evacuate the blood a second time, and there is no other option, then you bleed the patient on that area or in the other arm in another vein. 
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called "rope of the arm" is phlebotomized in place of the cephalic or basilic vein, when they are not found or are hidden, because it is composed of them.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	And the way to perform phlebotomy on him is that the patient puts his hand in warm water until the forearm reddens and the vein appears clearly.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	And then it should be tightened above it with a bandage with moderate pressure; and then phlebotomize according to the small transversal, not latitudinally nor longitudinally. 
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And let the opening be wide and let your phlebotomy be such that you phlebotomize it over the joint of the hand a little.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is stopped, then you put the hand back in the warm water and let the blood run into the water until you achieve the required amount.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the summer days, then you are excused from putting the hand back in the warm water, although it is better to place the blood vessel in warm water in winter time.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And phlebotomy of this vein is safer than all other veins, because there is no pulsating vein, nor nerve, underneath it.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And phlebotomy of the cephalic vein of the right hand is beneficial for diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the proper way to perform phlebotomy is that you tighten the hand with a bandage or with your hand, after you have placed it in warm water, until the vein is swollen and clearly visible; then phlebotomize it transversely; and if you cut it completely, this will not harm anything.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And be careful not to damage your hand with the phlebotomy, because underneath there are the nerves of the fingers, bare of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And then return the hand to the warm water and let the blood flow into it, because if you don't return it to the warm water, the blood will coagulate in the opening of the vein, and its flow will be blocked.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the blood has been extracted according to the necessary amount, then you put oil and salt on the vein, so that it is not closed up too quickly; and similarly you must do with any narrow branch (vein).
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But the benefit of phlebotomy in the left hand is that it is suitable for diseases of the spleen.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do likewise in his phlebotomy as you have done in the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the benefit of phlebotomy of the saphenous vein applies to diseases that are in the lower part of the body, such as diseases of the uterus, and retention of menses, and diseases of the kidneys and ulcers of the thighs and old legs, and similar ailments.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the procedure for his phlebotomy is that the patient puts his foot in hot water and rubs it until the veins appear well; and tie above the ankle with a strap; and the place of the vein to be cut appears above the said thumb, and from it are branched many small veins on the surface of the foot.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And then phlebotomize the largest branch either below the leg above the heel or below its confluence, because it is better and safer.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you phlebotomize it on the surface of the foot, then beware of the nerves that are beneath it on the surface of the foot, and position your lancet with which you phlebotomize across, as if you intended to incise it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the phlebotomy be ample/generous. / And let the bleeding be substantial.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the flow of blood is restricted; then you immerse his foot in the hot water again and let the blood flow into it until it is evacuated/drained.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist errs on the first attempt, then repeat with the lancet a little above, because the location is safe; and do not fear to harm him, but beware of the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do the same with the saphenous vein of the other foot.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And concerning the sciatic vein, the location, as we have said, is behind the heel below the ankle on the outer side. / And as for the sciatic vein, the place, as we have said, is behind the heel bone beneath the ankle of the left leg.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of its phlebotomy (bloodletting from it) is for hip pain when caused by hot blood.  / And the benefit of phlebotomy there is for pain in the hip when it is caused by hot blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the proper way to perform phlebotomy on it is that the patient enter a bath, and quickly and tightly bind his thigh on the side of the hip down to above the heel with a long, thin bandage, for it (the vein) appears only by doing this.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And then when it appears, you then phlebotomize it according to whatever method is possible for you and across (transversely), and that is better; or incise it by making an incision or cut it by sectioning, because the area is safe. / And when it appears, you should then perform phlebotomy on it by any method you can, preferably transversely; or make an incision, or sever it completely, because that location is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is very hidden in many men; and if you find it, and it does not appear clearly to the touch, then phlebotomize a branch of it, which is the one that appears on the top of the foot near the little toe and the ring toe. / And it is very hidden in many people; and if you find it, but it is not readily apparent to the touch, then you should bleed a branch of it, which is the one that appears on the top of the foot towards the little and ring toes.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And beware of the nerves, and let flow the quantity of blood that you desire.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then loosen the bandage and place cotton over the site of the phlebotomy and compress the area, for it is easily healed.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Concerning cupping/venesection and the properties of their use. /  On cupping therapy and the characteristics of its use. (Ventosacio refers specifically to a cupping procedure, not just general venesection, though bloodletting is often a component).
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Cupping glasses are made of horn, or brass, or glass.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And cupping is done in two ways: one of them is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is cupping without scarification (dry cupping).
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this cupping that is without scarification is done in two ways, for it is either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And for cupping that is administered with scarification and blood extraction, there are fourteen locations on the body, one of which where cups are placed is on the inion (back of the head), and it is the rear part of the head; and the middle location of it [the head?] between the two sides of the neck together; and cupping of the chin below the mandible, further below the mouth; and cupping of the two shoulder blades; and cupping on the alohoster, and that is above the end of the tailbone (coccyx); and cupping of the two armpits, which are below the two arms; and cupping of the two ankles; and cupping of the two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And cupping does not extract blood except from the small veins dispersed in the flesh, and because of this, the strength does not fall through them, as is the case with phlebotomy (venesection); nor should cupping be done, with fire or without fire, in any illness caused by repletion (excess) until the whole body has been evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity compels cupping because of illness or for maintenance, we administer it at any time at the beginning of the month and at its end, and in the middle of it and at whatever time it may be.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The reason is that there are men in whom blood is multiplied until they need to extract it by cupping, and they find heaviness and dizziness in their head; and there are those who find fullness and redness in their face and in their head, and in their neck; and there are those who find itching in their face and in their forehead and darkness and dullness in their eyes; and there are those from whom the site of their cupping oozes; and there are those whose laughter is excessive; and there are those who find a taste of blood in their mouth, or whose tongue is blistered and they spit blood; and there are those whose sleep is excessive, and those who see blood in their sleep, redness, and old men, and wounds, and other similar things. 
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And so when you see any of these signs, and especially if it is in the third or middle of the month, then we recommend that cupping be done after two or three hours of the day have passed.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of cupping on the nape of the neck is that it helps with heaviness in the head and that which affects the eyes; but it is necessary that this be near a time of complete evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this cupping is in the place of phlebotomy of the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not permitted for someone of a cold complexion, or someone who has a catarrh, to use it, because it causes them great harm. 
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for this reason, old people, and those whose heads suffer from cold ailments, should not use it.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But for those on whom it is continuously used, it causes forgetfulness; and therefore you should instruct the cupper to pause his hand a little with the cup at the lower parts, for fear of causing forgetfulness.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But cupping with alkali is in the place of phlebotomy of the median cubital vein and the basilic vein: and therefore it benefits asthma, constriction of the breath, damage to the respiratory system, coughs, and fullness/plethora.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And the alkali cup should be applied lightly, because if it is placed heavily, it generates weakness in the body and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And cupping with alhagdahan (possibly a type of cupping material) is beneficial for accidental pains in the head, ophthalmia (eye inflammation), migraine, suffocation, and pain in the roots of the teeth; and it replaces phlebotomy of the basilic vein. 
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And you should instruct the cupper not to press his hand with the scarification tool lest he incise an artery and cause excessive bleeding.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And cupping under the chin benefits canker sores in the mouth, corruption of the gums, and similar oral diseases; and it replaces phlebotomy of the veins (aliheric) that are in the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But cupping done over the two shoulder blades is beneficial for headache (caphatan), which is caused by an excess of heat. 
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And cupping on both sides within the armpits effectively replaces phlebotomy of three veins, namely the basilic, median cubital (fusca), and cephalic veins, because it draws blood from all the smaller veins in the flesh, and those smaller veins from larger ones until the drawing reaches the three main veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And instruct the cupper not to go too deep in the scarification, because the area [the armpit] is lacking in flesh, and underneath are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And there is a cupping glass which is used on the hips, and it benefits hemorrhoids of the anus and deeper ulcerations.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And you should instruct the cupper to use a large cupping glass, and that it be made of bronze, because the location requires strong suction; and thin cupping glasses break easily and it should be scarified with a scarificator.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But cupping glasses on the legs lessen manifest plethora, because they draw blood from the whole body, and benefit old aches of the kidneys and womb, and of the bladder; and provoke menstruation, and benefit buboes and swollen glands; and they take the place of phlebotomy of two saphenous veins, thus relieving them, and of two ankle veins. 
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they greatly weaken the whole body and cause fainting in many men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the relief from cupping glasses on the groin is similar to the relief from cupping glasses on the two legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the proper way to apply the cupping glasses is to place the cupping glass initially empty and draw with moderate suction, and do not prolong the placement of the cupping glasses, but place them lightly, and remove them carefully, so that the humors come to the location with a gradual arrival.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to repeat this and continue until you see the place redden and swell and the redness of the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scarify and repeat the suction little by little, and then consider the disposition of the bodies.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For a person who is of tender flesh with sparse pores, it is necessary that you scarify him only once and no more, so that the place does not ulcerate.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And order the cupper to widen the scarification and deepen it a little, and moderate the suction gently.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if there is thickness in the blood, then you must scarify twice, because on the first time the way of thinning is opened to the blood and its wateriness.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But on the second, to the careful examination acquired from the extraction of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very polluted, then let scarification be done a third time so that it attains the rest (of the polluted blood).
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And lastly, when we want to extract the blood little by little, or a small amount, one scarification is enough for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a lot of blood, we scarify with many scarifications; and if we know that the blood is thick, then it is necessary that we scarify with a deep scarification. 
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the limit of scarification is only as deep as the skin.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the person whose skin is thick, hard, dark, and their pores are narrow, it is necessary that the locations for the cupping glasses be anointed with softening, opening, and resolving [ointments]; if it is in summer, such as aloe oil or violet oil, or sweet almond oil, or hip seed oil; and if it is in winter, then narcissus oil, or lily oil, or chamomile oil, or blood oil, and things similar to these.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick and cold, then the oil should be amaranth oil, or balsam mint oil, or aloe oil, or dill oil, and things similar to them. 
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the person to be cupped has wide pores and tender flesh, then it is necessary to avoid oil, and it is necessary for these people that the locations for cupping, close to the time of cupping, be washed with rosewater or with cold nightshade water, or with hip water, or with borage water, and things similar to these.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for the one whose blood has much humidity, wash their cupping locations with sour wine, or with myrtle and sumac water, and things similar to these.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for the one whose superfluities are thick, wash their cupping locations with old wine, or with marjoram water (which is called "sansuc"), or with a decoction of dill, or of chamomile, and things similar to them.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And cupping should be avoided before a bath; for those having it, it should be administered about one or two hours after exiting the bath, and they should sleep after the cupping.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is the necessary regimen for one who is to be cupped or bled before cupping/venesection? (Alternatively: How should one who is to be cupped or bled manage themselves before the procedure?)
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	It is necessary to consider at the beginning: if the person to be cupped or bled is choleric and experiences sharp blood and inflammation, then they should take cooling things, such as sour pomegranates, endive with sour wine and lettuces, hemp, julep, and things similar to them.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And include in their meals things like chicken, and the meat of wild birds, and foods seasoned with sour flavors, and similar things.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for one whose complexion is cold, they should take syrup of marshmallows, or syrup of hemp seeds, and sumac, and a very fragrant medium-dry wine (between old and new); and it is recommended that they partake of little drink and food, and include in their meals chicken, hemp, fish, small birds, and pigeon/dove.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is necessary that on the day of cupping or bloodletting, the drink be greater than the food (i.e., they drink more than they eat).
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it is necessary to give some men Theriac Al Faruq, or medications of musk, that is nutmeg, or alcelita (a kind of confection) to drink at certain times before cupping or bloodletting or immediately afterwards, so that the principal members are strengthened and the blood is thinned; and they should not take those (medications) warm/heated. 
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the cups that are without scarification (dry cupping) are cups that are placed on the liver, and on the spleen and for gout, and on the navel, in the areas of the knees, and the hip socket, for these members do not tolerate scarification on them.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not sought by these (cups without scarification) to draw blood from the limb, as when we place a cup on the breast in the case of nosebleeds; and we use it (cupping) so that cold, ingrained wind/flatulence is dissolved from the limb, as when we place it on the belly and navel; for it rarefies the limb and warms it and reduces the pain because it dissipates flatulence.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it (cupping) is also placed on the kidneys when blockage or pus occurs in them, for by the power of suction it very easily opens the blockage and eradicates the pus from its location. 
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And it does similarly when placed on the liver and spleen because of flatulence enclosed in them.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cups are administered empty with suction only; and sometimes they are administered with fire (fire cupping).
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes they are administered filled with warm water in diseases of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is so that the cup may be filled and be larger, that is, with hot water alone or water in which herbs suitable for this purpose have been boiled.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	The way to make a cup administered with fire: let the width of the opening be two fingers, as we have made it; and the amount of the grip be half a palm; and let it be on its side, in the place that is on the circumference, the middle of it, the hole should be small according to the size that a needle will enter it.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Let it be made of red or yellow brass, with thick, smooth, even and polished edges so that it does not harm the limb where it is placed. 
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And let there be in the middle of it a transverse rod of brass or iron, on which a candle with fire is placed.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And let this cup be much larger than the one we have described; and somewhat smaller than that according to the illnesses and the age of the one who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cups for children and weakened individuals are different than the cups for young people and those with large bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the way to place this cup with fire on the limb is to suitably extend the wick with a wood fire in front of a small wax candle, and place it on the middle of the transverse rod in the middle of the cup, so that the fire is lit around the lower part so that the patient's body is not burned. 
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it should be placed on the patient's limb, and the finger should be over the hole that we have mentioned, until, when we are holding the cups and do not need to uncover the hole and let the vapor escape through it, then the cup will be immediately released. 
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And then light the wick according to the usual manner, and repeat it if you need to.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in a cup that is administered in the disease of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse rod nor hole, it is only administered when it is filled with water, and it is placed on the limb just so.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is its form: And this cup, the larger it is, the better, so that it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter 97.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not administered on many limbs but on those where the placement of cups is not possible, due to their small size, such as the wrist and gums and similar areas; or on a limb devoid of flesh, such as the finger and the nose and their like.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the appropriate way to use them is that if you have found leeches that are in the fresh waters of clean springs...
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they should be left for a day and a night in fresh water until they are hungry, and nothing remains in their bellies; and then the body should be evacuated initially by phlebotomy (blood-letting) and with cups; and then the patient's limb should be rubbed until it reddens; and then the leeches should be placed upon it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full, they will fall off.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if suction of the location with a cupping glass is possible, it is more helpful afterwards. 
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the area with sour wine and then with hot water; and let it be rubbed and pressed. 
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the flow of blood from the body is prolonged after the application of leeches, and it oozes, then you should soak a linen cloth in cold water, and place it over the area until the oozing stops.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the bleeding is profuse, then sprinkle over it crushed vitriol, or gallnuts and similar styptic substances, until the blood is staunched; or place the halves of cooked broad beans on the area, and leave them there until the beans adhere to the area, and the blood is staunched.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And it is necessary, if repeated application of leeches is required, to change them when possible.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the leeches refuse to attach, then rub the area with fresh blood or prick it with a needle in several places until blood comes out; and then apply them, for when they sense blood they will attach immediately. 
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to detach, sprinkle on them a little crushed aloe, or salt, or ash, and they will fall off immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the prologue of the third part: on restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very often necessary in the art of medicine; and it concerns the restoration of fractures and dislocations occurring in the bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, know that foolish and vulgar physicians, and those who have never consulted the books of the Ancients nor read a letter of them, boast about this chapter.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, this method of the learned is hidden in our land; and I have not at any time completely forgotten it; and I have not used what follows, except through long reading of the books of the Ancients and study of their meaning, until I extracted the knowledge from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I applied myself to experimentation and study throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have described in this chapter everything that my knowledge contains and upon which my experience has passed; after having abbreviated it for you and freed it from the burden of lengthiness; and I have shortened it to be concise; and I have demonstrated it clearly; and I have formed in it many forms of the instruments that are administered in it, as is done by adding clarification, just as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summaries and collections on the nature of bone fractures, of those whose premise is necessary, before we begin the discussion of fractured limbs and the different [treatments] of each one.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	It is fitting, then, that we state in the prologue of this chapter the summaries of the discourse; and the chapters to the understanding of which the artisan is forced at the beginning and to dwell on their truth; that is to say, you and those of you who are eager to know or learn this noble art [along with] others.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And so I say that when someone experiences a fracture or dislocation or sprain or fall, then you should attend to at the beginning with phlebotomy (blood-letting) or purging him, or both together, unless some condition prohibits it, such as weakness of strength, or if it happens to a child, or an old man in decrepitude, or it is a time of intense heat, or intense cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And next, let his food consist of cool herbs and the meat of birds and river crabs; and we forbid rich meats and filling himself with foods, and any food that fills the veins with blood, until you are safe from hot swelling, and if you do not fear an outpouring of matter into the limb. 
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to his first regimen, with which he is accustomed.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so when the broken bone begins to be restored, then the patient should be nourished with nutritious foods of much substance, rich and heavy, in which there is viscosity, such as foods made from wheat cooked with water, and rice, and heads, and feet, and bellies of cows, and eggs, and fresh fish, and fat meat and things similar to these, and with this regimen the knitting of the fracture is achieved more easily and better. 
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that broken bones when they are in men who are in their first old age (i.e. beginning to age) and in the decrepit, it is not possible that they be joined and consolidated according to their nature because of the dryness of their limbs.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and joined according to their nature always due to the lack of dryness of those limbs [i.e., due to their moistness/suppleness], and those of them at the end of infancy, like the bones of small children, are joined and consolidated.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	But still, nature adds and applies over the broken bone on all sides a certain glue-like substance, in which there is a thickness that adheres to and binds it together until they are glued and bound together, until they reach their full strength and firmness, as with fire at the beginning, until something prevents it from completing its work. 
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary that you provide the patient with foods in which there is heaviness, viscosity, and richness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is much diversity of fracture according to the diversity of the limb.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fracture are diverse according to the diversity of the limbs, for a fracture of the leg bone is different from a fracture of the skull; and a fracture of the foot bone is different from a fracture of the back bone; and similarly all the other limbs are different from each other.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I come to a consideration of every kind of fracture, explained in its own chapter, distinct from the others.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Much diversity of fracture in itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of bone fracture are diversified in themselves; for there are arched fractures other than those that occur in the ankles; and sometimes a fracture is made along the length of the bone: and these are the fractures of the sagittal, and splint bones, and additions proceeding and not proceeding, as is done in the quill when it is prepared for writing, and there is fracture with wound and disruption in the head, and there is small fissure fracture. 
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And to each type there is a proper device or torment in its restoration according to what will be discussed distinctly in its place.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Many signs of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And by this a bone fracture is recognized: its crookedness, and the prominence and appearance of it to the touch, and this when you compress it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And thus when there is no apparent crookedness in the place nor is it made by your touch when you touch the bone with movement and the patient does not find great pain, then there is no fracture there.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	However, it is possible that there may be crookedness or a small fissure, then you should not press it with your hand and with complete compression; rather, place upon it the medicines of which there will be discussion shortly, which are suitable for the place; and then it should be bound with a light bandage. 
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that the place when it is arched and not split in two or otherwise not seriously injured, such as when any part is removed from its counterpart, then you must begin immediately to straighten it, lest a hot abscess occur there.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if a hot abscess occurs there, then leave it for a few days until the abscess subsides; and then adjust it in whatever gentle and ingenious way you can.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And know that its restoration and healing are easier than for a bone in which a serious injury has occurred. 
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	And then bind it as will be discussed later.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the bones are seriously injured, then it is necessary to extend this broken limb from two sides, if it is the hand or the foot; either with your hand if the limb is small; or with two ropes or with one rope and your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And position yourself so that you place the limb evenly according to its natural shape, while the parts of the broken limb are being extended, then you must return those additional pieces gently and in whatever way you can to their places. 
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And take care, according to your strength, that no pain or injury occurs to the patient because of your work; and you must, according to your ability, apply one bone to its companion according to their best forms.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And it is necessary at that time that you skillfully touch it with your hand, and if you see anything amiss, rectify it and adjust it to the best of your ability.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	And avoid vehement extension and compression, as many foolish doctors do, who often cause an abscess because of their work, or cause contraction in the limb, as we have seen this happen because of their work many times.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then add bandages, appropriate setting, proper handling and binding of that limb, and rest and tranquility; admonish the patient about this and make him avoid disturbing it during his waking hours and his sleep, and watch his turning and movements, and observe his excretions, and observe all his movements with all your ability; and see that the position of the limb is such that pain is prevented, the reason being that when he feels pain or injury in a particular position; then you must change it to another position in which he feels no pain; and see to it that his position is straight and even, so that no crookedness occurs in the limb when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the manner of binding the injured limb is what I recommend; so that you know that broken limbs are diverse in their smallness and in their greatness and in their shape.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those that are small like the arm and the finger and the radius and similar to those, then the wrapping should be of a very fine soft cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	But those that are large like the thigh or the leg, it is necessary that the wrapping on them be wide and strong, because the wide bandage joins the large limb and tightens it on all sides with even pressure, so that no blemish occurs on it.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin your reduction, setting, applying a suitable bandage for this, over the place of the fracture with three or four wrappings according to what the limb requires; and tighten your hand a little with the bandaging.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then go with it to the part most above the location of the fracture, and tighten less than you did the bandaging with which you tightened the place of the fracture itself.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then move away with the bandaging from the site of the fracture a little, and loosen the tightness little by little, until you take in a large area around the site. 
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	And then take another bandage and wrap it again over the broken place with bandaging, and then go with the wrappings to the part below the fracture; and your work in the tightening of the bandaging and in the loosening of it should be according to what we have said about the first bandaging above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	And then place between the turns of tow flax or cloth with which the crookedness of the fracture is padded, if there is crookedness in it; and if not, don't place anything there.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place another bandage on it, and then neatly place freshly made splints on top of these bandages immediately, if there is no hot swelling or abscess in the place, and in that case, apply something which settles the abscess and removes the swelling to it; and leave that for some days; and afterward you may tighten the splints on it. 
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And let the splints be of half of a smoothed peeled cane, and skillfully formed; or they may be of pine wood; or of palm branches; and let the width of each splint be according to this form and this figure:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, it is necessary that the splint that is placed over that fracture be a little thicker and smoother than the other splints, and the length of the splint be according to the size of the limb, large or small; and then tighten another bandage over the splints according to your first tightening; and then tie it up neatly with thread as we have said regarding tightening, which is that your tightening should be greater at the location of the fracture itself, and the further away it is from the fracture, the less the tightening.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And the threads should be medium in thickness and fineness, and made of flax; and if the threads are thick, as I have seen through the practice of some fools placing their threads of twisted hemp cords, that is a great error, because the tightening is uneven. 
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And likewise, thin threads are not suitable, because you will not achieve what you want by tightening with them, and there should not be less than a finger's width between splint and splint.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the patient is hurt by the ends of the splints near the bandaging in those places, then put some tow flax or carded wool underneath them so that this does not cause him injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes a fracture is accompanied by a wound, and a rupture occurs in the skin, and I will come back to this point in the second chapter with a detailed explanation.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And know that not every broken limb is bound with splints on the first day; the reason being that when the limb is large, you should not place splints on it until after five or seven days or more, depending on your certainty regarding the development of a hot abscess/swelling.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the method of plasters with which the Ancients performed restorations, which are placed on fractures and dislocations and sprains.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of a common abbreviated plaster for the restoration of a fracture, suitable for many complexions and especially for women and children, because it is something on which neither heat nor cold comes: and it is that you take mill dust, which is the marrow of the flour that hangs from the movement of the millstone on the walls of the mill.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And prepare it as is, only sieve it with egg white, and make the mixture neither thick nor thin; then use it.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of plaster restoring fracture and dislocation and sprain: take of asafoetida, of labdanum, of acacia, of elecampane, and migrach, which is the root of wild pomegranate, of all ten drams; of myrrh and aloe each five drams; of aloe vera twenty drams; let all be ground and sieved and mixed with aloe water or with egg white if the patient's complexion is heated; then use this plaster, for it is of good composition and restores broken bones easily, and suits many people.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method of plaster which suits fracture and sprain: take migrach (wild pomegranate root) and marshmallow root, each ten drams; of myrrh and of aloe each five drams; of acacia six drams; of Armenian bole twenty drams.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Let all be ground in a mortar with much grinding, and be sieved, and be mixed with water or with egg white and be administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	Method of plaster for joints and bones separated from their places, and which soothes pain occurring in them and in fissures and fractures: take dirty wool and submerge it in sour wine and cooked oil and place it on the area/location.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	But in this plaster there is no power of restoration, of hot abscess and it expels pains properly/effectively.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method of plaster that restores broken bone: take leaves of a wild fig tree and leaves of wild poppy; grind it all and make a plaster from them.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A shortened method of plaster administered after the restoration of a bone fracture and when you want resolution of the remainder of an abscess: take roots of marshmallow, chamomile and violet flowers, and orach flour, one part of each; let all be ground and mixed with wine, if the limb is not heated/inflamed.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is heated/inflamed, then mix it with juice of coriander or with water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of plaster, stronger in resolution than this first one, when a hard abscess occurs after the restoration of the limb: take roots of marshmallow and linseed, and pomegranate rind, and melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, one equal part of each; let all be ground and mixed with willow water or with fresh water or with wine, all this according to the condition of the limb and the return of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Hippocrates did not say in his book that anything be placed on the broken limb after its restoration except a cerate made of wax and oil and nothing else; and he recommended that it be medium in thickness, between thick and thin.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But in Gaul it is seen that things are placed on the broken limb after its restoration, things in which there is desiccation with a little heat, such as myrrh, frankincense, and similar things which we have mentioned.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	Method of plaster that you will make for injury and pain: take breadcrumbs, wax, shaved human hair or bird feathers, marshmallow, and salt, equal parts; let them be ground and sieved and mixed, and let a plaster be made.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	But the length of time that the bandage should remain and when it should be loosened is as follows: consider if there is no pain or itching and if the broken bone has not moved from its place, then you do not loosen it for many days.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	And if severe pain or itching or swelling occurs at the site, then you hasten to loosen it immediately, and remove the plaster from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	And take a linen cloth and a wet sea sponge, and submerge it in warm water, and with that wash the area until the itching stops and the pain is soothed; and then let the limb rest for an hour; and then place upon it clean wool submerged in sour wine and oil or rose oil, and bind it on overnight until you are sure of a warm abscess, and that the swelling of the limb is reduced, and the pain from it is removed.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that light binding and small plaster and do not tighten it as much as your first binding, and continue with this until it is healed.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if you see that the abscess and the redness and the pain and the swelling and all the symptoms are completely gone, and there is no need for plaster and bandaging, then you repeat the procedure as you did at the beginning, equally.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if none of the things we have mentioned happen to the limb, then do not loosen it for about three or four or five or seven days; and sometimes all of this is left for twenty days, depending on what you observe with the loosening of the limb, as we have said, until the fracture adheres, and the flesh coagulates over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then tighten the bandaging more than your first bandaging, and increase the richness of the patient's food, as was previously mentioned concerning him/her.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	But if you see that the site of the fracture has dried and thinned out more than it should, then know that nourishment is prevented from reaching it; and therefore bathe it with lukewarm water every time you loosen it; and do this every three days; and loosen the bandaging a little, and through this procedure nourishment will flow to the limb, and it is easily healed.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what foolish bone-setters do, setting a fractured limb a second time when it wasn't set correctly at the beginning, and is set crookedly, is a mistake in their practice, and a great risk, and if it were correct the Ancients would have emphasized this in their books and would have practiced it.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen any of them do this, so it is more reasonable not to do it.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter Two: On fractures when they occur in the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The types of fractures are many, and their forms are diverse, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are caused by a sword blow, and the blow drives the entire bone into the brain, which is below the bone, just like an axe does in wood, and therefore this type is called a depression fracture ["ascial" likely relates to axe/adze]; or the sword cuts some part of the bone, and cuts the flesh there but the incision does not pass through to the inside of it; and this type of fracture is called a simple incision/superficial wound [literally, "absolute lifting/raising"].
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the damage of these two fractures is either great or small, as is a fracture that is a contusion or bruise; and its cause is a blow with a stone or a fall on a rock, and things like them.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is either penetrating, which then approaches the membrane which is below the bone; or it is on the surface of the bone, and the damage of these two fractures is either great or small.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And there is a fracture that is a hairline crack in the bone, as fine as a hair, and therefore this type is called a hairline fracture [literally "capillary fracture"].
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And there is a fracture that is made either by a fall or by a blow from a stone or similar things, which causes some layer of the bone to go into the inner parts, and a concavity is made in the place, just as happens to copper pots when they are struck and part of them is driven inwards. 
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this happens especially in the bodies with damp bones, such as the heads of children.
