And the physician should place his palms strongly upon the vertebra until it returns (to place), or he should place a board over it, and then place his feet upon the board until it returns (to place).
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	But if it does not return by this method, then take a board whose width or length is about three cubits, and dig a place in the wall (which we have mentioned is near the patient) into which the end of the board can enter.
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	And then place half of the board over the vertebra, and the physician should place his feet on the other end, and press firmly until the vertebra is reduced and returns to its place.
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	And if you wish, use a windlass which is turned by hand; that is, you fix in the ground behind the patient's head two poles, the length of which should be one cubit, and likewise two poles behind his head [this seems repetitive, perhaps "feet"?]; and the distance between each pole should be a palm, and a hole should be made in each pole through which a rope runs, and each one should be firmly fixed in the ground so that it cannot be moved.
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	And let a round pole, on which the windlass is, be placed and turned in the two holes of the two poles.
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	And at its end there is a hole in which the pole is inserted, the length of which is a palm, along with the part that is turned; and in the other two poles there is a similar arrangement.
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	And then tighten the bandages that you have tied on the patient's feet in the hole which is behind his head, and the bandages that you have tied on his thighs in the hole which is behind his feet. [Or perhaps, "the windlass which is towards his feet."]
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	And then next to each windlass there should be an assistant who turns the windlass with his hand, and the physician straightens the spine as we have described.
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	And this is the form/shape of the windlass:
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	And then after the vertebra is returned, and the place is straightened, then it is necessary that you apply a drying plaster with egg white, and then tow; and then place on the plaster a splint of wood whose width is three fingers or about that, and its length should be enough to cover the area of the hump, and over the part of the protruding vertebra.
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	And then it should be bound with the bandage that we have described, and the patient should use/have a light diet until he is healed.
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	And if any swelling remains in the place at the end of the healing, then it is necessary that softening and cleansing medicines be administered with the application of the board for a long time, which we have recounted; and then a sheet of lead is applied to that place.
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes swelling occurs in the back of the dorsal vertebrae, and it is thought to be due to that dislocation; and it is that bone which is already prominent, so no attempt should be made to treat it with this medicine, for it will very easily cause death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 31.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the hip joint and the shoulder joint suffer only dislocation, and they do not experience what happens to other joints, namely slight displacement and concavity/subluxation.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the hip joint is dislocated in four ways, for it is dislocated inwards, or outwards, or forwards, or backwards.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And it is mostly dislocated inwards, and rarely forwards or backwards.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And a sign of its inward dislocation is that, when you compare the patient's healthy leg with the injured one, it is longer and the buttock is more prominent than the healthy one, and the patient cannot bend their foot towards the groin, and the place near the groin is swollen with a hot swelling, because the head of the femur has moved there. 
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of the one who has an outward dislocation is that their symptoms are opposite to this.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And a sign of the one who has a forward dislocation is that they can extend their leg fully, but they cannot bend it without pain in the buttock, and if they force themselves to walk, they cannot do so forwards; and their urine is retained and their groin is swollen, and next they walk on their heel.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And a sign of the one who has a backward dislocation is that they cannot extend the buttock, nor can they bend it forward without bending the groin, and their leg is shorter than the other, and the groin is soft, and the head of the femur is near that place.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of the types of this dislocation is that you consider, then, if the dislocation is old and longstanding, that it is already fixed by having it near; you administer its reduction and it remains according to its disposition, then it is not completely curable; and then no presumption should be made in that case.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in the one whose dislocation is recent, and it is one of the four types of dislocation, then you should strive to return the joint and extend it inwards and outwards, and move it to the right and left, for it returns very easily and does not need other treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But, if it does not return in this way, then you must prepare a strong assistant and extend their leg from the lower part, either with their hands or with a bandage which is tied on the leg above the buttock; and another assistant should extend their hand from above so that they place their hands under their armpits; and then tightly tie a linen bandage over the base of the thigh, and have another assistant hold the end of the bandage.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And let the extension be either from the inside of the groin towards the fork (perineum/pubis), or from the back towards the back.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And let the extension of all these be at once, until the patient is lifted with their body off the ground and remains hanging.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension is common to all four (types of dislocation).
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns with what we have said, it will be good; and if not, then for each type it is necessary to describe the specific treatment.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In the reduction of the hip itself, when it is dislocated, and the dislocation is towards the inside, it is necessary that the patient be lying on their healthy side; then place the bandages on the root of the thigh in that place which is between the head of the thigh and the place that is below the groin; then extend the bandage upwards from the groin to the highest part of the perineum/pubis.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And then another strong assistant should take his arms and grasp the thick part of the diseased thigh and extend outwards with strong extension, for it will return to its place.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this type, with which this limb is reduced, is of easier treatment than the other types.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if it is difficult for you and you cannot manage entry with this type of treatment at all, then it is necessary that the two feet of the patient be tied together with a strong, light bandage, above both ankles and both knees.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And the length of each of its parts should be the amount of four fingers, and let the diseased leg be extended more than the other by the amount of two fingers.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And then the patient should be suspended over the top of the wood, and it should be in the house; and his distance from the ground should be the amount of two arms' lengths. 
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And then order a strong youth to pull down on the top of the thigh, and another youth should be suspended with the patient, and the other youth pulling down on the thigh with strength should push, for the joint will return to its place quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in the proper reduction, when there is dislocation to the outside, it is necessary that the patient lie on his back according to what we have recounted in the chapter on humpback; and the bandage should be tightened on the diseased leg specifically and upon his feet.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And then two pieces of wood should be placed, one at his feet and the other at his head; and then fitted pieces of wood should be placed in the middle of the mound placed on which damp cloths are wrapped, so that the patient is not harmed by the wood being between his thighs, so that he should not be pulled by the extension downwards.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And then each assistant should extend their part, and the physician with his hand guides the reduction according to the art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	Therefore, if you obey by returning (the joint), it will be very good; and if not, put pressure on it diligently as we have described for humpback, in the same manner.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	But it is necessary that the patient lie quietly on his side.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in the forward parts, then it is necessary that the leg be extended slightly, and this is according to the same description, upon a mound; and the physician places the palm of his right hand over the diseased groin, and then presses it with the other hand, and with this pressure pushes it downwards toward the painful area.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is in the back parts, then it is not necessary for the patient to be lowered, and he is raised above the ground; he should be placed on a hard surface, just as the leveling is necessary if his hip is dislocated outwards, according to what we have said about his lying on two hips; and he is on his face and the ligaments are extended, according to what we have said, not long ago.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And compression must be administered with a board over the place where the joint protrudes.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	Then when the reduction is complete as it should be—and the sign of its reduction is not hidden from you, and that is that you extend the patient's two legs, and when you see them equal and the patient stretches his leg and spreads it without hesitation, then you know that the limb has returned as it should—and then you arrange two cushions and apply a plaster and bind it with a bandage so that the hip is not moved in any direction; and the patient should adhere to rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then untie the bandage and the plaster, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	Then, if you see them equal in appearance, then you know that the dislocation is already healed, and then let the patient go.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you see any cause for softening (inflammation/swelling), then you return and plaster it, and bind it according to your first binding, and leave it for three days. 
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then untie it, and have him delay walking on it for some days, until it is strengthened.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the treatment of dislocation of the knee.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The knee is dislocated in three ways, for it is dislocated outwards, and inwards, and downwards, and more to the back; and it is not dislocated forwards.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that when you command the patient to bring his leg up to his thigh, then you know that the knee is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration in all its forms is that you make the patient lie straight, so that he extends his leg, if he can; then you put your two hands on his face, and place his foot between your feet; and then make his knee adhere with your palms, and hold them with your fingers strongly upon his knee, and another assistant extends his foot until the knee returns to its place. 
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of its reduction is that his leg will then adhere to the thigh with easy, unimpeded movement. (literally: with non-laborious lightness)
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then apply a plaster to it and make the leg adhere to the thigh, and then bind them together with a bandage for three or four days, and then untie them.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And the patient should not walk for some days, until he is healed and strengthened.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if the reduction is difficult for you, then administer strong extension with the bindings, of which there was previous mention in the treatment of the hip.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of dislocation of the ankle/heel. ( _talo_ likely refers to the talus bone, hence ankle or heel)
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	The ankle/heel is sometimes moved slightly, and sometimes it is completely dislocated, and its dislocation occurs either inwards or outwards.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of its dislocation is that you see the ankle/heel swollen, protruding to the side to which it is dislocated.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the treatment of its slight movement is easy reduction, and it is that it be extended gently with the hands and adjusted until it returns (to its place).
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in its treatment when it is completely dislocated, it is necessary that you make the patient sit upright, and have a strong and capable assistant hold him from behind his back, in the middle of his back. 
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you take with your right hand the foot from the highest part/top, and with your left hand the lower part of the foot in the area of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then pull the foot towards you with your right hand, and then with your left twice, and then extend with your left; and push the toes of the foot with your right towards the leg without exertion/force.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do this twice, as we have described.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then push the toes of the foot towards the leg the third time, and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	Then return (the foot) once or twice in this manner, and if you see the foot straightened, it is good; and if not, then repeat the operation on it, for it will return (to normal).
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are prevented from reducing it with what we have recounted, then have the patient lie on their back on the ground, and firmly fix a very strong cloth to the ground, which should be placed between their thighs, and you have already wrapped cloth over them so that you do not hurt the patient.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And then have their assistant hold their thighs, and then have another assistant extend the foot with their hands or with a bandage tied above the ankle; and then let each assistant extend it against the other's pull, and let the cloth be stretched between the patient's thighs, holding it, so that their body is not pulled downwards during its extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And then the physician sets the dislocation with their hands, and another assistant holds the healthy thigh downwards, so that the dislocation returns easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And when the dislocation returns (to its proper place) and the success of its reduction is apparent to you, then apply a plaster and secure it tightly with bandages, and bind the foot to the leg.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And you should be wary of/take care with the tendons that are behind the heel, so that the bandaging on it is not too tight and does not injure it severely.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And then leave it like that for two or three days; and if the bandage loosens, tighten it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And then untie it on the third or fourth day, and forbid the patient from walking for forty days. 
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if he is forced to walk before that time, there is no guarantee that the dislocation will not become loose and disrupted again, and then it may not be curable.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if a hot abscess develops, then you must administer to soothe it that which we have described previously, in another place, regarding treatment and embrocation, until it is removed/reduced. 
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	On the treatment of dislocation of the toes.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It is necessary that the dislocated toe be straightened with little extension without force; and this is not difficult, rather it is easy.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in some of the bones of the back of the foot, then you must have the patient place their foot on a level spot on the ground or on a table, and stand as if they were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand near their foot and place your foot on the part beyond the affected joints, and press on it with your foot forcefully until it returns (to place), and you see that it is straightened and no protrusion appears at the location. 
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place a splint under the sole of their foot, covering the entire foot, which has two ends, and then tighten it with moderate and firm bandaging for three days; and then loosen it and let them rest from walking for many days, until it is strengthened and healing is assured. 
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Regarding the types of dislocation that are caused by a blow or by a fracture or by any of these together.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When you encounter any of these cases, and you exert yourself in its treatment and in the patient's recovery, death often occurs.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And therefore, no one should presume to treat it except someone who is wise in the art, with long experience, merciful and compassionate, cautious, not rash nor presumptuous; and who uses, in the beginning, medicines that only reduce hot swellings/inflammations, and leaves the patient to divine judgment, except for the one in whom you hope for salvation from destruction, with alleviation of the illness, and in which some hope appears.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And then strive to immediately perform the reduction at the beginning of the event, before a hot swelling/inflammation develops.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And then if the limb returns as we wish, then administer a regimen that reduces hot swelling/inflammation and treats the wound with appropriate drying ointments. 
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is with a fracture and you find separated bone fragments, then you must secure their union/setting, and do in this what we have said about simple maladies of this type that has been previously described in their places.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And watch out and avoid, according to your ability, entering into dangerous procedures as my preaching has forewarned you; for this is better for you before your Creator, and more permanent for your glory, and more salutary for your true purpose in your time.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus end the words of Albucasis perfectly, for which God be praised. 
Amen.	Amen.
